  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals

2022-03-21

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-18 , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-07üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-01üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1943-12-30, Islamic: 1443-08-17 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫08:20; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫30:24*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫21:29; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫15:52; ‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫08:20; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫19:23; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫30:24*; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (12.02¬∞ ‚Üí 11.22¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (39.41¬∞ ‚Üí 40.30¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (11.69¬∞ ‚Üí 12.44¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.55¬∞ ‚Üí 46.55¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (49.32¬∞ ‚Üí 49.56¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:26-12:27üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî08:29; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî21:25
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:26-07:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:26-10:56; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:27-13:57; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:27-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:57
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:26-07:14; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:14-08:02; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:38-10:26; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:02-12:51; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:27-15:15; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:51-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:50-05:38; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:14-01:38
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:56-09:26; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:56-12:27; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:57-15:27
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:38); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ú‡§Ø‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ-‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•¨‡•Ø, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•à‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Æ‡•à‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•®‡•©) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§ó‡§ú‡§™‡§§‡§ø‡§®-‡§≤‡§ñ‡•ç‡§®‡•å‡§§‡§ø-‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•≠‡•≠‡•≠, ‡§õ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§§‡§ø-‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§ú‡•Ä-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä #‡•©‡•Ø‡•©, ‡§≠‡§æ‡§≤‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§π‡§∞-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§≤‡§ñ‡§™‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡•á‡§£ ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É #‡•®‡•≠‡•¨, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•Å‡§µ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ã ‡§™‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§π‡§§‡§∂‡•ç ‡§ö #‡•©‡•©‡•©, ‡§∏‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§π‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á ‡§Ω‡•û‡•ç‡§ò‡§æ‡§®-‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•®‡•¨‡•™
‡§≠‡§æ‡§≤‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§π‡§∞-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as bhƒÅlachandra-mahƒÅga·πáapati·∏•. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

‡§ó‡§£‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§∂ ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡•§
‡§ï‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ö‡§Ø‡•á‡§∂‡§æ‡§® ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§¶‡•á‡§π‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•á‡••

‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§¶‡§æ ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•á ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•à ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§®‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§ó‡§£‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™‡§É‡•• (‡§≠‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç)

‡§õ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§§‡§ø-‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§ú‡•Ä-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä #‡•©‡•Ø‡•©

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-TrÃ•tƒ´yƒÅ tithi of PhƒÅlguna·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha). The event occurred in 4730 (Kali era).

  • Tags: MahapurushaEvents CommonFestivals
‡§ó‡§ú‡§™‡§§‡§ø‡§®-‡§≤‡§ñ‡•ç‡§®‡•å‡§§‡§ø-‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•≠‡•≠‡•≠

Event occured on 1245-03-21 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

The army of Gajapati Narasimhadeva-I, having slaughtered Karimuddin Laghri’s unit at Lakhnor, beseiged and won Lakhanuti.

Context: This was the second seige by the gajapati in 14 months. Narasinhadeva had attacked Lakhnauti for 1st time in around November 1243 and had to tactically retreat till Katashin/Contai in South Bengal in April 1244 before drawing out, ambushing and routing Mamluk forces under Tughan. Hindu chiefs of South Bengal were vassalized by Narasimhadeva and had helped him in his campaign.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ú‡§Ø‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ-‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•¨‡•Ø

Observed on SvƒÅtƒ´ nakshatra of Mƒ´na·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha). The event occurred in 5054 (Kali era).

jagadguru ≈õrƒ´~jayƒìndra sarasvatƒ´ was inducted into the kƒÅmak≈ç·π≠i-pƒ´·π≠ham on 22nd March 1954, vijaya year, mƒ´na/phƒÅlguna mƒÅsa krÃ•·π£·πáa dvitƒ´yƒÅ s≈çmavƒÅsara·∏• chitrƒÅ upari svƒÅtƒ´ nak·π£atram.

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•à‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Æ‡•à‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•®‡•©) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on SvƒÅtƒ´ nakshatra of Mƒ´na·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: NayanarGurupujai
‡§≤‡§ñ‡§™‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡•á‡§£ ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É #‡•®‡•≠‡•¨

Event occured on 1746-03-21 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

ChoTTa ghallUghAra massacre of sikhs began on 3 Jeth 1746 with the rounding up and massacre of Sikh inhabitants of Lahore. An estimated 7,000 Sikhs were massacred in total.

The operation was planned and executed by Lakhpat Rai, who was a Revenue Minister in the Court of Lahore to avenge the killing of his brother, Jaspat Rai, a military commander by the Sikhs earlier in the same year.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ã ‡§™‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§π‡§§‡§∂‡•ç ‡§ö #‡•©‡•©‡•©

Event occured on 1689-03-21 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

sambhAji mahArAj, aged 32, was brutally tortured and killed by awrangzeb at tulApur (where his grandfather shAhAjI had done the tulAgaja vidhi, donating an elephant‚Äôs weight in gold). While given to debauchery, sambhAjI shared his father’s vision of hindavI svarAjya (refer his letter to rAmasiMha of mevAr) and was well versed in sanskrit.

Per marATha accounts: Sambhaji was told that if he converted to Islam and spent his life as a servant of the emperor he could see life. Sambhaji made it clear that the Alamgir was the worst enemy of the country and the Padishaw was a real fool to follow a mentally ill person as his only prophet. Awrangzeb decided to execute him on hearing his reply. sambhAjI said he would sacrifice his life as an offering to the great mahAdeva. His tongue was cut out and fed to a dog. Then his eyes were gouged out and limbs cut. His heart was pulled out and finally the head was cut. Body parts which were left over from feeding dogs were then paraded through major cities in a procession.

Background: Sambhaji’s positions were spied upon by his own relations, the Shirke family, who had defected to the Mughals. Sambhaji and 25 of his advisors (including kavi kalash) were captured by the Mughal forces of Muqarrab Khan in a skirmish at Sangameshwar in February 1689. Earlier in his life he had escaped the clutches of Awrangzeb at Agra with his father shivAjI.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∏‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§π‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á ‡§Ω‡•û‡•ç‡§ò‡§æ‡§®-‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•®‡•¨‡•™

Event occured on 1758-03-21 (gregorian).

The Marathas under raghunAth rAv, Mughals under Adina Beg and the Dal Khalsa (Sikh confederation) under Jassa Singh Ahluwalia attacked and captured Sirhind from Afghans on March 21, 1758.

Context

The Marathas remembering the vision of Peshwa Baji Rao, 1720-1740, to establish Hindu Pad Padshahi (Hindu empire) and the lure of Punjab‚Äôs riches, made the first attack on Sirhind in December 1757. The Afghan governor, Abdus Samad managed to avoid battle with a tribute. Marathas returned in January 1758 with a large army under Raghunath Rao.

Aftermath

The city was thoroughly plundered which also led to bad blood between Sikhs and Marathas as the Sikhs garnered the lion‚Äôs share. The allies then marched to Lahore. The city was abandoned by the Afghans to the ‚ÄúIndian alliance‚Äù. The Afghan escapees were were waylaid at Wazirabad on the Chenab. While Taimur and Jahan Khan escaped across the river, the entire treasury which was still east of the river was captured by the victors. Large scale slaughter of Afghan troops took place. The prisoners were marched by the Sikhs to Amritsar to clean the Golden Temple sarovar where dead cows and excreta had been dumped earlier by Jehan Khan.

Surprisingly despite having an army of 2,00,000 and supported by Adina Beg and the Sikhs, the Marathas did not pursue the Afghans across the Indus to deal the coupe de grace. They were content to enforce ‚Äúchauth‚Äù (one forth of revenue) and ‚Äúsardeshmukhi‚Äù (one tenth of revenue for king/ governor). The frontiers of Punjab were left to be guarded by 15000 - 20000 troops in widely separated forts at Multan, Peshawar and Attock. There was no unified command. Bulk of the army under Raghunath Rao and his deputy Malhar Rao Holkar made its way back to Delhi and central India.

The Marathas gave the Adina the title of Nawab and made him the overlord of Lahore and Sirhind, virtually pacing entire Punjab under him for an annual payment of rupees seventy five lakhs. They abandoned the Sikhs to the now powerful Adina who began pursuing them with vengeance for past wrongs. The Sikhs in turn began guerrilla raids on the Marathas.

(Sources: TOI Article by an Army commander)

Details

  • Tags:
‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•Å‡§µ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on day 1 of Madhu·∏• (tropical) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Vernal equinox

  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-03-22

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-20 , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-08üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-02üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-01, Islamic: 1443-08-18 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫28:22*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫20:12; ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫13:06; ‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫17:23; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫28:22*; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (11.22¬∞ ‚Üí 10.40¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (12.44¬∞ ‚Üí 13.20¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (40.30¬∞ ‚Üí 41.20¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.55¬∞ ‚Üí 46.54¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (49.56¬∞ ‚Üí 49.80¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:26-12:26üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî09:18; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî22:24
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:26-07:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:26-10:56; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:26-13:56; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:57
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:26-07:14; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:14-08:02; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:38-10:26; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:02-12:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:26-15:14; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:51-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:50-05:38; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:14-01:38
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:57; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:26-10:56; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:26-13:56
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:14); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§∂‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ-‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É #‡•ß‡•©, ‡§∞‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä
‡§Æ‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§∂‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ-‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É #‡•ß‡•©

Event occured on 2009-03-22 (gregorian).

Major Mohit Sharma, SM (who’d earlier, in the guise of angry young Kashmiri Iftikaar Bhatt had infiltrated Hizbul Mujahideen, dramatically killed jihAdi commanders Abu Sabjar and Abu Torara and escaped), was leading Bravo Assault Team in operations in Kupwara District of North Kashmir. … terrorists fired from three directions indiscriminately. In the heavy exchange of fire, four commandos were wounded immediately. With complete disregard to his safety, he crawled and recovered two soldiers to safety. Unmindful of the overwhelming fire, he threw grenades and killed two terrorists but was shot in the chest. In the brief respite that followed, he kept directing his commandos, in spite of serious injuries. Sensing further danger to his comrades, he charged in a daring close quarter combat killing two more terrorists. His last words to his 2nd in command was, “Make sure not one escapes the net.”

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∞‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Pa√±camƒ´ tithi of PhƒÅlguna·∏• (lunar) month (Prad≈ç·π£a·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: LessCommonFestivals

2022-03-23

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-21 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-09üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-03üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-02, Islamic: 1443-08-19 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‚ñ∫26:16*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫

  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚ñ∫10:17; ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫15:19; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫26:16*; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (10.40¬∞ ‚Üí 9.55¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (49.80¬∞ ‚Üí 50.04¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (41.20¬∞ ‚Üí 42.09¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.54¬∞ ‚Üí 46.52¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (13.20¬∞ ‚Üí 13.95¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:25-12:26üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî10:11; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî23:25
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:25-07:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:25-10:56; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:26-13:56; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:25-07:13; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:13-08:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:37-10:26; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:02-12:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:26-15:14; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:51-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:49-05:37; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:14-01:37
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:26-13:56; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî07:55-09:25; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:56-12:26
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:50); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•ß‡•Ø, ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É, ‡§≠‡§ó‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•Ø‡•ß
‡§≠‡§ó‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•Ø‡•ß

Event occured on 1931-03-23 (gregorian).

Bhagat Singh, Shivaram Rajguru, and Sukhdev Thapar were executed by the British on this day.

Context

The trio was found guilty of killing deputy police superintendent JP Saunders in 1928, to avenge the death of Lala Lajpat Rai.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É

When an≈´rƒÅdhƒÅ nakshatra falls on a Wednesday, it is a special y≈çga·∏• for performing dƒÅnam. One can do dƒÅna·πÅ of dadhy≈çdanam in Vishnu temples on this day. When Rohini nakshatra falls on a Saturday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays
‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•ß‡•Ø

Event occured on 2003-03-23 (gregorian).

On this day, jihAdis dressed as army men murdered lined up 11 men, 11 women, and two small boys (belonging to kAshmIri paNDit community) and shot them.

Events

Armed jihAdis came dressed in counterfeit military uniforms at around midnight, lined up 11 men, 11 women, and two small boys (belonging to kAshmIri paNDit community) and shot them. The victims ranged from a 65-year-old man to a 2-year-old boy. The killers allegedly disfigured the bodies of the victims, looted their houses and took away the ornaments from bodies of the dead women.

Context

In 1990, 300,000 to 600,000 Kashmiri Hindus left Kashmir after being selectively targeted by the Islamic militants.

Aftermath

The terror stricken few remaining Hindus decided to leave the area. Three Lashkar-e-Taiba (“Army of the Pure”) militants suspected to be responsible for this massacre were gunned down by Mumbai police on 29 March.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-03-24

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-22 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-10üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-04üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-03, Islamic: 1443-08-20 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫24:10*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫17:28; ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫07:25; ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫28:34*; ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫13:13; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫24:10*; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (9.55¬∞ ‚Üí 8.68¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (50.04¬∞ ‚Üí 50.28¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.52¬∞ ‚Üí 46.50¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (13.95¬∞ ‚Üí 14.70¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (42.09¬∞ ‚Üí 42.98¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:24-12:26üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî11:08; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî00:26*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:24-07:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:25-10:55; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:26-13:56; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:24-07:13; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:13-08:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:37-10:25; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:02-12:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:26-15:14; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:51-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:49-05:37; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:14-01:37
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:56-15:26; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî06:24-07:55; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:25-10:55
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ (‚ñ∫14:26); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§§‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§É, ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§É

Shannavati Shraddham Day.

‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on every occurrence of Vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏• yoga (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti).

Vyatipata Shraddha day.

2022-03-25

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-23 , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-11üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-05üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-04, Islamic: 1443-08-21 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§

  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫22:04; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§®‡§µ‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫16:06; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫25:43*; ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ò‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫11:07; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫22:04; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (8.68¬∞ ‚Üí 7.80¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (14.70¬∞ ‚Üí 15.46¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.50¬∞ ‚Üí 46.47¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (50.28¬∞ ‚Üí 50.52¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (42.98¬∞ ‚Üí 43.87¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:24-12:25üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî12:08; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî01:25*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:24-07:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:24-10:55; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:25-13:56; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:24-07:12; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:12-08:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:37-10:25; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:01-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:26-15:14; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:48-05:36; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:13-01:37
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:55-12:25; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:57; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:54-09:24
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:13); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ó‡§£‡•á‡§∂-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•Ø‡•ß, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä), ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§µ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§π‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•Å‡§ï‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É #‡•´‡•ß
‡§ó‡§£‡•á‡§∂-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•Ø‡•ß

Event occured on 1931-03-25 (gregorian).

gaNesh shankar vidyArthI, a Hindu kAyastha journalist and nationalist, was killed on this day by a Muslim mob in kAnpur. For 4 days his mutiliated dead-body was lying on a pile of garbage. He had gone to a Muslim majority area of Kanpur to appeal for harmony - and rescue trapped Hindus.

Context

Ganesh Shankar Vidyarthi (26 October 1890 ‚Äì 25 March 1931) was a journalist, an Indian National Congress leader, and a friend of Bhagat Singh and Chandrashekhar Azad. He participated in the non-cooperation movement. He had translated Victor Hugo’s novel Ninety-Three, and was the founder-editor of the Hindi language newspaper, Pratap. Due to his activism, he had to face numerous prosecutions, pay heavy fines and suffer five prison sentences.

In the 1920s, hindu-muslim conflicts spread in western UP. shuddhi movement had grown popular. Even secularist congressmen asserted their defiance against Islamist mobs. For example, in February 1927, Vidyarthi and other Congress leaders had organized a demonstration to the Moolganj mosque and played music for forty minutes - in retaliation to a Muslim mob attacking a musical band accompanying a Hindu marriage procession.

In 1931, Hindu-Muslim riots took place in Kanpur. Ganesh, recently (9 March 1931) released from jail under the Gandhi‚ÄìIrwin Pact, was to leave to the Karachi Congress Session, but stayed back. Eyewitnesses note him to have rescued members of both communities; his daughter claimed in an interview that Vidyarthi was murdered while trying to rescue a group of trapped Hindus.

Aftermath

Congress came out with a report on riots a month or so later- the document is a stellar template of secular whitewashing, and MK Gandhi declared: “His blood is the cement that will ultimately bind the two communities. No pact will bind our hearts. But heroism such as Ganesh Shankar Vidyarthi showed is bound in the end to melt the stoniest hearts, melt them into one.”

Ganesh Shankar Vidyarthi Puraskar has been given to renowned journalists by honourable President of India every year from 1989. Sevveral public places and institutions are named after him. On 18 July 2017, UP Government renamed Kanpur airport after him.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§µ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§π‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•Å‡§ï‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É #‡•´‡•ß

Event occured on 1971-03-25 (gregorian).

Operation Searchlight, specially targetting Bengali Hindus and nationalists, began on this day. It marked the beginning of the genocide in bangladesh as well as the Bangla war of liberation. Members of the Pakistani military and supporting Islamist militias from Jamaat-e-Islami (lit. Collective of Islamists) killed up to 3 million people, raped between 200k and 400k Bengali women. A further eight to ten million people, mostly Hindus, fled to India.

Of course, the operation failed and backfired, as India under Indira Gandhi intervened and utterly defeated the Islamic republic’s military.

Contemporary report by Ted Kennedy: “Hardest hit have been members of the Hindu community who have been robbed of their lands and shops, systematically slaughtered, and in some places, painted with yellow patches marked H. All of this has been officially sanctioned, ordered and implemented under martial law from Islamabad”.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä)

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of PhƒÅlguna·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: ShannavatiTarpanaDays

2022-03-26

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-24 , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-12üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-06üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-05, Islamic: 1443-08-22 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§®‡§µ‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫20:02; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫14:46; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ò‡§É‚ñ∫22:55; ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫09:02; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫20:02; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (7.80¬∞ ‚Üí 6.88¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (15.46¬∞ ‚Üí 16.21¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.47¬∞ ‚Üí 46.43¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (50.52¬∞ ‚Üí 50.75¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (43.87¬∞ ‚Üí 44.77¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:23-12:25üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî13:09; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî02:21*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:23-07:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:24-10:55; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:25-13:55; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:23-07:11; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:11-08:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:36-10:24; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:01-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:26-15:14; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:48-05:35; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:13-01:36
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:24-10:55; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî13:55-15:26; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî06:23-07:54
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:36); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ñ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•™‡•Ø‡•´, ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®-‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•©‡•´‡•¶, ‡§π‡•ã‡§≤‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§∞-‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ #‡•©‡•®‡•Ø
‡§π‡•ã‡§≤‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§∞-‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ #‡•©‡•®‡•Ø

Event occured on 1693-03-26 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On this day was born the great general Malhar Rao Holkar, who served under peshva-s ranging from bAjI rAv to mAdhav rAv.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§ñ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•™‡•Ø‡•´

Event occured on 1527-03-26 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

The mogol king bAbUr defeated rAjaputras under rANA sangrAmasiMha of mevAr. Sanga’s army greatly outnumbered Babur’s forces. bAbur prepared excellent defence with chained carts and muskets. In the midst, Silhadi of Raisen desterted rANa’s side and joined bAbur. Rana was shot by a bullet and fell unconscious, causing great confusion in the Rajput army. The replacement was a poor commander. The Mogols won due to superior tactics and weapons. Rana Sanga managed to evade capture and escape to Chittor, where he was poisoned to death by 30 January 1528.

Background: Rajput ruler of Mewar, Rana Sanga, sent an ambassador to Babur at Kabul, offering to join in Babur’s attack on the Sultan. Sanga offered to attack Agra, while Babur would attack the Lodhis at Delhi. But he changed his mind after realizing that bAbur, unlike taimUr, intended to stay in India. Rana Sanga had built a formidable military alliance against Babur. He was joined by virtually all the leading Rajput kings from Rajasthan. Some Lodi afghAns also joined.

Babur denounced the Afghans who joined the alliance against him as kafirs and murtads (apostates from Islam). Babur proceeded to renounce future consumption of wine, broke his drinking cups, poured out all the stores of liquor on the ground and promulgated a pledge of total abstinence. bAbur wrote: “It was a really good plan, and it had a favourable propagandistic effect on friend and foe.”

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®-‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç

Shannavati Shraddham Day.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: ShannavatiTarpanaDays
‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•©‡•´‡•¶

Event occured on 1672-03-26 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

Though their revolt seems to have been sparked off by a relatively insignificant incident, Aurangzeb’s persecution of the Hindus was certainly the underlying cause which turned it into a religious uprising. The soldier hit the cultivator with a stick which broke his head, whereupon a body of Satnamis beat the assailant to death. When the news reached the local government administrator, he sent a party of footmen to arrest those men. By then a large number of Satnamis had gathered at the scene. They attacked the footmen, put them to flight and seized their arms. The number of rebels was increasing by the hour. The faujdar of Narnol sent a large body of horsemen and foot soldiers to punish the rebels. But they too were routed by the Satnamis. The movement now spread like wild fire and the number of rebels rose to some five thousand. The Satnamis defeated the faujdar of Narnol, captured the town, demolished a number of mosques and tombs and established their own administration. A belief spread among them that they were immortal and that if one of them was slain, seventy others would spring up in his place! At last, on 16th March 1672, Aurangzeb sent a force of 10,000 horsemen, supported by artillery, under command of Rad-andaz Khan to crush the revolt.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-03-27

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-25 , ‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-13üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-07üåûü™ê , ‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-06, Islamic: 1443-08-23 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫18:04; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫13:30; ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫20:12; ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫07:02; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫18:04; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫29:08*; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (6.88¬∞ ‚Üí 5.95¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.43¬∞ ‚Üí 46.39¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (44.77¬∞ ‚Üí 45.66¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (16.21¬∞ ‚Üí 16.96¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (50.75¬∞ ‚Üí 50.99¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:22-12:25üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî14:09; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî03:13*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:22-07:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:24-10:54; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:25-13:55; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:22-07:11; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:11-07:59; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:36-10:24; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:01-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:25-15:14; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:47-05:35; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:13-01:36
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî16:56-18:27; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî12:25-13:55; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:56
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:12); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡•ß‡•®, ‡§∞‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä-‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞-‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§É #‡•´‡•ß, ‡§π‡•ã‡§≤‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§∞‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§É #‡•®‡•´‡•¨
‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡•ß‡•®

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-ƒíkƒÅda≈õƒ´ tithi of PhƒÅlguna·∏• (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

‡§π‡•ã‡§≤‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§∞‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§É #‡•®‡•´‡•¨

Event occured on 1766-03-27 (gregorian).

malharrAv holkar dies

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∞‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä-‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞-‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§É #‡•´‡•ß

Event occured on 1971-03-27 (gregorian).

Twenty days after Mujib‚Äôs speech at the Ramna Race Course, the Pakistan army attacked the temple and massacred all the Hindus there and in the vicinity of the temple. The Pakistani army had doused the temple with petrol and gunpowder and set it on fire. The priest of the Ramna Kali temple along with over hundred people and fifty cows were killed in the temple, and over another hundred were massacred in the adjacent Maa Anandamayi Ashram and the nearby houses. Dr. John E. Rohde from the United States Agency for International Development visited the area on 29 March. He had witnessed charred corpses of men, women and children who had been killed and burned.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-03-28

  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫

  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§É‚ñ∫17:36; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:22-12:24üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî15:08; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî04:01*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:22-07:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:23-10:54; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:24-13:55; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:22-07:10; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:10-07:58; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:35-10:23; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:00-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:25-15:14; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27

  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:52-09:23; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:54-12:24; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:55-15:26
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:35); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§™‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§°‡•à‡§Ø‡§æ‡§±‡•ç‡§±‡§ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§±‡•à‡§µ‡•Å, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡§æ‡§™‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ö‡§®‡•Ä-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä, ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§£‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
‡§ï‡§™‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§°‡•à‡§Ø‡§æ‡§±‡•ç‡§±‡§ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§±‡•à‡§µ‡•Å

‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§£‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
  • ‚Üí12:23

When Shravana nakshatra falls on a Monday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. When Rohini nakshatra falls on a Saturday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡§æ‡§™‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ö‡§®‡•Ä-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä

The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of phƒÅlguna month is known as pƒÅpam≈çchanƒ´-ƒìkƒÅda≈õƒ´.

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§ö ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§É‡•§
‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•Å‡§≠‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡§™‡§ø‡••

‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ï‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§∂‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§≠‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡••
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡§•‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§∞‡•á ‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡§µ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡•§
‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö ‡§µ‡•à ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡•ã ‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§§‡§É‡••
–‡§™‡§¶‡•ç‡§Æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á

‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on every occurrence of ≈örava·πáa·∏• nakshatra (SƒÅ·πÖgava·∏•/puurvaviddha).

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialVratam

2022-03-29

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-27 , ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-15üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-09üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-08, Islamic: 1443-08-25 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫14:38; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫11:27; ‡§∂‡§§‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡§ï‡•ç‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫15:10; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫14:38; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫25:56*; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (5.00¬∞ ‚Üí 4.02¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.34¬∞ ‚Üí 46.29¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (46.55¬∞ ‚Üí 47.45¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (51.23¬∞ ‚Üí 51.46¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (17.71¬∞ ‚Üí 18.47¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:21-12:24üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî16:04; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî04:46*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:21-07:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:23-10:53; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:24-13:55; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:21-07:09; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:09-07:58; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:35-10:23; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:00-12:48; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:25-15:14; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:46-05:33; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:12-01:35
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:56; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:23-10:53; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:24-13:55
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:11); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
  • 18:27‚Üí19:56

Pradosha Vratam. Fast during the day and perform ≈õivap≈´jƒÅ in Pradosha Kala.

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑‡•á ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§æ‡§É‡•§
‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§∂‡§§‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡§ø‡••

2022-03-30

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-28 , ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É-‡§∂‡§§‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡§ï‡•çüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-16üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-10üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-09, Islamic: 1443-08-26 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫13:19; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§§‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡§ï‡•ç‚ñ∫10:47; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§É‚ñ∫12:58; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫13:19; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫24:48*; ‡§∂‡§ï‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (4.02¬∞ ‚Üí 3.03¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (18.47¬∞ ‚Üí 19.22¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.29¬∞ ‚Üí 46.23¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (47.45¬∞ ‚Üí 48.34¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (51.46¬∞ ‚Üí 51.69¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:20-12:24üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî16:58; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:28*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:20-07:51; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:22-10:53; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:24-13:55; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:26-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:20-07:09; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:09-07:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:34-10:23; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî12:00-12:48; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:25-15:13; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:45-05:33; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:12-01:35
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:24-13:55; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî07:51-09:22; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:53-12:24
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:48); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§¶‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§°‡§ø‡§ó‡§≥‡•ç ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•©‡•¶) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä), ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É, ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡•Ä-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É
‡§¶‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§°‡§ø‡§ó‡§≥‡•ç ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•©‡•¶) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on ≈öatabhi·π£ak nakshatra of Mƒ´na·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Tags: NayanarGurupujai
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Caturda≈õƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (Ni≈õƒ´tha·∏•/paraviddha).

  • ‚Üí21:16

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 360, it is sƒÅyana-vaidhrÃ•ti·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡•Ä-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä

Phalguna Krishna Trayodashi, combined with Shatabhishak Nakshatram.

‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡•á‡§® ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•å ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§æ ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‡•§
‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§§ ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§∂‡§§‡•à‡§É ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡•• (‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•å ‡§™‡•É ‡•¨‡•Ø)

2022-03-31

‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É-12-29 , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ-12-17üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-11üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-10, Islamic: 1443-08-27 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É üåõ- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, üååüåû- ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É, ü™êüåû- ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üååüåû- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1943, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2078, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5122
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ü™êüåû - ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫12:22; ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫10:29; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫19:10; ‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫11:05; ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ï‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫12:22; ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‚ñ∫24:04*; ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (3.03¬∞ ‚Üí 2.01¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.23¬∞ ‚Üí 46.17¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (48.34¬∞ ‚Üí 49.24¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (51.69¬∞ ‚Üí 51.93¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (19.22¬∞ ‚Üí 19.97¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:20-12:23üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî17:50; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:09*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:20-07:51; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:22-10:53; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:23-13:54; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:25-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:20-07:08; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:08-07:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:34-10:22; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:59-12:48; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:25-15:13; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:45-05:32; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:12-01:34
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:54-15:25; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî06:20-07:51; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:22-10:53
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ (‚ñ∫14:25); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§§‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•¨‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡•Å‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§® ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•©‡•®, ‡§ñ‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø-‡§¨‡§ñ‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞-‡§∏‡•à‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§É #‡•Æ‡•ß‡•¨, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ), ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É-‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§É, ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§É-(‡§∞‡•à‡§µ‡§§‡§É-[‡•´]), ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äì‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§≤‡§æ)
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•¨‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡•Å‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§® ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•©‡•®

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of PhƒÅlguna·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 4991 (Kali era).

Preceptor MahƒÅdevendra adorned the Pƒ´·π≠ha for thirty-nine years and attaind Siddhi on the new moon day in the month of PhƒÅlgu·πáa of the year Virodhi. This preceptor‚Äôs name before initiation was MahƒÅli·πÖgam. His parents were well-known as Lak·π£mƒ´ and ≈öe·π£ƒÅdri. His place of siddhi was a village called IlayƒÅtta·πÖgu·∏çi. ≈öalivahana era 1813.

‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡§ó‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ú‡§É‡•§
‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡§É ‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§¨‡•Å‡§≤‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡••‡•ß‡•¨‡••
‡§â‡§™‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§ó‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•á ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•à‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§ó‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•ß‡•≠‡••
‡§™‡•Ä‡§†‡•á ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§µ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§µ‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§ß‡§ø‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡•à‡§µ‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡••‡•ß‡•Æ‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•ç

Details
  • References
    • Punya Shloka Manjari
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: KanchiAradhanaDays
‡§ñ‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø-‡§¨‡§ñ‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞-‡§∏‡•à‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§É #‡•Æ‡•ß‡•¨

Event occured on 1206-03-31 (gregorian).

On this day, forces of the Assamese khen dynasty kAmarUpa king vishvasundara-deva aka pRthu utterly destroyed the army of the evil marauder Ikhtiy√°rud d√≠n Muhammad Bakht√≠y√°r Khilj√≠.

Kanaibadasibana or KƒÅnƒÅi Bara≈õi BowƒÅ Rock Inscription of North Guwahati proclaims:

‚Äú≈õƒÅke turaga-yugme≈õe
madhu-mƒÅsa-trayoda≈õe
kƒÅmarupa·πÅ samƒÅgatya
turu·π£kƒÅ·∏• k·π£ayamƒÅyayu·∏•‚Äù

Context

Having utterly destroyed the world reknowned universities of nAlanda and vikramashIla (where the libraries are said to have burnt for days) besides massacring all ≈örama·πáas and BrƒÅhma·πáas during his 1200 invasion, having razed navadvIpa in his 1203/04 invasion of sena-ruled vanga, bakhtIyAr was seized by the ambition of seizing Tibet (likely attracted by plunder, trade routes and horses - a valuable military resource).

Led on by a Mech convert named Ali, he with about 10k horses proceeded to cross a bridge in kAmarUpa. The kAmarUpa king sent him a message warning him about it being the wrong season (winter snow?) for attack and suggested that he wait till new year so the he would join in. But bakhtIyAr hurried on, leaving behind a few troops. After 15 days, he reached Tibet. There he began looting. Angry Tibetans inflicted heavy losses on bakhtIyAr. Further he feared arrival of a massive army. So he began retreating.

The inhabitants of the valleys and passes had all removed far away from the road, and for a space of fifteen days, not a sir of food nor a blade of grass or fodder was to be found, and they were compelled to kill and eat their horses.

Rout in kAmarUpa

By the time he got back to the bridge, he found it destroyed and the guard gone. He holed up in a temple. The kAmarUpa king pRthu ordered his troops to block their way out. Still, Bakht√≠y√°r and forces escaped to the river bank, pursued by the kAmarUpa troops. They tried to ford the river in desperation. Almost everyone died. Out of 10k when they set out, about 100 made it accross.

Aftermath

Bakhtiyar fell into depression. Like his Delhi sultAn, he was soon murdered with a knife. kAmarUpa king pRthu continued to rule till 1228, when he died fighting Iltutmish‚Äôs son Nasiruddin.

  • Tags:
‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§É-(‡§∞‡•à‡§µ‡§§‡§É-[‡•´])

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of PhƒÅlguna·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti).

  • References
    • VaidyanƒÅtha-Dƒ´k·π£itƒ´yam
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: ManvadiDays
‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç

pƒÅrva·πáavratam on the eve of dar≈õa-sthƒÅlƒ´pƒÅka·∏•.

‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§æ ‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É, ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§Ω‡§≠‡§ø‡§Ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö - ‘‡§Ö‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£ ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•å‡§™‡§µ‡§∏‡§•‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•Ä ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç ‡§è‡§®‡§Ø‡•ã‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç- ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∂‡§≤‡•á‡§®’‡•§

‘‡§Ö‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§ß ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§Ø‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§§‡•å ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§ú‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§®‡•ç-‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡§∞‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§á‡§§‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∏-‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á‡§®‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§ ‡§ú‡•Å‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∏‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§’

‡§™‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç ‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É‡•§

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡§ø ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

“‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§â‡§¶‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Ø‡•á‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ” ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å‡•§

  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§™‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É-‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§É

Pinda Pitru Yajnam is a ≈õrƒÅddham to be done to two sets of Pitru Devatas. It is to be done in one’s Agnihotra Agni or if that is not present then Aupasana Agni. Rice is cooked in a section of the Agni moved to the south-east. From this, even those whose father is living, give ƒÅhuti to the Deva Pitru-s ie s≈çma, yama and agni kavyavƒÅhana. Those whose father is not living should additionally give pi·πá·∏ças to the Manushya Pitru-s also to whom amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ-≈õrƒÅddham is also performed.

  • Tags: ShraddhaDays
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äì‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§≤‡§æ)

amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ of phƒÅlguna month.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: AmavasyaDays

It is said in the Smrtis, that if Amavaysa falls on a Monday, Tuesday or Thursday, such a tithi is given the appellation pu·π£kalƒÅ and is as sacred as a solar eclipse.

‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡•á—
‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á‡§® ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡•á‡§® ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø‡•§
‡§∏‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§≤‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡••

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-11, Islamic: 1443-08-28 Sha øbƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§™‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ö‡•á‡§§, ‡§Ö- ‡§ö‚Äô‡§§

  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫11:54; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫10:38; ‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§´‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫09:33; ‡§á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‚ñ∫11:54; ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫23:52; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (2.01¬∞ ‚Üí 0.98¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (46.17¬∞ ‚Üí 46.10¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (49.24¬∞ ‚Üí 50.13¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (51.93¬∞ ‚Üí 52.16¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (19.97¬∞ ‚Üí 20.73¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:19-12:23üåûÔ∏è-18:27üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî18:41; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî—
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:19-07:50; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:21-10:52; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:23-13:54; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:25-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:27-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:19-07:08; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:08-07:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:33-10:22; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:59-12:47; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:25-15:13; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:39-18:27
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:44-05:32; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:12-01:34
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:52-12:23; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî15:25-16:56; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:50-09:21
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:10); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•ß‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•¨‡•Ø‡•©, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•®‡•≠ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•™‡•™‡•´, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•´‡•® ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•¨‡•¶‡•´, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂-‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§É, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É, ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§™‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§-‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§É
‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
  • 10:38‚Üí

When Revati nakshatra falls on a Friday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. When Rohini nakshatra falls on a Saturday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays
‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyFestivals
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•ß‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•¨‡•Ø‡•©

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of Caitra·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3430 (Kali era).

Ga·πÖgƒÅdharagƒ´·π£pati·∏•, known as Subhadra, son of KƒÅ√±ci Bhadragiri, got initiated in the twelfth year of age by ≈örƒ´ VidyƒÅghana whom He had served became a realised soul when He as twenty-four years old and reached the eternal abode of ≈örƒ´vidyƒÅ and ≈örƒ´ ≈öiva. He, the Omnipotent, omniscient and pure reached the eternal abode by his glory on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of Caitra of the year Sarvadhari.

‡§∏‡•Ç‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡§ø‡§∞‡•á‡§É ‡§∏‡•Å‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø(‡§ï‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø?)‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•á
‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§®‡•Å‡§ö‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞‡§ó‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡§ø‡§É ‡§∏ ‡§ö ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡•á ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡•á‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§®‡•ã‡§§‡•ç ‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•©‡•¶‡••
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡§ø ‡§∏ ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡§ß‡§ø‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡•Å‡§®‡•á‡•§
‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡•Å‡§®‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∂‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§¶‡§ø‡§Æ‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡•á‡§Ω‡§®‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§∏‡§æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§π‡••‡•©‡•ß‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•®‡•≠ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•™‡•™‡•´

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of Caitra·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3678 (Kali era).

Then the preceptor CidvilƒÅsa, who was Harike≈õava (before initiation), son of Madhus≈´danƒÅrya of Hasti≈õaila (KƒÅ√±ci) attained his immortal state on the first day of the ≈öarat ·πõ·π≠u in the year Durmukhi. The above two impeccable pontiffs Praj√±ƒÅghana and CidvilƒÅsa attained siddhi in KƒÅ√±ci itself. His (CidvilƒÅsa) duration of preceptorship was thirteen years.

‡§Ö‡§• ‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∂‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§∏‡•Ç‡§¶‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ú‡•ã ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡§µ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡§É‡•§
‡§Ö‡§ó‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§ñ‡§ø‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡§É ‡§∏ ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡§ø‡§® ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§Æ‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡•á‡••‡•´‡•¨‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä
