‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§É #‡•ß‡•≠‡•™

Event occured on 1848-04-18 (gregorian).

Mulraj Chopra, the khatri divAn at multAn loyal to raNajIt singh and family, rebelled against the British on this day.

The revolt was started by a soldier from mUlarAja’s family attacking and wounding two British officers who’d come to take over.

The poet Hakim Chand recites: Then the mother of Mulraj spoke to him reminding him of the Sikh Gurus and martyrs: ‘I will kill myself leaving a curse on your head. Either lead your men to death or get out of my sight; (and) I shall undertake the Khalsa army and go to the battle …’. She tied a bracelet on his wrist and sent him to the battle. Next morning, the mob hacked the two British officers to death. Mulraj presented Vans Agnew’s head to Vitesh Sharma and told him to take it back to Currie at Lahore.

Aftermath: The British chief Currie sent a big detachment of the khalsa under Sher Singh Attariwalla to help the Bengal army in beseiging Multan. However, Sher Singh rebelled as well on Sep 14! However, Sher Singh moved away to fight separately. Mulraj was however defeated by 22nd January. This freed up more artillery for the Birish to use during the decisive Battle of Gujarat.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç-‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§É #‡•ß‡•´‡•©‡•≠

Event occured on 0485-04-18 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

The yavana polytheist sage died in Athens on this date in 485 CE. Proclus died aged 73, and was buried near Mount Lycabettus in a tomb. It is reported that he was writing 700 lines each day.

He had a great devotion to the goddess Athena, who he believed guided him at key moments in his life. Marinus reports that when Christians removed the statue of the goddess from the Parthenon, a beautiful woman appeared to Proclus in a dream and announced that the “Athenian Lady” wished to stay at his home.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•á‡§® ‡§π‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡•Ä‡§∞‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ #‡•©‡•™‡•Æ

Event occured on 1674-04-18 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

Chhatrapati Shivaji inspected his army at Chiplun. A new commander-in-chief had been identified. His name was Hansaji Mohite. But that day Shivaji titled him Sarnobat (Chief of Army) Hambirrao & history will remember him by that name: Hambirrao father of Tara Bai

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ-‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•Ä ‡§π‡§§‡§É #‡•ß‡•¨‡•©

Event occured on 1859-04-18 (gregorian).

Ramachandra Panduranga Yawalkar, Aka Tantia Tope, general of the last peshvA nAnA saheb, victor of many battles, killed by the British after being surrendered to them by mAn singh.

2022-04-19

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É-01-18 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-01-06üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É-01-30üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-29, Islamic: 1443-09-17 Rama·∏çƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ü‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§ñ, ‡§Ö- ‡§¨‚Äô‡§π‡§æ‡§ó
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫16:39; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫25:37*; ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫16:59; ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫16:39; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫27:15*; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-16.32¬∞ ‚Üí -17.05¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (44.33¬∞ ‚Üí 44.19¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (56.00¬∞ ‚Üí 56.22¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (33.54¬∞ ‚Üí 34.29¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (65.44¬∞ ‚Üí 66.34¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:08-12:18üåûÔ∏è-18:29üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî08:03; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî21:15
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:08-07:41; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:46; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:51; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:29-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:08-06:57; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:57-07:47; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:26-10:15; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:54-12:43; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:22-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:29
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:35-05:21; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:08-01:28
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:56; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:46; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:51
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:04); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ö‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§ü-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§π‡§∞-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ-‡§Ö‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä
‡§Ö‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§ü-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§π‡§∞-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as vika·π≠a-mahƒÅga·πáapati·∏•. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyVratam SankataharaChaturthiVratam

When caturthI occurs on a Tuesday, it is known as aGgArakI and is even more sacred.

‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ-‡§Ö‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä

chaturthƒ´ tithi on a Tuesday is as sacred as a solar eclipse. When it occurs in ≈õuklapak·π£a, it is called sukhƒÅ. Good day for doing puja of Ganesha/Subrahmanya with naivedyam of modakam/millet flour respectively.

‡§∏‡•Å‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö—
‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§µ‡§π‡§æ ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ ‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•ß‡•ß‡••
‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∂‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ç‡§≤ ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§æ‡•§
‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§§‡§•‡§æ‡••‡•ß‡•®‡••
‡§∏‡•Å‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ï‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ß‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§π ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§µ‡§π‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§™‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§´‡§≤‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•ß‡•©‡••
‡§π‡§∏‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§≤‡§≤‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§µ‡§π‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§∏‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ‡§∏‡§≠‡•Å‡§ú‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•ß‡•™‡••
‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤‡•ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§π‡•§
‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§® ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡•á ‡§ö‡•á‡§∂‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§∂‡•á ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§É ‡§∏‡•Å‡§§‡•á‡••‡•ß‡•´‡••
‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ã ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§µ‡•à ‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§§‡§¶‡§æ ‡§∏‡§æ ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§¶‡§æ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä ‡§µ‡•à ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡•á‡§§‡§ø ‡§ö‡••‡•ß‡•¨‡••
‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•à‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§π‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ö‡§≤‡•á‡•§
‡§≠‡•Ä‡§Æ‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¨‡§æ‡§π‡•ã ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§¨‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•Å‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§É ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡•å‡••‡•ß‡•≠‡••
‡§Æ‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∏ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡•á‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§®‡§Ø‡§æ‡•§
‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡•ã‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É ‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ú‡•ã ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ã ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡§µ‡§É‡••‡•ß‡•Æ‡••
‡§Æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§§‡•ã ‡§Ø‡§•‡•ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ã ‡§π‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ö‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§¶‡•ã‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•ã‡§™‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§Ö‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã ‡§®‡•É‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•ß‡•Ø‡••
‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§ï‡§∞‡•ã ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§µ‡•à ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡••‡•®‡•¶‡••
‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§®‡§æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§∏‡§æ‡•§
‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§Ø‡•á‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ú‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡•á‡§™‡§®‡•à‡§É‡••‡•®‡•ß‡••
‡§ó‡§£‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∞‡•ç‡§ö‡§Ø‡•á‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•®‡•®‡••
‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§•‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§ø‡•§
‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§‡••‡•®‡•©‡••
‡§á‡§π ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•á‡§®‡•ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§∞‡§§‡§æ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§≤‡•§
‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á ‡§¶‡§π ‡§™‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•®‡•™‡••
‡§á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§™‡§†‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§∂‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡•Ç‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ú‡§≤‡§ï‡§£‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•®‡•´‡••
‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•É‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§∏‡§ø ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§ö ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§§‡§§‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•á‡§§ ‡§ú‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§É‡••‡•®‡•¨‡••
‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡•ã ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§®‡§ø‡§É ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•å‡§ï‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ú‡•ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ö‡•à‡§µ ‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡§§‡§Ø‡•á ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É‡••‡•®‡•≠‡••
‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§π‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§ö‡•§
‡§§‡§°‡§æ‡§ó‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§ö ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∏‡§∞‡§É‡§∏‡•Å ‡§ö‡••‡•®‡•Æ‡••
‡§®‡§¶‡•Ä‡§∑‡•Å ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§ñ‡§æ‡§§‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§∏‡•Å‡§§‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§π‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§µ‡•à‡•§
‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç ‡§™‡§†‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§§‡§§‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ö‡§∞‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•®‡•Ø‡••
‡§§‡§§‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ó‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•à ‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡•å ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ó‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•©‡•¶‡••
‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡•å ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§Æ‡•å ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§Ω‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•à‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡••‡•©‡•ß‡••
‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§¶‡§π ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•©‡•®‡••
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§§‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß ‡§Æ‡§π‡•Ä‡§™‡§§‡•á‡•§
‡§™‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•Ä ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§§‡•å‡•§
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§∂‡§Æ‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡§æ‡§™‡§Ç ‡§®‡•Ç‡§®‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§ø ‡§ß‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡••‡•©‡•©‡••
‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§®‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß ‡§Æ‡•á‡•§
‡§®‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§ú‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§®‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ö‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§• ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Æ‡•á‡••‡•©‡•™‡••
‡§á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§™‡§†‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•à ‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®‡§Ç ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§§‡•ã ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à ‡§§‡•Å ‡§ó‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡•Å ‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§§‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•©‡•´‡••
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§≠‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§∏‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡•§
‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§™‡§π‡§æ ‡§≠‡§µ‡••‡•©‡•¨‡••
‡§á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§™‡§†‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§æ ‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§™‡•É‡§•‡§ø‡§µ‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§® ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∂‡§Ø‡§É‡••‡•©‡•≠‡••
‡§è‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•å‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§ó‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§ú‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö ‡§Æ‡•É‡§¶‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§è‡§≠‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§¶‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•à‡§É‡••‡•©‡•Æ‡••
‡§∂‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∂‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ã‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≠‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ö‡•§
‡§ï‡•Å‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§≤‡§≤‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§≤‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•à ‡§§‡§•‡§æ‡••‡•©‡•Ø‡••
‡•ê‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ï‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§∂‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§ö‡••‡•™‡•¶‡••
‡§è‡§§‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§¶‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§§‡•ã ‡§®‡•É‡§™‡•§
‡§ñ‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞‡•à‡§É ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡•Å‡§ó‡•ç‡§ß‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡•à‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡•à‡§É‡••‡•™‡•ß‡••
‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§É ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§π‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§π‡•Å‡§§‡•Ä‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡•å‡••‡•™‡•®‡••
‡§∏‡•å‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§™‡§ø ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•Å‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡•É‡§™‡•§
‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•Å‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§™‡§ø ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ñ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡•à‡§∞‡§™‡§ø‡••‡•™‡•©‡••
‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡•å‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•Å‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§ï‡•á‡§∏‡§∞‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§™‡§ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡•à‡§É ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§É ‡§´‡§≤‡•à‡§∞‡§™‡§ø‡•§
‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§Ö‡§• ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∞‡•ç‡§ö‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•™‡•™‡••
‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡•É‡§ú‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§É ‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§§‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§§‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•™‡•´‡••
‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§µ‡§Ç‡§∂‡§ú‡•á ‡§Æ‡•É‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ω‡§™‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§
‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§®‡§∞‡§æ‡§É ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§ï‡•á‡§∏‡§∞‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§æ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§Ç ‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§É ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ö‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•™‡•¨‡••
‡§Ö‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡•á‡§§‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§ó‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§≠‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§•‡§æ‡•§
‡§ß‡•Ç‡§™‡•à‡§∞‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§ø‡§µ‡§¶‡•ç‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••‡•™‡•≠‡••
‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡•å‡§¶‡§®‡§Ç ‡§ò‡•É‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•ã‡§ß‡•Ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§õ‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§§‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ö‡§µ‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•à ‡§¶‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§•‡§æ‡••‡•™‡•Æ‡••
‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∂‡§æ‡§†‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§ß‡§®‡•á ‡§®‡•É‡§™‡•§
‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∂‡§æ‡§†‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§π‡§ø ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§£‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§´‡§≤‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•™‡•Ø‡••
‡§∂‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡•Ä‡§ï ‡§â‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö
‡§Ö‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï‡•á‡§£ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§≠‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ ‡§§‡•Å ‡§â‡§§‡§æ‡§π‡•ã ‡§∏‡§ï‡•É‡§¶‡•á‡§µ ‡§§‡•Å‡••‡•´‡•¶‡••
‡§∏‡•Å‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö
‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§æ ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§æ‡•§
‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§µ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•á‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§ø‡§µ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§É‡••‡•´‡•ß‡••
‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•ã ‡§ö‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§É ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ú‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§æ‡•§
‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•É‡§£‡•Å ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•´‡•®‡••
‡§∏‡•å‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ú‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∏‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ï‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§¶‡§∂‡§∏‡•å‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§∂‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§ö‡••‡•´‡•©‡••
‡§∏‡•å‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡•å‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ω‡§™‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§
‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§™‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ‡••‡•´‡•™‡••
‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§
‡§∞‡•å‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡§≤‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§ö‡••‡•´‡•´‡••
‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ö ‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ω‡§™‡§ø ‡§§‡•Å‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•à ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§É ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡•à‡§É ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡§ï‡•à ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•à‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡•à ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•à‡§É ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•´‡•¨‡••
‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§¶‡§æ ‡§¶‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§∏‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§®‡•É‡§™‡•§
‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¨‡§æ‡§π‡•ã ‡§ó‡•Å‡§£‡§ø‡§®‡•á ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§Ø‡§∏‡•á ‡§®‡•É‡§™‡••‡•´‡•≠‡••
‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡•Ä‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É‡•§
‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§∞‡•ã ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§®‡•ã‡§§‡§ø ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§‡••‡•´‡•Æ‡••
‡§ï‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§Ø‡§∏‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§§‡•á‡§ú‡§∏‡§æ ‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§≠‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§¨‡§≤‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•´‡•Ø‡••
‡§à‡§¶‡•É‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§π ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§ø ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§∏‡§¶‡•ã ‡§®‡•É‡§™‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡§•‡§æ ‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡•á‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡•É‡§™‡••‡•¨‡•¶‡••
‡§™‡§†‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•É‡§£‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§™‡§æ‡§™‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∂‡§Ø‡§É‡•§
‡§ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§§‡§•‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§≤‡§≠‡§§‡•á ‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∂‡§Ø‡§É‡••‡•§‡•¨‡•ß‡••
—‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§≠‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á ‡§∂‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§∏‡§æ‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§ø ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡•á ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§µ‡§π‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§£‡§Ç ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•à‡§ï‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡§É

  • Tags: RareDays Combinations
‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on every occurrence of Vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏• yoga (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti).

Vyatipata Shraddha day.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyShraddhaDays ShannavatiTarpanaDays

2022-04-20

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É-01-19 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-01-07üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§É-02-01üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-01-30, Islamic: 1443-09-18 Rama·∏çƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ü‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§ñ, ‡§Ö- ‡§¨‚Äô‡§π‡§æ‡§ó
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫13:53; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫23:40; ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫13:36; ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ò‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫13:53; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫24:32*; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (44.19¬∞ ‚Üí 44.05¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (34.29¬∞ ‚Üí 35.05¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (66.34¬∞ ‚Üí 67.25¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (56.22¬∞ ‚Üí 56.44¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-17.05¬∞ ‚Üí -17.71¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:07-12:18üåûÔ∏è-18:29üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî09:00; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî22:18
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:07-07:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:46; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:51; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:29-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:07-06:57; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:57-07:46; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:15; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:54-12:43; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:22-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:29
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:34-05:21; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:08-01:28
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:51; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî07:40-09:13; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:46-12:18
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:43); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • (‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§™‡§¶‡•Ä-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É, ‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
(‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§™‡§¶‡•Ä-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 06:07‚Üí14:18

Vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ Punyakala.

‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§™‡§É‚Äî
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§π‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
(‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ü‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ï-‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§É)

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É
  • 07:54‚Üí

Beginning of mƒÅdhava-mƒÅsa·∏•, marked by the transit of Sun into vrÃ•·π£abha-rƒÅshƒ´. While nirayana sa·πÖkrƒÅnti’s are widely observed, tropical sa·πÖkrƒÅnti’s are also equally sacred, and have similar pu·πáyakƒÅlas associated with them.

‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§™‡§É‚Äî
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§π‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
—‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ü‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ï-‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§É

‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§®‡§≠‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§®‡§≠‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‚Äå‡§∑‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§á‡§∑‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§∏‡§π‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§π‡•à‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§§‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§§‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡•à‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
—‡§§‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø-‡§∏‡§Ç‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡•™-‡•™-‡•ß‡•ß

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 06:07‚Üí12:18

When the transit of the Sun (sa·πÖkrƒÅnti) happens in the first half of the day (p≈´rvƒÅh·πáa) or after midnight of the previous day, the first half of the day is a pu·πáyakƒÅla for various observances. In addition to 16 ghatikas on either side of the transition, and specific pu·πáyakƒÅlas like ·π£a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti, vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ etc., this is also useful, especially in cases where the other pu·πáyakƒÅlas are inconvenient for appropriate performance of rituals such as snƒÅna, dƒÅna, tarpa·πáa, etc.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Pa√±camƒ´ tithi of Caitra·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§§‡•á‡§Ω‡§ú‡§ø‡§§ ‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§® ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§§‡§®‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ß‡•Å‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•á ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É‡•§
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ó‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§≤‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•à ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§§‡•á‡••‡•©-‡•ß‡•©-‡•©‡•´‡••
‚Äî‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§µ‡§§‡•á ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á ‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•á‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•á ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•á‡§Ω‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡•á

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•á ‡§§‡•Å ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡•á ‡§®‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§≠‡•Å‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡•á‡§£ ‡§∂‡•É‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡§ß‡•á‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§≤‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡••
‡§Ö‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•á‡••

2022-04-21

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É-01-20 , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-01-08üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§É-02-02üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-02-01, Islamic: 1443-09-19 Rama·∏çƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ü‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§ñ, ‡§Ö- ‡§¨‚Äô‡§π‡§æ‡§ó
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫11:12; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫21:50; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ò‡§É‚ñ∫10:18; ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫11:12; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫21:56; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (67.25¬∞ ‚Üí 68.16¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-17.71¬∞ ‚Üí -18.31¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (56.44¬∞ ‚Üí 56.66¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (35.05¬∞ ‚Üí 35.81¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (44.05¬∞ ‚Üí 43.91¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:07-12:18üåûÔ∏è-18:29üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî10:01; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî23:19
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:07-07:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:45; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:51; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:29-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:07-06:56; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:56-07:46; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:14; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:53-12:43; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:22-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:29
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:34-05:20; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:08-01:27
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:51-15:24; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî06:07-07:40; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:45
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ (‚ñ∫14:22); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§§‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§É #‡•ß‡•¨‡•™
‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§É #‡•ß‡•¨‡•™

Event occured on 1858-04-21 (gregorian).

On this day, Kunwar Singh, masterfully deceiving the british forces, crossed gangA into bihAr. He had spread word that there are no boats and that he would cross the river with elephants at a different spot, even as he gathered boats at a differnt point. Douglas’ army caught up and began to shoot at their boat. One of the bullets shattered Singh’s left wrist. Singh felt that his hand had become useless and that there was the additional risk of infection due to the bullet-shot. He drew his sword and cut off his left hand near the elbow and offered it to the Ganges.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-04-22

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É-01-21 , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-01-09üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§É-02-03üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-02-02, Islamic: 1443-09-20 Rama·∏çƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ü‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§ñ, ‡§Ö- ‡§¨‚Äô‡§π‡§æ‡§ó

  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123

  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‚ñ∫08:42; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫20:13; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫07:09; ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§É‚ñ∫28:11*; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫08:42; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫19:33; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (68.16¬∞ ‚Üí 69.07¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (35.81¬∞ ‚Üí 36.56¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (43.91¬∞ ‚Üí 43.76¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-18.31¬∞ ‚Üí -18.84¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (56.66¬∞ ‚Üí 56.88¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:06-12:18üåûÔ∏è-18:29üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî11:03; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî00:17*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:06-07:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:45; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:51; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:29-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:06-06:56; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:56-07:45; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:24-10:14; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:53-12:43; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:22-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:29
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:33-05:20; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:08-01:27
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:45-12:18; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:56; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:39-09:12
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:04); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á‡§∞-‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§¨‡§≤-‡§≠‡•ã‡§ú-‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§æ #‡•©‡•¶, ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∂‡§æ‡§π‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•¨‡•¶
‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á‡§∞-‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§¨‡§≤-‡§≠‡•ã‡§ú-‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§æ #‡•©‡•¶

Event occured on 1992-04-22 (gregorian).

On this day, a local new paper of Ajmer, Dainik Navajyoti, broke the news about grooming and rape of several hundred (mostly Hindu) girls orchestrated by a gang of youth (main accused belonging to the khAdim family of the Islamic Ajmer DargAh, who also happened to be local leaders of Congress (I)). These (as well as subsequent events) were reminiscent of later infamous grooming of UK Kafirs by (mainly pAkistani) Muslim men in UK.

The scandal had come to police attention a year earlier - but they took scant action, blaming reticence of victims and possibility of hindu-muslim riots. Among those who eventually faced trial were Among those who face trial are Farooq Chishtee, president of the Ajmer Youth Congress, Nafis Chishtee and Anwar Chishtee, vice-president and joint secretary respectively of the city unit.

Context and events
  • Ajmer was ahead of time in modernity - and the reason was prestigious colleges like Mayo, Sophia and Savitri college.
  • It started with girls (1990) being lured by expensive gifts, (initially Farooq Chisti) bringing the girl-friend to a farmhouse, another boy taking intimate pictures, subsequent blackmail and rape, followed by pressure to lure another young girl and so on (eg. Rashmi ‚Üí Sunita ‚Üí Madhuri). This cascaded to hundreds of girls being raped.
  • There were 8-10 boys in the gang : Farooq, Nafees, Anwar, Puttan, Salim, Ishrat, Shamshusdin, Suhail etc.
  • A victim, Madhuri (pseudonym), had informed a police constable and a special branch officer in the first half of 1991. But she started getting threatening phone calls. When trying to recover the photographs, an accused even sauntered up in front of the police and said “they’ve played this game before”; the photos were not returned. She eventually moved to a different city.
  • Influencial lechers, including policement and businessmen got wind of it, and the grooming rape operation expanded and shifted to a famous Ajmer club.
  • Eventually, 6 girl students committed suicide by hanging. Later still, one burned herself to death in a major street.
  • Photo copies were sent by a shocked neighbor of the reel developer to VHP and Dainik Navjyoti.
  • Finally, journalist Santosh Kumar Gupta and editor DB Choudhary of Dainik Navjyoti broke the story. 24 days later, they followed up by publishing pictures of local girls, which had been circulating. “Finally, we decided to go ahead because it was the only way to shake the administration and police out of their slumber.” said the editor. Other newspapers followed suit.
Aftermath
  • Ajmer erupted into bandhs and rallies. On 27 May, police invoked the National Security Act (NSA) to arrest 8 of the accused.
  • No girl came for FIR initially - but eventually a handful of the girls turned up. Ajmer Mahila Samooh, who tried to take up the victim’s cause, withdrew after receiving threats.
  • 18 persons were accused by the police. Few of them were: Farooq Chisti, Salim, Mojiulla, Ishart Ali, Anwar, Shamsudin (Maradona), Nafees Chisti, Suhail, Purshottam (photo reel developer), Mahesh Ludhani (Owner of Photo color lab), Harish tulani. 15 were nabbed.
  • Ajmer, and its top schools fell into disrepute. People used to enquiry at newspaper office - humari ladki ki bhi photo hai kya? ‚ÄúNo one wanted to marry girls from Ajmer.” said Gupta.
    • Boarding facilities of Savitri School and Sophia School have remained shut down.
  • Eventually, on the order of CM, police raided on all video parlors and confiscated many video cassettes and pictures.
  • A journalist madan singh, running “Lehro ki barkha” tabloid, published more pics. He even allegedly tried to blackmail the girls. He fell out with powerful accomplices, named some politicians, and was assassinated with a shotgun and two pistols on 12th Sep 1992 (after attempts on his life had begun on Sep 4).
Trial
  • During trial, most of the girls who had come forward backed off. 2 remained. In 1998, Sessions Judge of Ajmer found all the accused guilty and sentenced them to life imprisonment. In 2001, High court acquitted Parvez Ansari, Mahesh Ludhani, Kailash Soni and Harish Tolani of all the charges levelled against them. Also reduced the sentence of 4 out of 8 accused from life imprisonment to 10 years. HC kept life imprisonment only for 4 accused Puttan, Ishrat, Anwar and Shamshuddin (Meradona). The main accused and mastermind Farooq Chisti supposedly “lost his mental balance” and trial against him was put on hold. He was later tried in 2007, given a punishment of 10 years imprisonment, and later in 2013 acquitted since he’d spent a “long time” in jail.
  • In 2003, Supreme court reduced the sentence of remaining 4 accused who got life imprisonment to 10 years. So the final judgement was 10 years imprisonment to 8 accused.
  • Nafis Chishty, also wanted for drug peddling, was nabbed wearing a burqa in 2003. Iqbal Bhat, evaded arrest until 2005. Salim Chisti (rapes started in his farm house) was caught in 2012.
  • Suhail Ghani Chishty was caught in 2018.
  • Those who completed their 10 year term are still living a luxurious life in Ajmer. As of 2022, Nafis Chishty, Iqbal Bhat, Saleem Chishty, Sayed Jamir Hussain, Naseem aka Tarzan, and Suhail Ghani ‚Äî were undergoing trial in POCSO court, but they were all out on bail. Santosh Gupta said: “Nafis and Farooq Chishty are leading a privileged life in Ajmer and are frequent visitors to Dargah Sharif, where some of the faithful still ritualistically kiss their hands”.
  • The two witnesses, who have had to come to court for 30 years, suffered the most - one of them suffered a breakdown in court in late 2021. In 2005, witness “Krishnabala” disappeared. Another became pregnant, was raped again, became pregnant again (the born died), was trheatened on the streets, before withdrawing.
Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∂‡§æ‡§π‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•¨‡•¶

Event occured on 1962-04-22 (gregorian).

Bangla muslim mobs attacked Hindus, motivated in part by Islamic Republic of Pakistan Army and government propaganda (including false stories about anti-muslim violence in India). An estimated 300 non-Muslims were killed in Rajshahi district alone. Around 11k Santhals and Rajbanshis migrated to India.

The intervention of the Indian Assistant High Commission resulted in the troops being called and the massacre was stopped.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-04-23

  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî12:04; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî01:10*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:06-07:39; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:45; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:51; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:29-19:56

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•´‡•¨ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û ‡§∏‡§¶‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ ‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•™‡•Æ‡•™, ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡•ã ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•Ä‡§∂‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø #‡•ß‡•¨‡•™, ‡§ú‡§æ‡§†‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•´‡•ß, ‡§§‡•Å‡§ò‡•ç‡§∞‡§≤‡§ñ‡§æ‡§®-‡§™‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•≠‡•≠‡•Æ, ‡§®‡§ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∞‡•ç ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à ‡§ì‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡•á‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä), ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§ú‡•Ä-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§É #‡•©‡•¶‡•®
‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§ú‡•Ä-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§É #‡•©‡•¶‡•®

Event occured on 1720-04-23 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

great peshva bAlAjI vishvanAth died.

‡§ú‡§æ‡§†‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•´‡•ß

Event occured on 1971-04-23 (gregorian).

Over 3k Bengali and Rajbanshi Hindu males trying to run away to India were stopped and killed by Islamic Republic of Pakistan Army in collaboration with razAkar-s (volunteers) including members of Jamaat-e-Islami and Muslim League.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•´‡•¨ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û ‡§∏‡§¶‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ ‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•™‡•Æ‡•™

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of Caitra·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 4640 (Kali era).

Then, the son of CirutacikkadƒÅdhvari on the banks of river UttarapinƒÅkinƒ´, a devotee of Hari, the preceptor Bodhe≈õvara, bearing the appellation SadƒÅ≈õiva under the directions of preceptor Chandrac≈´·∏ça, was Jagadguru for sixteen years adored by the King Pravƒ´ra Sethupati. The preceptor visited the sacred Sethu RƒÅme≈õvara, having worshipped Lord ≈öiva for the welfare of the mankind reached eternal abode on Caitra ≈öukla A·π£·π≠amƒ´ in the year Vilambi. This preceptor is well-known as SadƒÅ≈õiva Bodhe≈õvara, author of Pu·πáya≈õlokama√±jarƒ´ and attained siddhi in RƒÅme≈õvaram.

‡§Ö‡§•‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡§ü‡§≠‡§µ‡§É ‡§∏ ‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§É
‡§∏‡•Å‡§§‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§§‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§£‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ã ‡§π‡§∞‡•á‡§É‡•§
‡§Ö‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§≤ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ö‡•Ç‡§°‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§Ø‡§æ
‡§∏‡§¶‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‡§µ‡§π‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞(‡•®‡•¨)‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡••‡•ß‡••
‡§∏ ‡§∏‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ú‡§ó‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§™‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§Ç
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§É ‡§™‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§®‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ø‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§
‡§¶‡§ß‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§õ‡§ø‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§ú‡§™‡§¶‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç
‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§≤‡•á ‡§®‡•É‡§£‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•®‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

Details
  • References
    • Punya Shloka Manjari
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: KanchiAradhanaDays
‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡•ã ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•Ä‡§∂‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø #‡•ß‡•¨‡•™

Event occured on 1858-04-23 (gregorian).

Kunwar Singh, aged 80 and one-handed (having cut off and offered his wounded hand to gangA devI in an earlier battle a few days earlier), utterly routed Captain le Grand’s forces (with 2 howitzers) with his little army of about two thousand men - dispirited and badly armed. Le Grand used his guns and an infantry charge into the jungle to no avail. On 22 and 23 April, being injured he fought bravely against the British Army and with the help of his army drove away the British Army, brought down the Union Jack from Jagdispur Fort and hoisted his flag.

On 26 April 1858 he died in his village. The mantle of the old chief now fell on his brother Amar Singh II who, despite heavy odds, continued the struggle and for a considerable time, running a parallel government in the district of Shahabad. In October 1859, Amar Singh II joined the rebel leaders in the Nepal Terai.

Details

  • Tags:
‡§®‡§ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∞‡•ç ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à ‡§ì‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡•á‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on ≈örava·πáa·∏• nakshatra of Mƒì·π£a·∏• (sidereal solar) month (Prad≈ç·π£a·∏•/paraviddha).

‡§ï‡•É‡§™‡§æ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•Å‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§®‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§ü‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§ø-‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§∏‡§¶‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§ø ‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡••
‡§Æ‡•å‡§≤‡•å ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ-‡§∂‡§∂‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•å ‡§ï‡§∞‡§ö‡§∞‡§£‡§§‡§≤‡•á ‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§≤‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ ‡§≠‡•Å‡§ú‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ:
‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•á ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ ‡§π‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ó‡§ø‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡•Å‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡•§
‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§§‡§µ ‡§ï‡§®‡§ï‡§∏‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§• ‡§∏‡•ã‡§¢‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•ç‡§µ ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø:
‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§§‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡§ø ‡§® ‡§§‡•á ‡§®‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•á‡••

  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä)

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§§‡•Å‡§ò‡•ç‡§∞‡§≤‡§ñ‡§æ‡§®-‡§™‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•≠‡•≠‡•Æ

Event occured on 1244-04-23 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

Small commando units (one of them 100 infantry and 50 cavalry) of Odisha’s Eastern Ganga Dynasty king Gajapati Narasimhadeva-I, pounced on a big Mamluk force under Tughril Khan (fooled into complacency by a faux retreat) near Katasin/Contai fort (near South Bengal). The Gajapati’s army then chased them all the way out of South Bengal (all the way beyond lakhnor fort, 70 miles away).

####### Context Narasimhadeva had laid a siege on Lakhanuti(Bengal) for the first time in Nov 1243. This shocked the Mamluk Governor Tughril Tughan Khan, who had to gather his forces and gave the clarion of Islamic jihAd against the Gajapati. The Ganga army hd to retreat till Katasin(Contai) of South West Bengal. The Mamluk army was overjoyed as they had apparently forced the Eastern Ganga army to withdraw, and camped near the Katasin fort. They weren’t aware that it was a fake retreat. The Mamluks weren’t alert and were infact quite excited on seeing the war elephants left behind for free.

Details

  • Tags:

2022-04-24

  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫17:51; ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É)

  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:05-07:38; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:44; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:30-19:56
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:05-06:55; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:55-07:45; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:24-10:13; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:53-12:42; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:21-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:30
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:33-05:19; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:08-01:27
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî16:57-18:30; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:57
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:03); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ü‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§≤‡•à‡§É ‡§ï‡•ã‡§°‡§ó‡•Å‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•ß‡•Æ‡•Æ, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É
‡§Ü‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§≤‡•à‡§É ‡§ï‡•ã‡§°‡§ó‡•Å‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•ß‡•Æ‡•Æ

Event occured on 1834-04-24 (gregorian).

chikka-vIra-rAjendra (allegedly tyrranical) was deposed and exiled by the British; his kingdom was annexed into British India. He lived 14 years in exile; one of his daughters married jung bahAdur rANa, while another, gauramma (then aged 11 years), adopted to be taken care by Queen Victoria was converted to Christianity and married to some old colnel.

  • 09:33‚Üí

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 360, it is sƒÅyana-vaidhrÃ•ti·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

Observed on every occurrence of ≈örava·πáa·∏• nakshatra (SƒÅ·πÖgava·∏•/puurvaviddha).

2022-04-25

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É-01-25 , ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-01-12üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§É-02-06üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-02-05, Islamic: 1443-09-23 Rama·∏çƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ü‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§ñ, ‡§Ö- ‡§¨‚Äô‡§π‡§æ‡§ó
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫25:38*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫17:11; ‡§∂‡§§‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡§ï‡•ç‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫20:52; ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫14:12; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫25:38*; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (43.47¬∞ ‚Üí 43.31¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (57.32¬∞ ‚Üí 57.54¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (70.88¬∞ ‚Üí 71.80¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (38.08¬∞ ‚Üí 38.84¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-19.69¬∞ ‚Üí -19.99¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:05-12:17üåûÔ∏è-18:30üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî13:59; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî02:44*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:05-07:38; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:44; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:23-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:30-19:57
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:05-06:54; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:54-07:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:13; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:52-12:42; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:21-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:30
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:32-05:18; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:08-01:26
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:38-09:11; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:44-12:17; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:50-15:23
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:23); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ-‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø-‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ-‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø-‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

Coming from Brahma’s Kamandalu, Pushkara Raja resides in different rivers, along with 3.5 crore tirthas, following the Sankranti of Guru, for twelve days at the beginning of the Sankranti (ƒÅdi pu·π£karam) and at the end of the year (preceding transition to the next rƒÅ≈õƒ´, antya pu·π£karam), and for two muhurtas during mid-day, every day, during the entire year. Following the transition of Guru to mƒ´na rƒÅ≈õƒ´, pu·π£kararƒÅja resides in prƒÅ·πáahitƒÅ river.

‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§¶‡§æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡•É‡§§‡§ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§¶‡§æ‡•§
‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡§æ‡§π‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡•á ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§Ø‡§æ‡••
‡§Ü‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡•á ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂ ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§ö ‡§Ø‡§•‡§æ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§Æ‡•ç‡••

  • Tags: RareDays Pushkara
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É
  • ‚Üí07:13

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 360, it is sƒÅyana-vaidhrÃ•ti·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

2022-04-26

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É-01-26 , ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É-‡§∂‡§§‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡§ï‡•çüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-01-13üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§É-02-07üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-02-06, Islamic: 1443-09-24 Rama·∏çƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ü‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§ñ, ‡§Ö- ‡§¨‚Äô‡§π‡§æ‡§ó
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫24:48*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§§‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡§ï‡•ç‚ñ∫16:55; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫19:02; ‡§á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫13:10; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫24:48*; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (43.31¬∞ ‚Üí 43.16¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-19.99¬∞ ‚Üí -20.22¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (38.84¬∞ ‚Üí 39.60¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (71.80¬∞ ‚Üí 72.71¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (57.54¬∞ ‚Üí 57.76¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:04-12:17üåûÔ∏è-18:30üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî14:53; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî03:27*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:04-07:38; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:44; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:23-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:30-19:57
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:04-06:54; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:54-07:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:13; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:52-12:42; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:21-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:50-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:30
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:32-05:18; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:07-01:26
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:23-16:57; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:44; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:03); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§µ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§õ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•®‡•¶) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§® ‡§π‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§≤‡§ø-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•©‡•™‡•Ø, ‡§µ‡§≤‡•ç‡§≤‡§≠‡§æ‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä #‡•´‡•™‡•™, ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§•‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§® ‡§π‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§≤‡§ø-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•©‡•™‡•Ø

Event occured on 1673-04-26 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

Prataprao General of shivAjI sacked Hubli, plundered the British East India Company’s house and escaped before Muzaffar Khan’s 4k cavalry arrived.

‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§•‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä

The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of chaitra month is known as var≈´thinƒ´-ƒìkƒÅda≈õƒ´.

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§ö ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§É‡•§
‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•Å‡§≠‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡§™‡§ø‡••

‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ï‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§∂‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§≠‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡••
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡§•‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§∞‡•á ‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡§µ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡•§
‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö ‡§µ‡•à ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡•ã ‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§§‡§É‡••
–‡§™‡§¶‡•ç‡§Æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á

‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§µ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§õ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•®‡•¶) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on ≈öatabhi·π£ak nakshatra of Mƒì·π£a·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-ƒíkƒÅda≈õƒ´ tithi of Caitra·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha). The event occurred in 4580 (Kali era).

  • Tags: MahapurushaEvents

2022-04-27

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É-01-27 , ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-01-14üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§É-02-08üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-02-07, Islamic: 1443-09-25 Rama·∏çƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ü‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§ñ, ‡§Ö- ‡§¨‚Äô‡§π‡§æ‡§ó
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫24:24*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫17:03; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫24:16*; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫17:33; ‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫12:33; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫24:24*; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (43.16¬∞ ‚Üí 43.00¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (39.60¬∞ ‚Üí 40.36¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-20.22¬∞ ‚Üí -20.37¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (72.71¬∞ ‚Üí 73.62¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (57.76¬∞ ‚Üí 57.97¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:04-12:17üåûÔ∏è-18:30üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî15:45; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî04:07*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:04-07:37; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:10-10:44; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:23-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:30-19:57
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:04-06:54; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:54-07:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:13; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:52-12:42; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:21-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:51-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:30
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:31-05:18; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:07-01:26
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî07:37-09:10; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:44-12:17
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:42); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§É
‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§É
  • ‚Üí06:39

The first quarter of dvƒÅda≈õƒ´ tithi is not suitable for breaking fast (pƒÅra·πáa), and is known as harivƒÅsara·∏•. Break fast once harivƒÅsara·∏• is over.

‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§É ‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡•ã ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§Æ‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡§É‡••

‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§®-‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§É)—
‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡§µ‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•Ä‡§¶ ‡§∏‡•Å‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§• ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡••

‡§µ‡•à‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•á ‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á—
‡§Ö‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§´‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§ó‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§
‡§Ü‡§Æ‡§≤‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É ‡§´‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∂‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡••

2022-04-28

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É-01-28 , ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§™‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡•Ä-01-15üåûüåå , ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§É-02-09üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-02-08, Islamic: 1443-09-26 Rama·∏çƒÅn, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ü‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§ñ, ‡§Ö- ‡§¨‚Äô‡§π‡§æ‡§ó
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫24:27*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫17:38; ‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§™‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡•Ä‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫16:25; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫12:22; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫24:27*; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (40.36¬∞ ‚Üí 41.12¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (57.97¬∞ ‚Üí 58.19¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-20.37¬∞ ‚Üí -20.43¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (73.62¬∞ ‚Üí 74.53¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (43.00¬∞ ‚Üí 42.84¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:03-12:17üåûÔ∏è-18:30üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî16:35; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî04:47*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:03-07:37; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:10-10:43; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:23-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:30-19:57
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:03-06:53; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:53-07:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:12; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:52-12:42; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:21-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:51-17:40; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:40-18:30
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:31-05:17; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:07-01:26
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:50-15:23; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî06:03-07:37; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:10-10:43
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ (‚ñ∫14:21); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§§‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡•ß, ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä, ‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§Æ‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•≠‡•®, ‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡•ß

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Tray≈çda≈õƒ´ tithi of Caitra·∏• (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Tray≈çda≈õƒ´ tithi of Caitra·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Matsyavataram happened on this day. On this sacred day, upavƒÅsa etc. gives anantapu·πáyam.

‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ã‡§™‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ú‡§ø‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§ß‡•É‡§ï‡•ç‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≤‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§§‡•á‡••

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≤‡§Ø‡§™‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ø ‡§ß‡§æ‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§∏‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•á‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡§£‡§Æ‡§™‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ
‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§ú‡§Æ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ ‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç
‡§§‡§Æ‡§π‡§Æ‡§ñ‡§ø‡§≤‡§π‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§ø‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç ‡§®‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡••‡•¨‡•ß‡••
—‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§µ‡§§‡•á ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§Æ‡§π‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•á ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§É

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ø‡§§‡•á ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡•å ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•Å‡§É‡•§
‡§â‡§¶‡§≠‡•Ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡•á‡§£ ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§Æ‡§µ‡§®‡•á‡§∞‡•ç‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‡••
‡§Ö‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•á‡••

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
  • 18:30‚Üí19:57

Pradosha Vratam. Fast during the day and perform ≈õivap≈´jƒÅ in Pradosha Kala.

  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫18:41; ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§™‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡•Ä‚ñ∫

  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫12:39; ‡§∂‡§ï‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫24:58*; ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‚ñ∫

  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (58.19¬∞ ‚Üí 58.41¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-20.43¬∞ ‚Üí -20.42¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (74.53¬∞ ‚Üí 75.45¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (42.84¬∞ ‚Üí 42.68¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (41.12¬∞ ‚Üí 41.88¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:03-12:17üåûÔ∏è-18:30üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî17:25; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:28*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:03-07:36; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:10-10:43; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:50; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:30-19:57
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:03-06:53; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:53-07:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:22-10:12; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:52-12:42; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:21-15:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:51-17:41; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:41-18:30
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:31-05:17; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:07-01:26
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:43-12:17; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî15:24-16:57; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:36-09:10
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:02); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ-‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä), ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É
‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É

When Revati nakshatra falls on a Friday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. When Rohini nakshatra falls on a Saturday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays
‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ-‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Caturda≈õƒ´ tithi of Caitra·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

On the Krishna Chaturdashi of Chaitra month, whoever performs snƒÅna in a Shiva Sannidhi, or especially in Ganga, they do not atttain prƒìtatvam.

‡§ö‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§ø‡§µ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ß‡•å‡•§
‡§® ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§®‡•ã‡§§‡§ø ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡§§‡§É‡••
