  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (31.33¬∞ ‚Üí 31.09¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (127.55¬∞ ‚Üí 128.54¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (85.71¬∞ ‚Üí 86.56¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (70.48¬∞ ‚Üí 70.72¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (21.41¬∞ ‚Üí 20.96¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:58-12:22üåûÔ∏è-18:45üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî14:58; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî02:49*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî05:58-07:34; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:10-10:46; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:22-13:57; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:33-17:09; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:45-20:09
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî05:58-06:50; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:50-07:41; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:14; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:56-12:47; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:29-15:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:03-17:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:54-18:45
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:29-05:14; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:14-01:29
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:46-12:22; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî15:33-17:09; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:34-09:10
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:05); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä

The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of jyai·π£·π≠ha month is known as y≈çginƒ´-ƒìkƒÅda≈õƒ´.

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§ö ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§É‡•§
‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•Å‡§≠‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡§™‡§ø‡••

‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ï‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§∂‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§≠‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡••
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡§•‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§∞‡•á ‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡§µ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡•§
‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö ‡§µ‡•à ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡•ã ‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§§‡§É‡••
–‡§™‡§¶‡•ç‡§Æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyVratam EkadashiVratam

2022-06-25

‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É-03-27 , ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É-‡§Ö‡§™‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-11üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-05üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-04, Islamic: 1443-11-25 ·∏é≈´ al-Qa ødah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫25:10*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§™‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡•Ä‚ñ∫10:22; ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫29:50*; ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫12:08; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫25:10*; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (86.56¬∞ ‚Üí 87.41¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (20.96¬∞ ‚Üí 20.45¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (128.54¬∞ ‚Üí 129.53¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (31.09¬∞ ‚Üí 30.85¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (70.72¬∞ ‚Üí 70.96¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:59-12:22üåûÔ∏è-18:45üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî15:48; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî03:33*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî05:59-07:34; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:10-10:46; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:22-13:58; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:33-17:09; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:45-20:09
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî05:59-06:50; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:50-07:41; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:14; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:56-12:47; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:30-15:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:03-17:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:54-18:45
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:29-05:14; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:15-01:29
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:10-10:46; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî13:58-15:33; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî05:59-07:34
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:23); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§™‡•Å‡§∞-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•ß‡•¨‡•´, ‡§ï‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä, ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä, ‡§Æ‡§£‡§ø-‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•®‡•Æ‡•™
‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on every occurrence of KrÃ•ttikƒÅ nakshatra (S≈´ryƒÅstamaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

krÃ•ttikƒÅ-vratam for Lord Subrahmanya. Observe fast for the entire day, and obtain blessings of all the krÃ•ttikƒÅ-striya·∏• who raised skanda after His birth. Three Vratas are very special for Subrahmanya—the bhrÃ•guvƒÅra-subrahma·πáya-vratam in tulƒÅmƒÅsa, this regular krÃ•ttikƒÅ vratam, and skanda·π£a·π£·π≠hivratam.

‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•à ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ú‡§æ‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§ó‡§§‡•á ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡•á‡••‡•ß‡••
‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§∞‡•á‡§µ ‡§∑‡§°‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§¨‡•ç‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§≤‡§Ø‡•á ‡§®‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö‡••‡•®‡••
‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡§æ‡§™‡§π‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§ø‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Ç ‡§™‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•©‡••
‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§£‡§ø ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ó‡§Æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡•á ‡§≠‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§≠‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§π‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§Ø‡§æ‡••‡•™‡••
‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§É‡•§
‡§ú‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ò‡•ã‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ó‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡••‡•´‡••
‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡•§
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ö‡•Å‡§ï‡•Å‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§π‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§≤‡§É ‡§∂‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ç‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡••‡•¨‡••
‡§ó‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§™ ‡§ö‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§É‡•§
‡§®‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§É ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á ‡§§‡§æ‡§™‡§∏‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Ä‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§É‡••‡•≠‡••
‡§®‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§≤‡§≠‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§™‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§™‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§É‡••‡•Æ‡••
‡§ê‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§æ‡§™‡•Å‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡•á‡•§
‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö‡•à‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§π‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Æ‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•Ø‡••
‡§∏ ‡§≤‡§¨‡•ç‡§ß‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§õ‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§ú‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§µ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§§‡§É‡••‡•ß‡•¶‡••
‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§§‡§ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Æ‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§ó‡•Å‡§π‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§É‡••‡•ß‡•ß‡••
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§∏‡§Ç‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ñ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á ‡§â‡§™‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡•á

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialVratam
‡§ï‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-DvƒÅda≈õƒ´ tithi of Jyai·π£·π≠ha·∏• (lunar) month (SƒÅyƒÅhna·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Danam of Brahma puranam

‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•á ‡§§‡§•‡§æ ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§ó‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡§ú‡§É‡•§
‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§É ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ï‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡•Ä ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§ß‡•å‡••
‡§Ö‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•á‡••

Details
  • References
    • Vaidyanatha Dikshitiyam (SVR) p.62
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Dashavataram LessCommonFestivals
‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§™‡•Å‡§∞-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•ß‡•¨‡•´

Event occured on 1857-06-25 (gregorian).

As the British forces at kAnpur surrendered on 25 June 1857, Nana was declared Peshwa in late June.

On June 27, the british making their way on gangA at Satichaura Ghat were killed or captured (it’s unclear who fired teh first shot). Around 120 women and children were taken prisoner and eventually moved to Bibighar; later more were added.

Using them for bargaining failed - and eventually, they were massacred on July 15 despite protestations (including hunger strike) of nAnA-saheb’s family, and hesitency / refusal of the soldiers - partly in anger at reports of violence by British against villagers. Finally, owner of the place, begum hussaini khAnum, a harlot, hired butchers to finish them off with cleavers. The British extracted their terrible vengence later.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§Æ‡§£‡§ø-‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•®‡•Æ‡•™

Event occured on 1738-06-25 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

maNi-rAm, aka bhAi maNi singh, a fine scholar and warrior, shiShya of the last 4 sikh gurus + bandA vairAgI, aged 94, was dismembered limb by limb.

Reason: Governor of Lahore, Zakaria Khan, expected Rs 5k in return for permission to celebrate divAlI at harmandir. But, knowing that he intended a slaughter (in collusion with divAn lakhpat rAi), the sikhs did not turn up - so maNi could not pay the money.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä

Dvadashi tithi, which is followed by an amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ or paur·πáamƒÅsƒ´ that touches two consecutive days at sunrise.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations SpecialVratam

2022-06-26

‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É-03-28 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É-‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-12üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-06üåûü™ê , ‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-05, Islamic: 1443-11-26 ·∏é≈´ al-Qa ødah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123

  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‚ñ∫13:04; ‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫14:16; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫27:26*; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫

  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (70.96¬∞ ‚Üí 71.20¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (87.41¬∞ ‚Üí 88.26¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (129.53¬∞ ‚Üí 130.52¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (30.85¬∞ ‚Üí 30.62¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (20.45¬∞ ‚Üí 19.89¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:59-12:22üåûÔ∏è-18:45üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî16:38; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî04:18*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî05:59-07:35; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:10-10:46; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:22-13:58; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:34-17:09; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:45-20:09
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî05:59-06:50; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:50-07:41; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:14; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:56-12:48; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:30-15:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:03-17:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:54-18:45
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:29-05:14; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:15-01:30
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî17:09-18:45; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî12:22-13:58; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:34-17:09
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:05); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§ß‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§æ‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç/‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§∞‡§•‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§É, ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§ß‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§æ‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç/‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§∞‡§•‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§É

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day, there is a special rathotsava, with the panchamurtis.

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
  • 18:45‚Üí20:09

Pradosha Vratam. Fast during the day and perform ≈õivap≈´jƒÅ in Pradosha Kala.

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑‡•á ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§æ‡§É‡•§

  • 03:39‚Üí

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 180, it is sƒÅyana-vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

2022-06-27

‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É-03-29 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É-‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-13üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-07üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-06, Islamic: 1443-11-27 ·∏é≈´ al-Qa ødah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫29:52*; ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä‚ñ∫16:00; ‡§Æ‡•É‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§Æ‡•ç‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫06:43; ‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫16:38; ‡§∂‡§ï‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫29:52*; ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (88.26¬∞ ‚Üí 89.12¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (19.89¬∞ ‚Üí 19.27¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (30.62¬∞ ‚Üí 30.38¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (71.20¬∞ ‚Üí 71.44¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (130.52¬∞ ‚Üí 131.50¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:59-12:22üåûÔ∏è-18:45üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî17:28; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:06*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî05:59-07:35; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:46; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:22-13:58; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:34-17:09; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:45-20:10
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî05:59-06:50; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:50-07:41; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:15; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:57-12:48; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:30-15:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:03-17:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:54-18:45
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:29-05:14; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:15-01:30
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:35-09:11; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:46-12:22; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:58-15:34
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:23); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§ú‡§§ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§ú‡•á‡§¢‡•á-‡§ï‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§π‡•ã‡§ú‡•Ä-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≤‡•ã‡§≠‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•®‡•¨‡•©, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä), ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É, ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§ú‡§§ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day, Nataraja gives darshan with a silver ‘chandra prabha’ vahanam.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§ú‡•á‡§¢‡•á-‡§ï‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§π‡•ã‡§ú‡•Ä-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≤‡•ã‡§≠‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•®‡•¨‡•©

Event occured on 1759-06-27 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On this day (AShADha shukla 6), Shia King “Imam” Ali Adil Shah unsuccessfully tried to threaten and pursuade kAnhojI jedhe to side with Afzal Khan against shivAjI, accusing him of “troubling Muslims”. In response, Kanhoji Jedhe went to Chhatrapati Shivaji and relinquished his Watan, thus signifying that he was not joining Afzal Khan. afzal destroyed temples and was himself killed and routed by shivAjI.

Translated firman (from Farsi)

I BEGIN IN THE NAME OF MERCIFUL AND KIND GOD.
THE WHOLE WORLD BELONGS TO GOD.
IMMAM ALI ALI ADILSHA
son of MAHOMED ADILSHAH.

This gracious Royal Firman is issued to KANHOJI JEDHE, TO WIT :-
Since the beginning of the year 1059, Shivaji out of narrow-mindedness and evil propensities has started troubling the Mahomedans residing in the Province of Konkan belonging to the Nizamshahi. He has also plundered them.

He has captured many forts in the Padshahi (our) Province; therefore in order to drive him out and conquer him, we have appointed Afzulkhan possessed of valour and prestige, the most capable and efficient of our noblemen, the most vadiant, resourceful and successful Ruler, (the noblest of our chiefs who is always victorious) the Chief Commander, as the Governor of that Province, and we have sent him there with his most valiant army. He has been sent by us.

You must carry out his commands and fulfil his requirements to his complete satisfaction. You must loyally obey all his commands and help him, so that Shivaji may be driven out and uprooted root and branch. You must not give his men and volunteers, wherever they may be or from wheresoever they may come, any quarter or opportunity - but must kill them. You must give a good account of yourself to this Court and then whatever Afzulkhan may write to us and recommend about rewarding your services and honouring you, will be done by us. Whatever Afzulkhan may say or write regarding our services and whatever he may direct you to do, you will obey implicitly. You should carry out his wishes and this will bring you a good result. You must act according to the orders contained in this Royal

Firman written on the 5th day of Shavval in the year 1069. (16-6-1659 Julian).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Caturda≈õƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (Ni≈õƒ´tha·∏•/paraviddha).

Monthly Shivaratri day.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyFestivals
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä)

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Caturda≈õƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É
  • ‚Üí04:38

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 180, it is sƒÅyana-vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Combinations
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
  • 16:00‚Üí

When Mrgashirsha nakshatra falls on a Monday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. As per the reading s≈çma≈õrƒÅva·πáyƒÅm in the same verse, Monday-Shravana is also praised as a special yoga. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays

2022-06-28

‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É-03-30 , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Æ‡•É‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§Æ‡•çüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-14üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-08üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-07, Islamic: 1443-11-28 ·∏é≈´ al-Qa ødah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•É‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§Æ‡•ç‚ñ∫19:03; ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫07:43; ‡§µ‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‚ñ∫19:07; ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (30.38¬∞ ‚Üí 30.14¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (131.50¬∞ ‚Üí 132.50¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (19.27¬∞ ‚Üí 18.60¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (71.44¬∞ ‚Üí 71.68¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (89.12¬∞ ‚Üí 89.98¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:59-12:22üåûÔ∏è-18:45üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî18:18; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:55*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî05:59-07:35; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:47; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:22-13:58; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:34-17:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:45-20:10
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî05:59-06:51; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:51-07:42; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:24-10:15; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:57-12:48; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:30-15:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:03-17:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:54-18:45
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:30-05:15; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:15-01:30
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:34-17:10; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:47; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:22-13:58
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:06); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ), ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É-‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§É, ‡§≠‡•ã‡§ó‡§∂‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ, ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äì‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§≤‡§æ), ‡§π‡§≤‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ò‡§æ‡§ü‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•™‡•™‡•¨
‡§≠‡•ã‡§ó‡§∂‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of Jyai·π£·π≠ha·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialPuja
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day, Nataraja gives darshan with a golden ‘surya prabha’ vahanam.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§π‡§≤‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ò‡§æ‡§ü‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•™‡•™‡•¨

Event occured on 1576-06-28 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On this day, pratApasiMha and his subjects (from all varNa-s including v1 and v3 to bhils) fought mogols at haldIghATI.

The mogol side was led by the traitorous Kacchavaha general of Akbar, Man Singh. They outnumbered pratAp’s side 5:1; and were filled with professional soldiers. (Prof K S Gupta: Most Rajput treaties [eg. 1569 Bundi-Mughal treaty] with Akbar had a clause that they would not be asked to join arms against Mewar. Kachhwahas were the only exception.)

From Vanguard to rear:

  • 85 Arab commandos under the vicious Arab general Sayyid Hashim al Barhai.
  • Then, Kacchavaha Hindu horsemen led by Rao Jagannath + horsemen of Mohammedan Mongols under Baqshi Ali Asaf Khan, the Khwaja of Kazvin in Persia.
  • Then the Iltmish brigade under the cousin of Man Singh, Madhav Singh with the second Kacchavaha corps. The center was under Man Singh with the third Kacchavaha force.
  • 3 brigades of the left wing:
    • Tajiks under Mullah Ghazi Khan, the veteran Jihadist from Tajikistan.
    • The traitor Rao Lonakarna leading a force of Kacchavahas from the Sambhar lake.
    • The Shaikhzada division formed by the prolific clansmen of Sufi Shaikh Salim Chishti.
  • The right-wing was formed by the vicious Arab clansmen of Sayyid Hashim al Barhai.
  • The rear-guard was formed by the brigade of Mihtar Khan and his Central Asian Kazakh warriors.

pratApasiMha’s side:

  • frontline charging force under Ramdas Rathod, the valiant son of Jaimal who died defending Chittor. Supported by Bhim Singh, the Rao Chundavat, and Hakim Khan Sur with his fellow Pathans who stayed true to his pledge despite being enticed for jihAd (Afghans having been deposed by bAbur’s invasion).
  • Pratap in the center with his elite rAjaputras.
  • 2 brigades of the right wing
    • Ram Singh Tanwar the king of Gwalior
    • vaishya division under the valiant 3 sons and the brother Tarachand of the rich businessman Bahman (aka bhAmA) Shah
  • Left wing - Jhala clan of the Rajputs under Mana
  • Reserve
    • brahmin brigade led by Pratap‚Äôs purohita Jagannatha
    • brigade formed by the Mehta businessmen and the Charanas
    • Bhil archers under the Bhil chieftain Panja

Thus, all sections of the Hindu society were represented in the struggle to defend against Islamist gAzi-s.

Outcome: Fierce battle. mahArANA pratAp wounded, as was his horse chetak. He escaped to fight on from the forests. By 1579, pratApasiMha would recover much of the western part of his kingdom. Chittor and the rest of eastern Mewar continued to remain under Mughal control.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç

pƒÅrva·πáavratam on the eve of dar≈õa-sthƒÅlƒ´pƒÅka·∏•.

‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§æ ‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É, ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§Ω‡§≠‡§ø‡§Ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö - ‘‡§Ö‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£ ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•å‡§™‡§µ‡§∏‡§•‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•Ä ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç ‡§è‡§®‡§Ø‡•ã‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç- ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∂‡§≤‡•á‡§®’‡•§

‘‡§Ö‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§ß ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§Ø‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§§‡•å ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§ú‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§®‡•ç-‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡§∞‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§á‡§§‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∏-‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á‡§®‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§ ‡§ú‡•Å‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∏‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§’

‡§™‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç ‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É‡•§

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡§ø ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

“‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§â‡§¶‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Ø‡•á‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ” ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å‡•§

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§™‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É-‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§É

Pinda Pitru Yajnam is a ≈õrƒÅddham to be done to two sets of Pitru Devatas. It is to be done in one’s Agnihotra Agni or if that is not present then Aupasana Agni. Rice is cooked in a section of the Agni moved to the south-east. From this, even those whose father is living, give ƒÅhuti to the Deva Pitru-s ie s≈çma, yama and agni kavyavƒÅhana. Those whose father is not living should additionally give pi·πá·∏ças to the Manushya Pitru-s also to whom amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ-≈õrƒÅddham is also performed.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: ShraddhaDays
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äì‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§≤‡§æ)

amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ of jyai·π£·π≠ha lunar month.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: AmavasyaDays

It is said in the Smrtis, that if Amavaysa falls on a Monday, Tuesday or Thursday, such a tithi is given the appellation pu·π£kalƒÅ and is as sacred as a solar eclipse.

‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡•á—
‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á‡§® ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡•á‡§® ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø‡•§
‡§∏‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§≤‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡••

2022-06-29

‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É-03-30 , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-15üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-09üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-08, Islamic: 1443-11-29 ·∏é≈´ al-Qa ødah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫08:22; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫22:06; ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å‡§É‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫08:46; ‡§ß‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‚ñ∫08:22; ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫21:36; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (132.50¬∞ ‚Üí 133.49¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (89.98¬∞ ‚Üí 90.85¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (18.60¬∞ ‚Üí 17.87¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (30.14¬∞ ‚Üí 29.90¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (71.68¬∞ ‚Üí 71.93¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:00-12:23üåûÔ∏è-18:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî19:06; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî—
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:00-07:35; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:47; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:23-13:58; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:34-17:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:46-20:10
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:00-06:51; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:51-07:42; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:24-10:15; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:57-12:48; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:30-15:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:03-17:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:54-18:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:30-05:15; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:15-01:30
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:23-13:58; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî07:35-09:11; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:47-12:23
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:48); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ò‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•™‡•≠‡•´, ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§ú‡§§ ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂-‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§É, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É, ‡§®‡•á‡§§‡•ã‡§ú‡•Ä-‡§∂‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É #‡•©‡•™‡•¨, ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§™‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§ú‡§§ ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day, Nataraja gives darshan on a bh≈´ta vahanam.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyFestivals
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ò‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•™‡•≠‡•´

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of ƒÄ·π£ƒÅ·∏çha·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3649 (Kali era).

The noble son of ≈örƒ´k·πõ·π£·πáa of ≈örƒ´mu·π£·πáa by name ≈öivasƒÅmbha who went round the earth thrice, became a disciple of ≈örƒ´citrukha through initiation, and later became the head of ≈örƒ´ ≈öƒÅrada ma·π≠ha. He (≈örƒ´ Citsukhendra), whose biography was composed by Mantha in his work titled Siddhajaya adorned the Pƒ´·π≠ha for twenty-one years and attained immortal state. He, the austere, SaccidƒÅnandaghana attained immortality in the form of ≈öivali·πÖga on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of ƒÄ·π£ƒÅ·∏çha of Prabhava year in the ≈öaka era 470.

‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Æ‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§§‡§®‡§Ø‡§É ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§ø‡§§‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡•§
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§®‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§∂‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∂‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§Æ‡§†‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•Å‡§É ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç ‡§∏ ‡§∂‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‡••‡•´‡•®‡••
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§¨‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§•‡•ã ‡§®‡§ø‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§®‡•á ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ú‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡•§
‡§∏ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§§‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•à‡§ï‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•Ä‡§†‡•á ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§æ‡§™ ‡§∏‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡••‡•´‡•©‡••
‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•á ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∂‡•ç‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•á (‡•™‡•≠‡•¶) ‡§∏‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ò‡§®‡§É ‡§∏ ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§µ‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§µ‡§®‡•ç ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡•É‡§•‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•´‡•™‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

Details
  • References
    • Punya Shloka Manjari
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: KanchiAradhanaDays
‡§®‡•á‡§§‡•ã‡§ú‡•Ä-‡§∂‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É #‡•©‡•™‡•¨

Event occured on 1676-06-29 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

(AShADha k4) - Netaji pAlkar ghar-vApasI.

After Shivaji’s escape from Agra, Aurangzeb, as a revenge, ordered Jai Singh to arrest Netaji Palkar. Netaji Palkar was then converted to Islam. His wives were thereafter brought to Delhi and also converted for him to remarry them in the Islamic way. Taking up the name of Muhammed Kuli Khan, Netaji Palkar was appointed as garrison commander of the Kandahar fort in Afghanistan. He tried to escape but was traced and trapped at Lahore. Thereafter on the battlefields of Kandhar and Kabul, he fought for the Mughals against rebel Pathans. Thus he gained the good faith of Aurangzeb and was sent to the Deccan along with Commander Diler Khan to conquer Shivaji’s territory. Here, after 8 years, Netaji joined Shivaji’s troops and went to Raigad. He peformed the prAyashchitta-s and made hindu again.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§™‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

‘‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§â‡§¶‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Ø‡•á‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ ' ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å‡•§

‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂-‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§É

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha). sthƒÅlƒ´paka·∏• is an important fortnightly ritual, involving the offering of havi·π£yƒÅnna to agni, with the offering being cooked on the fire itself.

  • ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞-‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§ú‡§§ ‡§ã‡§∑‡§≠ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Ä-‡§®‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É
‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞-‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • 18:46‚Üí19:53

Have darshan of Moon today, chanting the following shloka

‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∑‡§£‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö
‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ß‡§∞‡•ã ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§¨‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§É‡•§
‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ω‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡§É ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ü‡•Ä
‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡§ß‡§æ‡§§‡•Å ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§É‡••

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: ChandraDarshanam
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§ú‡§§ ‡§ã‡§∑‡§≠ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day, Nataraja gives darshan on a silver Rishabha vahanam.

‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É-04-02 , ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É-‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Éüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-17üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-11üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-10, Islamic: 1443-12-01 ·∏é≈´ al-·∏§ijjah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫13:09; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫27:54*; ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫10:42; ‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫13:09; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫26:15*; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (17.09¬∞ ‚Üí 16.26¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (29.65¬∞ ‚Üí 29.41¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (72.17¬∞ ‚Üí 72.42¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (134.48¬∞ ‚Üí 135.48¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (91.71¬∞ ‚Üí 92.58¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:00-12:23üåûÔ∏è-18:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî07:35; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî20:37
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:00-07:36; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:47; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:23-13:59; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:34-17:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:46-20:10
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:00-06:51; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:51-07:42; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:24-10:15; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:58-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:31-15:22; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:04-17:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:55-18:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:30-05:15; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:16-01:31
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:47-12:23; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî15:34-17:10; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:36-09:12
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:06); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§≤‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§ú‡§§-‡§ó‡§ú‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§ö‡•á‡§§‡§ï‡•ã ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ó‡§§‡§É #‡•™‡•™‡•¨, ‡§ú‡§ó‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§•-‡§∞‡§•-‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ, ‡§Æ‡§¶‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§Ü‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§≤‡•á‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§π‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø #‡•ß‡•ß‡•©
‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§≤‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on ≈öukla-Dvitƒ´yƒÅ tithi of ƒÄ·π£ƒÅ·∏çha·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialVratam
‡§ö‡•á‡§§‡§ï‡•ã ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ó‡§§‡§É #‡•™‡•™‡•¨

Event occured on 1576-07-01 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

After the fierce battle at haldIghATI, mahArANA pratAp wounded, as was his heroic horse chetak. Chetak succumbed on this day.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§ú‡§§-‡§ó‡§ú‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day, Nataraja gives darshan on a silver elephant vahanam.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§ú‡§ó‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§•-‡§∞‡§•-‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ

Observed on ≈öukla-Dvitƒ´yƒÅ tithi of ƒÄ·π£ƒÅ·∏çha·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: CommonFestivals OdishaTempleFestivals
‡§Æ‡§¶‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§Ü‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§≤‡•á‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§π‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø #‡•ß‡•ß‡•©

Event occured on 1909-07-01 (gregorian).

Madanlal Dhingra killed Curzon Wyllie, a distinguished British former soldier and head of secret police who were trying to get info about sAvarkar. Dhingra fired five shots right at his face, four of which hit their target.

Dhingra was tried in the Old Bailey on 23 July. He represented himself during his trial but did not recognize the legitimacy of the court. He said: “I hold the English people responsible for the murder of 80 millions of Indian people in the last fifty years, and they are also responsible for taking away ¬£100,000,000 every year from India to this country. … Just as the Germans have no right to occupy this country, so the English people have no right to occupy India, and it is perfectly justifiable on our part to kill the Englishman who is polluting our sacred land.” His supposed last words: “The only lesson required in India at present is to learn how to die, and the only way to teach it is by dying ourselves. My only prayer to God is that I may be re-born of the same mother and I may re-die in the same sacred cause till the cause is successful. Vande Mataram! "

Dhingra was heavily inspired by VD sAvarkar, but was disowned for his political activities by his father Gitta Mall, who was the Chief Medical Officer in Amritsar, who went so far as to publish his decision in newspaper advertisements. After his execution, Dhingra’s body was denied Hindu rites and buried. They refused to turn over the body to Savarkar. Bhagat Singh and Chandrasekhar Azad were inspired by him.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-07-02

‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É-04-03 , ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É-‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-18üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-12üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-11, Islamic: 1443-12-02 ·∏é≈´ al-·∏§ijjah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫15:17; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫11:28; ‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫15:17; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫28:15*; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (29.41¬∞ ‚Üí 29.17¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (16.26¬∞ ‚Üí 15.38¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (92.58¬∞ ‚Üí 93.45¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (135.48¬∞ ‚Üí 136.47¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (72.42¬∞ ‚Üí 72.67¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:01-12:23üåûÔ∏è-18:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî08:25; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî21:19
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:01-07:36; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:48; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:23-13:59; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:35-17:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:46-20:10
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:01-06:52; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:52-07:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:16; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:58-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:31-15:22; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:04-17:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:55-18:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:31-05:16; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:16-01:31
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:48; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî13:59-15:35; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî06:01-07:36
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:25); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§ï‡•à‡§≤‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡•Å‡§ó‡§¥‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§£‡•à ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•´‡•™) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§ï‡•à‡§≤‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day, Nataraja gives darshan on a Kailasha vahanam.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§™‡•Å‡§ó‡§¥‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§£‡•à ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•´‡•™) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on ƒÄ≈õrƒì·π£ƒÅ nakshatra of Mithunam (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Tags: NayanarGurupujai

2022-07-03

‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É-04-04 , ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É-‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-19üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-13üåûü™ê , ‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-12, Islamic: 1443-12-03 ·∏é≈´ al-·∏§ijjah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫17:07; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‚ñ∫06:28; ‡§Æ‡§ò‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚ñ∫12:02; ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫17:07; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫29:53*; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (93.45¬∞ ‚Üí 94.33¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (15.38¬∞ ‚Üí 14.46¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (136.47¬∞ ‚Üí 137.47¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (72.67¬∞ ‚Üí 72.92¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (29.17¬∞ ‚Üí 28.93¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:01-12:23üåûÔ∏è-18:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî09:14; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî21:59
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:01-07:36; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:48; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:23-13:59; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:35-17:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:46-20:10
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:01-06:52; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:52-07:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:16; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:58-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:31-15:22; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:04-17:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:55-18:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:31-05:16; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:16-01:31
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî17:10-18:46; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî12:23-13:59; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:35-17:10
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:07); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§≠‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§ü‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§∞‡§•‡§É, ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§µ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡§Ç ‡§π‡•à‡§¶‡§∞‡•á‡§£ #‡•®‡•¨‡•ß, ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ã‡§ú-‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á‡§Ø-‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É #‡•®‡•©, ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É #‡•®‡•©, ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§≠‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§ü‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§∞‡§•‡§É

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day, Nataraja gives darshan on a silver elephant vahanam.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§µ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡§Ç ‡§π‡•à‡§¶‡§∞‡•á‡§£ #‡•®‡•¨‡•ß

Event occured on 1761-07-03 (gregorian).

On 3rd july 1761, Haidar formally occupied the Fort at Srirangapatna and declared himself as “Sarvadhikari and Regent” to the King. Former dalavAi Karachuri Nanjarajaiah, who wanted to re-establish himself at Srirangapatna and had provided crucial assistance to Haidar upon being emotionally swayed, was deceived for the second time by Haidar.

Context
  • Khande Rao came in contact with Haidar Ali in August 1756 when the king entrusted him with 50k gold pieces to be given to Sahbas Sahib (brother of Haidar) and Haidar to enable them to raise an army to defeat the Dalawai brothers who had virtually imprisoned him (the king) in his own palace.
  • Haidar rose to power under Khande Rao with the countenence of Karachuri Nanjarajaiah. In 1758, Khande Rao was made “Dewan” on the recommendation of Haidar and the Dalawais (including Karachuri Nanjarajaiah) were side-lined.
  • By 1759, it was clear that Haidar was getting more and more revenue districts assigned to himself and Khande Rao had seen through Haidar’s intention to fleece the king.
  • The Wodeyar King sought the assistance of the Mahratta army and Khande Rao wrote several letters to George Pigout, Governor General at Madras for help.
  • On 26th August 1760, Khande Rao attacked Haidar at Srirangapatna but let Haidar flee out of sentiment, with the promise that he would retire away from maisUru. Haidar did not keep his promise - he tried regrouping and attacking.
  • Sadly, shortly thereafter marATha forces were recalled after the defeat at pANIpat.
  • Haidar rushed to the feet of the dalvai Karachuri Nanjarajaiah - the latter was swayed and basically let Haidar act on his behalf - sowing utter confusion in the maisUru king’s troops.
  • On 20th June 1761, the royalist divAn Khande Rao was surrendered to the new userper Haidar by a cornered Krishnaraja Wodeyar II.
Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§Æ‡§®‡•ã‡§ú-‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á‡§Ø-‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É #‡•®‡•©

Event occured on 1999-07-03 (gregorian).

Lieutenant Manoj Kumar Pandey, a young officer of the 1/11 Gorkha Rifles, died conquering Jubar Top from pAkistAni jihAdists on this day.

On the night of 2/3 July 1999, ‘B’ Company of 1/11 Gorkha Rifles approached Jubar top along a narrow ridge. He surged ahead of his troops and charged at the enemy with a full-throated battle cry (‡§ú‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä! ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡§ñ‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä!) through a hail of bullets. Fearlessly assaulting the first enemy position, he killed two enemy personnel and destroyed the second position by killing two more. Although wounded in the shoulder and leg, he pressed on his solitary charge with grim determination, until he closed in on the first bunker. He continued to lead the assault on the fourth position urging his men and destroyed the same with a grenade, even as he got a fatal Medium Machine Gun burst on his forehead.

Entries in Pandey’s personal diary:

  • ‘If death strikes before I prove my blood, I promise (swear), I will kill death!’
  • ‘Some goals are so worthy, it’s glorious even to fail!’
Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É #‡•®‡•©

Event occured on 1999-07-03 (gregorian).

The final assault on Tiger Hill began on 3 July at 17:15 during Kargil war/ operation vijay.

After artillery pounding for 13 hours, 2 Naga advanced on the right and 8 Sikh advanced on the left. They used unexpected, and therefore difficult, avenues of approach. ghAtak commandoes of 18 Grenadiers advanced up the rear. Just as they reached the top, they were spotted and fired upon. In the early morning hours of 4th July, Yogendra yAdav despite being hit by multiple bullets, climbed up, crawled to the first bunker, downed 4 pAki solidiers with a grenade, charged a second bunker with two others. Hit by 21 bullets, he was to receive PVC later. Maj. Ravinder Singh of 8 Sikh with 200 soldiers launched a daring attack to relieve them.

Aftermath- Most of the Sikh soldiers attacked without cold weather gear, and many of the wounded died from exposure. 18 Grenadiers seized the 16,700-foot (5,062 m) Tiger Hill Top on the morning of 8 July.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on ≈öukla-Caturthƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (MadhyƒÅhna·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Shukla Chaturthi Vratam for Lord Ganesha.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyVratam ShuklaChaturthiVratam

2022-07-04

‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É-04-05 , ‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É-‡§Æ‡§ò‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-20üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-14üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123

  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É

  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫12:17; ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫18:33; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫

  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (72.92¬∞ ‚Üí 73.17¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (94.33¬∞ ‚Üí 95.20¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (137.47¬∞ ‚Üí 138.47¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (14.46¬∞ ‚Üí 13.49¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (28.93¬∞ ‚Üí 28.68¬∞)

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:01-12:24üåûÔ∏è-18:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî10:02; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî22:38
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:01-07:37; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:48; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:24-13:59; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:35-17:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:46-20:11
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:01-06:52; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:52-07:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:16; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:58-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:31-15:22; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:04-17:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:55-18:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:31-05:16; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:16-01:31
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:37-09:12; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:48-12:24; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:59-15:35
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:25); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§•‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§É, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä-‡§ó‡•å‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§¶-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§∞‡§•‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§É

The Brahmotsavam of Nataraja at Chidambaram happens specially around the Aani Thirumanjana festival each year, for ten days. On this day is the rathotsava or chariot festival.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on MaghƒÅ nakshatra of Mithunam (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Edit config file

‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§¶-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä

Observed on ≈öukla-Pa√±camƒ´ tithi of ƒÄ·π£ƒÅ·∏çha·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on every occurrence of Vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏• yoga (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti).

Vyatipata Shraddha day.

2022-07-05

‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É-04-06 , ‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ-03-21üåûüåå , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§É-04-15üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-04-14, Islamic: 1443-12-05 ·∏é≈´ al-·∏§ijjah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Ü‡§®‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§π‡§æ‡•ú‡•ç‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§π‡§æ‡§∞
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Ü‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‚ñ∫19:28; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫10:28; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫12:11; ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫07:05; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫19:28; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (13.49¬∞ ‚Üí 12.48¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (95.20¬∞ ‚Üí 96.08¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (73.17¬∞ ‚Üí 73.42¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (28.68¬∞ ‚Üí 28.44¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (138.47¬∞ ‚Üí 139.47¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:01-12:24üåûÔ∏è-18:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî10:50; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî23:16
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:01-07:37; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:48; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:24-13:59; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:35-17:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî18:46-20:11
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:01-06:52; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî06:52-07:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:16; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:58-12:49; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:31-15:22; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî17:04-17:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:55-18:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:31-05:16; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:16-01:31
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:35-17:11; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:48; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:24-13:59
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:07); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§∞‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•¨) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•©‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•®‡•Æ‡•¨, ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§®‡§ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∏‡§≠‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡•á‡§ï‡§É, ‡§®‡§ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∞‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§©‡§ø ‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§©‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§∞‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•¨) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on P≈´rvaphalgunƒ´ nakshatra of Mithunam (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Tags: NayanarGurupujai
‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á ‡§®‡§ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∏‡§≠‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡•á‡§ï‡§É

‡§Æ‡•å‡§≤‡•å ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ-‡§∂‡§∂‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•å ‡§ï‡§∞‡§ö‡§∞‡§£‡§§‡§≤‡•á ‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§≤‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ ‡§≠‡•Å‡§ú‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ:
‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•á ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ ‡§π‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ó‡§ø‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡•Å‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡•§
‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§§‡§µ ‡§ï‡§®‡§ï‡§∏‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§• ‡§∏‡•ã‡§¢‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•ç‡§µ ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø:
‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§§‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡§ø ‡§® ‡§§‡•á ‡§®‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•á‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: TamilnaduTempleFestivals
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•©‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•®‡•Æ‡•¨

Observed on ≈öukla-·π¢a·π£·π≠hƒ´ tithi of ƒÄ·π£ƒÅ·∏çha·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3838 (Kali era).

Born near the VedƒÅchala mountain as the son of VimalƒÅk·π£a and well-known as Su≈õƒ´lakamalƒÅk·π£a, after renunciation became Citsukha; having had the authority of the preceptorship of KƒÅ√±ci, He lived in the caves of Sahya mountain. He, having installed/deputed CitsukhƒÅnanda Yogƒ´ndra in his place, vanished fully on the sixth day of the bright fortnight of the month of ƒÄ·π£ƒÅ·∏çha of the year DhƒÅtu. His preceptorship was for twenty-seven years.

‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§æ‡§ö‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§≠‡§µ‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§®‡§É ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§®‡•Å‡§É ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∂‡•Ä‡§≤‡§ï‡§Æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§§‡§®‡•Å‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ï‡•ã‡§ü‡•Ä‡§™‡•Ä‡§†‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§µ‡•ã‡§Ω‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡§§‡•ç ‡§∏ ‡§∏‡§π‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡••‡•¨‡•Æ‡••
‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§ú‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§∞‡•á‡•§
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ß‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§∏ ‡§ß‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡•á‡••‡•¨‡•Ø‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä
