‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§É

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha). sthƒÅlƒ´paka·∏• is an important fortnightly ritual, involving the offering of havi·π£yƒÅnna to agni, with the offering being cooked on the fire itself.

2022-11-10

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-17 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É-‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-07-24üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-19üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-19, Islamic: 1444-04-15 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ê‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§∏‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ï‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ï, ‡§Ö- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡§ø
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫18:33; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä‚ñ∫29:05*; ‡§Æ‡•É‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§Æ‡•ç‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ò‡§É‚ñ∫21:07; ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫18:33; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-0.81¬∞ ‚Üí -1.40¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-4.60¬∞ ‚Üí -4.85¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-91.27¬∞ ‚Üí -90.29¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-131.54¬∞ ‚Üí -130.49¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (142.78¬∞ ‚Üí 143.94¬∞)

  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:19-07:05; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:05-07:51; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:08; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:40-12:26; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:01-17:47

2022-11-11

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-18 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É-‡§Æ‡•É‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§Æ‡•çüåõüåå , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-07-25üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-20üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-20, Islamic: 1444-04-16 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ê‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§∏‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ï‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ï, ‡§Ö- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡§ø

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫20:17; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫

  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫21:23; ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫07:22; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫20:17; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-4.85¬∞ ‚Üí -5.10¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-1.40¬∞ ‚Üí -1.99¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (143.94¬∞ ‚Üí 145.12¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-90.29¬∞ ‚Üí -89.32¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-130.49¬∞ ‚Üí -129.44¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:20-12:03üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî08:34; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî20:12
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:20-07:46; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:11-10:37; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:03-13:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:21
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:20-07:06; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:06-07:51; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:09; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:40-12:26; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:01-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:39-05:30; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:48-01:19
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:37-12:03; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:21; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:46-09:11
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫10:54); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ì‡§¨‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä #‡•ß, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•Ø ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ï‡•É‡§™‡§æ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•Ø‡•´‡•™, ‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§∏‡•Å‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•Ø ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ï‡•É‡§™‡§æ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•Ø‡•´‡•™

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-TrÃ•tƒ´yƒÅ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3170 (Kali era).

K·πõpƒÅ≈õa·πÖkara, son of ƒÄtmasomayƒÅji in Andhra in the lineage of Garga, with the name Ga·πÖgayya before initiation established six religions of worship in worshipping ≈öiva, Hari, Skanda and others away from Tantrik practices and establishing everywhere the non-dualism enunciated in the Vedas, drove away the notion of dualism. K·πõpƒÅ≈õa·πÖkara established ≈örƒ´ Vi≈õvar≈´pa at ≈ö·πõ·πÖgeri under the directions of ≈örƒ´ Kaivalya Munƒ´ndra and formulated precepts; having adorned ƒÄcƒÅrya Pƒ´·π≠ha for forty-one years, he departed in the direction of Kubera, viz. North and attained siddhi at Vindhyas. The mighty omniscient (K·πõpƒÅ≈õa·πÖkara), the One without a second, attained the supreme non-dual state of the Ultimate known as parƒÅpara which is full of Supreme Bliss on the third day of the dark fortnight in the month of KƒÅrtika in the year Vibhava.

‡§Ü‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§®‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§ó‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ-
‡§≠‡§ø‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡§∑‡§£‡•ç‡§Æ‡§§‡§É ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§µ‡§®‡§ø‡•§
‡§§‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•à‡§ï‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡•ã‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç
‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡§ï‡§•‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•É‡§™‡§æ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§É‡••‡•ß‡•≠‡••
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ï‡•à‡§µ‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§®‡§µ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§ß‡§Ç
‡§∂‡•É‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•á‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•á ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö‡•§
‡§ö‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§è‡§ï‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§≠‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•Ä‡§†‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∂‡§Ç
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§Ø‡•à‡§°‡§µ‡§ø‡§°‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Æ‡§≠‡§ú‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§ï‡•É‡§™‡§æ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§É‡••‡•ß‡•Æ‡••
‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§µ‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•Å‡§∞‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§É ‡§™‡§∞‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§É‡•§
‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡•Ä‡§®‡§Æ‡•á‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•ß‡•Ø‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

Details
  • References
    • Punya Shloka Manjari
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: KanchiAradhanaDays
‡§ì‡§¨‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä #‡•ß

Event occured on 2021-11-11 (gregorian).

On this day, Karnataka government began celebrating Obavva jayantI to honor the deeds of onake obavva of chitradurga.

Events

Onake Obavva, the wife of a common soldier, while fetching water during one of the several sieges of the fort, heard the muffled sound of enemy soldiers attempting to enter the fort walls through a small crevice that was just big enough for one person at a time to crawl through. Hiding silently next to the crevice with an onake, or pestle, she killed each soldier as his head appeared in the opening and dragged his body inside the wall. By the time her husband and others came to her aid, many dead soldiers lay around her. Onake Obavva’s courage and quick thinking single-handedly saved the fort that day.

Aftermath

Chitradurga anyway fell to Hyder Ali later. But Obavva was never forgotten.

Her bravery is commemorated in Chitradurga by the name of Onake Obavva Stadium and by an extraordinary new sculpture near the DC Office. In 2021, Karnataka government started celebrating Obavva jayantI on Nov 11 (one day after the purported, but mistaken, Tipu birth day as per Julian calendar).

Famous picturizations - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tdNjRgW3hBk

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§∏‡•Å‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-TrÃ•tƒ´yƒÅ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

2022-11-12

  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:40-05:30; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:48-01:19

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ó‡§£‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§π‡§∞-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§™‡•Å‡§∞-‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡§®-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂-‡§ò‡•ã‡§∑‡§£‡§æ #‡•Æ‡•≠, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•®‡•¨‡•¶, ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•©‡•´‡•´
‡§ó‡§£‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§π‡§∞-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as ga·πáƒÅdhipa-mahƒÅga·πáapati·∏•. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

‡§ó‡§£‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§∂ ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡•§
‡§ï‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ö‡§Ø‡•á‡§∂‡§æ‡§® ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§¶‡•á‡§π‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•á‡••

‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§¶‡§æ ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•á ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•à ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§®‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§ó‡§£‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§™‡§É‡•• (‡§≠‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç)

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyVratam SankataharaChaturthiVratam
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•®‡•¨‡•¶

Event occured on 1762-11-12 (gregorian).

On this day, to keep marATha unity and strength in the face of an ambitious nizAm, mAdhav rAv surrendered to his stupidly greedy uncle raghunAth rAv. The contrast between the two - whether in terms of ethics, capability or longevity is huge.

Context: He decided to wage a war against his uncle Raghunathrao on November 7, 1762. However, Madhavrao didn’t wish to battle against his own uncle and thus, proposed for a treaty. Raghunathrao agreed to sign the treaty with Madhavrao and asked him to move back to a non-attacking position. Madhavrao did so. However, Raghunathrao deceived Madhavrao. When the Maratha camp under Madhavrao was relaxed and unsuspecting of a battle, they were caught unawared as Raghunathrao attacked treacherously. Thus, Madhavrao was defeated in the Battle of Alegaon and on November 12, 1762 surrendered himself to Raghunathrao near Alegaon. After the surrender, Raghunathrao decided to control all the major decisions under the assistance of Sakharam Bapu. He also decided to befriend Nizam, but this proved to be a wrong masterplan as the Nizam slowly started infiltrating the zones of Maratha Empire. As time slipped by, Madhavrao pointed out the gravity of the situation to his uncle. Eventually on March 7, 1763 the Peshwas, once again under Madhavrao’s leadership, decided to attack Aurangabad to crush Nizam.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•©‡•´‡•´

Event occured on 1667-11-12 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

Ahom ruler Chakradhvaja Singha (Supangmung, 1663-1670) recaptures Itakhuli (shukreshvara hill) and some other guvahATi garrissons from Mogol governor Sayed Firoj Khan. The enemy was chased down to the mouth of the Manaha river, the old boundary between Assam and Mughal India (prior to Mir Jumla’s campaign). On receiving the news of victory the king cried out-“It is now that I can eat my morsel of food with ease and pleasure”.

Background: Aurangzeb, after ascending on the throne of Delhi, ordered Mir Jumla to invade Cooch Behar and Assam and re-establish Mughal prestige in eastern India. The western Ahom kingdom was then rife with envy and resentment. So, in 1662 he had succeeded. King Jayadhvaja retreated to the hills, abandoning much treasure, later sent his daughter and niece to mogol harem. Chakradhwaj Singha, who succeeded him, was against any payment at all on principle. He shouted out from his throne: ‚Äì “Death is preferable to a life of subordination to foreigners”. In 1665 the king summoned an assembly of his ministers and nobles and ordered them to adopt measures for expelling the Mughals from western Assam, adding‚Äî“My ancestors were never subordinate to any other people; and I for myself cannot remain under the vassalage of any foreign power. I am a descendant of the Heavenly King and how can I pay tribute to the wretched foreigners.”

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§™‡•Å‡§∞-‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡§®-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂-‡§ò‡•ã‡§∑‡§£‡§æ #‡•Æ‡•≠

Event occured on 1935-11-12 (gregorian).

On this day, Maharaja Chithira Thirunal Balarama Varma of Travancore issued the Temple Entry Proclamation.

Context

Kerala is a rare state where caste discrimination actually led to conversion to abrahamist faiths because converts got more rights than low jAti-s. In other states, the primary factor in conversion was and remains selectively targetted allurements, supposed miracles and threats.

Vaikom Satyagraha protests sought equal rights of access in areas previously restricted to members of upper castes. The protests expanded to become a movement seeking rights of access to the interior of the temples themselves. Regent Maharani Sethu Lakshmi Bayi yielded partly - deferring to her minor nephew (who supposedly assured gAndhI on his own will).

Implementation

Chithira Thirunal signed the Proclamation on the eve of his 24th birthday in 1936. He was ably supported by his divAn Sachivottama Sir Chetput Pattabhiraman Ramaswami Iyer, who clarified that the decision was a result of his own free will and not the result of protests or advice; and carefully managed its acceptance and implementation.

Aftermath

The Travancore Temple Entry Proclamation did not have a serious influence in Cochin or British Malabar as the Maharajah of Cochin and the Zamorin were staunch opponents of temple entry for dalits. Even when universal temple entry was granted in 1947 the Cochin maharajah made an exemption in the bill so as to keep his family temple, “Sree Poornathrayeesha”, out of the purview of temple entry.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-11-13

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-20 , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-07-27üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-22üåûü™ê , ‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-22, Islamic: 1444-04-18 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ê‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§∏‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ï‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ï, ‡§Ö- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡§ø
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫24:52*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫10:15; ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å‡§É‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫22:44; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫11:37; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫24:52*; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-2.57¬∞ ‚Üí -3.15¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-5.35¬∞ ‚Üí -5.60¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-128.39¬∞ ‚Üí -127.35¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-88.35¬∞ ‚Üí -87.38¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (146.32¬∞ ‚Üí 147.53¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:21-12:03üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî10:14; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî21:53
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:21-07:46; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:38; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:03-13:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:20
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:21-07:06; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:06-07:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:23-10:09; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:40-12:26; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:40-05:30; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:48-01:19
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî16:20-17:46; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî12:03-13:29; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫10:55); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

2022-11-14

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-21 , ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç-‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å‡§Éüåõüåå , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-07-28üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-23üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-23, Islamic: 1444-04-19 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ê‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§∏‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ï‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ï, ‡§Ö- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡§ø
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‚ñ∫27:24*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å‡§É‚ñ∫13:12; ‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§É‚ñ∫23:36; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫14:08; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫27:24*; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-3.15¬∞ ‚Üí -3.72¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-5.60¬∞ ‚Üí -5.84¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-127.35¬∞ ‚Üí -126.31¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-87.38¬∞ ‚Üí -86.41¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (147.53¬∞ ‚Üí 148.75¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:21-12:03üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî11:00; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî22:43
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:21-07:47; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:12-10:38; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:03-13:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:20
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:21-07:07; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:07-07:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:24-10:09; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:41-12:26; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:40-05:31; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:48-01:19
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:47-09:12; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:38-12:03; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:29-14:55
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:24); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï-‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§É, ‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§≤‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£-‡§Æ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É, ‡§∏‡•á‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ-‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•´‡•©
‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï-‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§É

Do puja to Shiva/Parvati, perform fast.

‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§π‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§∂ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡§¶‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡••
—‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ‡§• ‡§ú‡§ó‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•á‡•§
‡§Ö‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ï‡•ã‡§ü‡§ø‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞ ‡••
—‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§§‡•á‡§ú‡§∏‡•á‡•§
‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§Ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
—‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§¶‡§ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§∂‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§®‡•á‡•§
‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡••
—‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡•à ‡§®‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§ø ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§ø‡•§
‡§Ö‡§®‡§ò‡•á ‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡•á ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§ø ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•Ä‡§¶ ‡§Æ‡•á‡••
—‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡••
—‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§∂ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡•§
‡§∂‡•à‡§≤‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•á ‡§®‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡•ã‡••
—‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

[‡§®‡•Ä‡§≤‡§ï‡§£‡•ç‡§†-‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•ã‡§ú-‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§´‡•Å‡§∞‡§ø‡§§-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§∏‡•§
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•ã‡§É ‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•á‡§π‡§ø ‡§ö‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§§‡•á‡••
—‡§ö‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)]

Details
  • References
    • Skanda Puranam
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthWeekdayFestivals
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É
  • 08:07‚Üí

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 360, it is sƒÅyana-vaidhrÃ•ti·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Combinations
‡§∏‡•á‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ-‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•´‡•©

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-·π¢a·π£·π≠hƒ´ tithi of TulƒÅ (sidereal solar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 5071 (Kali era).

Aradhana Day of Sri Anantarama Dikshitar.

‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§≤‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£-‡§Æ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É

Beginning of Gangakarshana Mahotsava in Thiruvisanallur. See also http://www.sriayyaval.org/ .

‡§à‡§∂‡•á ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§§‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§Æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§Æ ‡§ö ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ö‡•§
‡§à‡§∂‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ ‡§ï‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡§æ ‡§ö ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§Ç
‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á ‡§®‡§∞‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ï‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§µ‡•á‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡••

2022-11-15

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-22 , ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É-‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Éüåõüåå , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-07-29üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-24üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-24, Islamic: 1444-04-20 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ê‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§∏‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ï‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ï, ‡§Ö- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡§ø

  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123

  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫29:50*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫16:10; ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫24:25*; ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫16:38; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫29:50*; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-5.84¬∞ ‚Üí -6.09¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-3.72¬∞ ‚Üí -4.29¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-126.31¬∞ ‚Üí -125.28¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-86.41¬∞ ‚Üí -85.44¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (148.75¬∞ ‚Üí 149.99¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:21-12:04üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî11:44; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî23:32
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:21-07:47; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:38; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:04-13:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:20
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:21-07:07; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:07-07:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:24-10:10; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:41-12:26; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:41-05:31; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:48-01:19
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:38; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:04-13:29
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫10:55); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É, ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§π‡§§‡§É #‡•™‡•Ø‡•¨
‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§π‡§§‡§É #‡•™‡•Ø‡•¨

Event occured on 1526-11-15 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On this day, Hemachandra vikramAditya, aka Hemu, was vanquished by mogols invading under akbar and his regent bairAm khAn (though they stayed in the rear - 8 miles away). This king, also known as Vikramaditya had won 22 battles against the Afghan rebels from 1553‚Äì1556 from Punjab to Bengal, and had his coronation at Purana Quila in Delhi on 7 October 1556 and had established ‚ÄòHindu Raj‚Äô in North India, before the 2nd battle of Panipat.

Events

Hemu was aided by afghAn-s who had been earlier deposed by bAbur’s invasion. Hemu was atop an elephant named hawAi. His left was led by his sister’s son, Ramya, and the right by Shadi Khan Kakkar.

Mogol army was led by Ali Quli Khan Shaibani in the center, Sikandar Khan Uzbak on the right and Abdulla Khan Uzbak towards the left. Vanguard led by Husain Quli Beg and Shah Quli Mahram.

Both the wings of the Mughal army had been driven back and Hemu moved his contingent of war elephants and cavalry forward to crush their centre. Hemu was on the cusp of victory when he was wounded in the eye by a Mughal arrow and collapsed unconscious. This triggered a panic in his army which broke formation and fled.

Aftermath

The elephant carrying the wounded Hemu was captured and led to the Mughal camp. Bairam Khan asked the 13-year-old Akbar to behead Hemu, but he refused to take the sword to a dying man. Akbar was persuaded to touch Hemu’s head with his sword after which Bairam Khan executed him. Hemu’s head was sent to Kabul while his body was gibbeted on a gate in Delhi. A minaret was subsequently constructed of the heads of the other dead.

Hemu’s family who lived in Machari (near Alwar) was captured by Pir Muhammad. Pir Muhammad offered to spare the life of Hemu’s elderly father if he converted to Islam. When the old man refused, he was executed. Hemu’s Smadhi Sthal, constructed during Akbar’s reign by supporters, supposedly on the spot where he died, is now occupied by migrant muslims and converted to a dargAh.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É
  • ‚Üí08:59

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 360, it is sƒÅyana-vaidhrÃ•ti·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Combinations

2022-11-16

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-23 , ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É-‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-07-30üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-25üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-25, Islamic: 1444-04-21 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ê‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§∏‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§ï‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ï, ‡§Ö- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡§ø
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‚ñ∫18:56; ‡§Æ‡§ò‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫18:45; ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫25:02*; ‡§á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫18:57; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-6.09¬∞ ‚Üí -6.34¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-4.29¬∞ ‚Üí -4.85¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (149.99¬∞ ‚Üí 151.24¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-125.28¬∞ ‚Üí -124.24¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-85.44¬∞ ‚Üí -84.47¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:22-12:04üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî12:25; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî00:20*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:22-07:47; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:38; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:04-13:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:20
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:22-07:07; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:07-07:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:24-10:10; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:41-12:27; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:41-05:31; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:48-01:20
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:04-13:29; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî07:47-09:13; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:38-12:04
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:27); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§¶‡•Ä‡§™-‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•™‡•® ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ò‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•® ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•¶‡•™‡•´, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•™‡•Ø ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•© ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•≠‡•≠‡•¨, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•´‡•Æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§Ü‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•©‡•Æ‡•´, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§≠‡•à‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä, ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®-‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä), ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä, ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï-‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§™‡§¶‡•Ä-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡•ß‡•Ø‡•ß‡•´-‡§≤‡§µ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•ß‡•¶‡•≠
‡•ß‡•Ø‡•ß‡•´-‡§≤‡§µ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•ß‡•¶‡•≠

Event occured on 1915-11-16 (gregorian).

viShNu gaNesha pingale and kartAr singh were executed by hanging by the British. They were active conspirators in the attempted mutiny (with German collaboration) under rAsh behArI bAsu. They were betrayed by spies such as Kirpal Singh.

End of a month long offering of Akasha Dipam.

‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•™‡•® ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ò‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•® ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•¶‡•™‡•´

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 4079 (Kali era).

Then Narasambha·π≠·π≠a, son of Subrahmanya, having been initiated by Ga·πÖgƒÅdhara got the appellation BrahmƒÅnandaghana held the preceptorship of the Pƒ´·π≠ha for twenty-eight years. This great preceptor merged in the Lord ƒ™≈õvara as He was teaching the disciples the Brahmas≈´tra, bhƒÅ·π£ya etc. in the early morning of A·π£·π≠ami of K·πõ·π£·πáapak·π£a in the month of KƒÅrtika in the year ƒ™≈õvara.

‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§≠‡§µ‡•ã ‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§∞‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•ã‡§Ω‡§• ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç
‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ò‡§®‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§ß‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ß‡§ø‡§§ ‡§ß‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Ç‡§®‡§æ‡§É ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•™‡•Ø ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•© ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•≠‡•≠‡•¨

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 4348 (Kali era).

Son of ChƒÅyƒÅvana Acyuta, He was Gurum≈´rti by name (before initiation); having adorned the seat of Jagadguru for forty-seven years, He attained on the night of KƒÅlƒÅ·π£·π≠amƒ´ of the month KƒÅrtika in the year ParƒÅbhava‚Äîthe Supreme state denoted by the term ParamƒÅtman.

‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§®‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§∏‡•Å‡§§‡•ã ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ
‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡§¶‡•á ‡§õ‡§µ‡§ø(‡•™‡•≠)‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•´‡•Æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§Ü‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•©‡•Æ‡•´

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 4739 (Kali era).

Vi≈õve≈õvara was the son of Vi≈õvamakhindra; resorting to the fact of Para≈õivƒÅrya, known as Nava≈õa·πÖkara from the first preceptor toured all places successfully, from Setu (RƒÅme≈õvaram) to Sƒ´tƒÅgiri (Himalayas). Since He possessed intellect more than anyone in the Universe, men of wisdom call him Vi≈õvƒÅdhika and Nava≈õa·πÖkara. His erudition in composing works such as Rudra bhƒÅ·π£ya is beyond words‚Äîimmeasurable. The preceptor Vi≈õvƒÅdhikendra carrying out the responsibilities of preceptor for fifty-two years, (later) handing over the responsibilities to BodhendrƒÅrya, and proceeding in southern direction reached eternal abode, meditating on Lord ≈öiva with the crescent moon in the crown, on the banks of river Garu·∏ça on the eighth day of the black fortnight in the month of TulƒÅ of the year ƒ™≈õvara. This preceptor ≈örƒ´ Nava≈õa·πÖkara residing on the banks of river Trida≈õa was revered by eminent men, departed in the southern direction and attained siddhi on the banks of river Garu·∏ça after handing over the responsibilities to the disciple ≈örƒ´ BhagavannƒÅma Bodhendra.

‡§µ‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§ö‡§≤‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§µ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§ñ‡•Ä‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•Ç‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç-
‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§É ‡§™‡§∞‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§É‡•§
‡§Ü‡§∏‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§ó‡§ø‡§∞‡§ø ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡§ú‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞
‡§Ü‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§∏ ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•ã‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Ü‡§∏‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•¨‡••
‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ß‡§ø‡§∑‡§£‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§§ ‡§è‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç-
‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§®‡§ò‡§æ ‡§®‡§µ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß-
‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§ï‡•å‡§∂‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•≠‡••
‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§∂‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§π‡§®‡•ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§ß‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§ó‡§∞‡•Å‡§°‡§æ‡§™‡§ó‡§æ‡§§‡§ü‡§≠‡•Å‡§µ‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡§§‡•ç ‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§∞‡§ß‡•Å‡§∞‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-
‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§®‡•Ä‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•á ‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§ø ‡§¶‡§ß‡§§‡•ç ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§ö‡•Ç‡§°‡§æ‡§Æ‡§£‡§ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•Æ‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∂‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§≠‡•à‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (Prad≈ç·π£a·∏•/puurvaviddha).

‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Very famously celebrated in Vaikom Mahadeva Temple.

‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä)

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 12:04‚Üí17:46

When the transit of the Sun (sa·πÖkrƒÅnti) happens in the second half of the day (aparƒÅh·πáa) and before midnight, the second half of the day is a pu·πáyakƒÅla for various observances. In addition to 16 ghatikas on either side of the transition, and specific pu·πáyakƒÅlas like ·π£a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti, vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ etc., this is also useful, especially in cases where the other pu·πáyakƒÅlas are inconvenient for appropriate performance of rituals such as snƒÅna, dƒÅna, tarpa·πáa, etc.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®-‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

End of Tula Kaveri Snanam. Also known as ta:ka·∏çaimugam.

‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï-‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§™‡§¶‡•Ä-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 12:21‚Üí17:46

V·πõ≈õchika-Ravi-Sa·πÖkrama·πáa-Vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ Punyakala. Do danam of deepam.

‡§ï‡•Ä‡§ü‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡•á ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§ö‡••
—‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•å‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≠‡•á
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§™‡§É‚Äî
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§π‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••

2022-11-17

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-23 , ‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É-‡§Æ‡§ò‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-08-01üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-26üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-26, Islamic: 1444-04-22 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫07:57; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§®‡§µ‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§ò‡§æ‚ñ∫21:18; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫25:18*; ‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫07:57; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫20:50; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-4.85¬∞ ‚Üí -5.41¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-6.34¬∞ ‚Üí -6.59¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-124.24¬∞ ‚Üí -123.21¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (151.24¬∞ ‚Üí 152.50¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-84.47¬∞ ‚Üí -83.51¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:22-12:04üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî13:04; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî01:08*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:22-07:48; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:39; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:04-13:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:20
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:22-07:08; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:08-07:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:10; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:41-12:27; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:43; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:41-05:32; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:49-01:20
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:29-14:55; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî06:22-07:48; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:39
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ (‚ñ∫13:58); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§§‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ-‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§≤-‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É, ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§°‡§µ‡§©‡•ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¥‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡•Å
‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ-‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§≤-‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É

Observed on day 1 of VrÃ•≈õcika·∏• (sidereal solar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Conduct Veda parayanam in the evening, during (or at least on one of) these 48 days.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialPeriodStart CommonFestivals
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§°‡§µ‡§©‡•ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¥‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡•Å

Nadha Sharma (ta:mu·∏çavan{}, i.e. lame man) and his wife Anavidyambikai came to Mayavaram in order to perform a tulƒÅ snƒÅnam in Kaveri. However, by the time they arrived, it was the last day of tulƒÅ mƒÅsa and they could not complete the snƒÅnam. They were disappointed yet spent their time doing Puja of the Lord, who appeared in their dreams and asked them to take a bath next morning (1st day of Vrschika) and reap full benefits of the Tula Kaveri Snanam itself!

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: CommonFestivals

2022-11-18

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-24 , ‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-08-02üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-27üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-27, Islamic: 1444-04-23 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§®‡§µ‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫09:33; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫23:05; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫25:05*; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫09:33; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫22:07; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-6.59¬∞ ‚Üí -6.83¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-5.41¬∞ ‚Üí -5.96¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-123.21¬∞ ‚Üí -122.18¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-83.51¬∞ ‚Üí -82.54¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (152.50¬∞ ‚Üí 153.78¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:23-12:04üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî13:43; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî01:57*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:23-07:48; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:13-10:39; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:04-13:30; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:20
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:23-07:08; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:08-07:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:10; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:41-12:27; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:42-05:32; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:49-01:20
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:39-12:04; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:48-09:13
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫10:56); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•®‡•Æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•ß ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•™‡•®‡•®, ‡§§‡•à‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§∞-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•¨‡•®‡•™, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ-‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡§É #‡•®‡•´‡•¶, ‡§∞‡•á‡•õ‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó-‡§≤‡§æ-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•¨‡•¶, ‡§µ‡•à‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•®‡•Æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•ß ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•™‡•®‡•®

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Da≈õamƒ´ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3702 (Kali era).

Son of BhƒÅnumi≈õra of BhadrƒÅcala, ≈öe·π£anƒÅrya (before initiation), He (BhadrƒÅcala MahƒÅdeva), having adorned/decorated the seat of the ƒÄdiguru, attained that Supreme state attainable by/to the great saints who were adepts in subduing senses, on the tenth day of the black fortnight in the year Raudrƒ´. He also attained beatitude in KƒÅ√±ci. His preceptorship was for twenty-four years.

‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡§≤‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§ú‡§®‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∏‡•Å‡§§‡§É ‡§∏ ‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ω‡§≠‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§Æ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•§
‡§∞‡•å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§¶‡§∂‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡§§‡•ç ‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§ø‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•á‡§É ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§æ‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•´‡•≠‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

Details
  • References
    • Punya Shloka Manjari

  • Tags: KanchiAradhanaDays
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ-‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡§É #‡•®‡•´‡•¶

Event occured on 1772-11-18 (gregorian).

The young but bold and astute visionary, peshvA mAdhava rAv, died of tuberculosis at his favourite Ganesha Chintamani Temple, Theur. Aged 28. Before he died, he had succeeded in reuniting the confrederacy. Grant Duff - “And the plains of Panipat were not more fatal to the Maratha Empire than the early end of this excellent prince‚Ä¶”

Context: Madhavrao was infected with intestinal tuberculosis in May 1770. This disease is characterised by unbearable abdominal pain. Pain was such, that during his last days Madhavrao once asked for a dagger from his uncle to cut his belly so that he might escape from the terrible suffering! Madhavrao’s last days were unfortunately very painful.

He died on 18 November 1772 at 11 o’ clock in the morning, with the word ‘Gajanan’ on his lips. Thousands of citizens visited the site and paid their last respects. Madhavrao was cremated on the banks of the river which was about half a mile from the temple. A small memorial carved out of stone rests today at that place as a memorial. His wife Ramabai chose to commit sati with his body at the time of cremation, even though Brahmin widows were not required to follow the ritual.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∞‡•á‡•õ‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó-‡§≤‡§æ-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•¨‡•¶

Event occured on 1962-11-18 (gregorian).

On this day, during the Sino-Indian War in 1962, Charlie ‚ÄòC‚Äô company of 13 Kumaon, consisting of 124 Ahirs, heroically stopped Chinese at Rezang La. 114 out of about 120 Indians died killing about 1k Chinese soldiers.

The fight

The company was led by Major Shaitan Singh, who won a posthumous Param Vir Chakra for his actions. From the Indian point of view, Rezang La had the drawback that an intervening feature blocked artillery operation, so that the Indian infantry had to do without artillery cover.

When Rezang La was later revisited dead jawans were found in the trenches still holding on to their weapons… every single man of this company was found dead in his trench with several bullets or splinter wounds. The 2-inch mortar man died with a bomb still in his hand. The medical orderly had a syringe and bandage in his hands when the Chinese bullet hit him… Of the thousand mortar bombs with the defenders, all but seven had been fired and the rest were ready to be fired when the (mortar) section was overrun.

Aftermath

The inscription on the War Memorial at Chushul, Ladakh raised by the Indian Army in memory of the soldiers who died in the Battle of Rezang La, reads as below:

How can a man die better,
Than facing fearful odds,
For the ashes of his fathers,
And temples of his gods.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§§‡•à‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§∞-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•¨‡•®‡•™

Event occured on 1398-11-18 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On this day, Taimur captured Bhatnair fort from Rai Dalachandra.

Events (from MT)

The fort of Bhatnair stood on this road and offered formidable defense against the invader. Timur promptly besieged the fort after sweeping through the countryside and forced Rai Dalachandra into the defensive. On 10th November 1398, he suddenly assaulted fort with giant fort-breaking ballistas that hurled huge rocks over a ton on the fort walls. Prince Shah Rukh, Mazid al Baghdadi and Jahan Maliq, Timur‚Äôs fierce generals, led the assault on the Hindus. The Hindus retaliated with a heavy rain of fireworks from their ramparts, but the Timurids pushed on building mines to break the ramparts.

Finally, the fort ramparts were demolished and the Timurid army rushed into the fort capturing Dalachandra and killing other defenders after much desperate fighting at close quarters.

Other sources claim: “Dulachand initially opposed Timur but when hard-pressed he considered surrender. He was locked outside the walls of Bhatner by his brother and was later killed by Timur. The garrison of Bhatner then fought and were slaughtered to the last man. Bhatner was looted and burned to the ground.”

Context

Timur was on his way to wrest Delhi and India from the Tughlaqs, who had weakened.

Details

  • Tags:

Observed on every occurrence of VaidhrÃ•ti·∏• yoga (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti).

Vaidhrti Shraddha day.

2022-11-19

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-25 , ‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ-08-03üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-28üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-28, Islamic: 1444-04-24 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫10:30; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫24:11*; ‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫26:05*; ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É‚ñ∫24:20*; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫10:30; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫22:41; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-6.83¬∞ ‚Üí -7.08¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-5.96¬∞ ‚Üí -6.51¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (153.78¬∞ ‚Üí 155.07¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-122.18¬∞ ‚Üí -121.16¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-82.54¬∞ ‚Üí -81.58¬∞)

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:23-12:04üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî14:22; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî02:46*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:23-07:49; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:14-10:39; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:04-13:30; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:20
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:23-07:09; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:09-07:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:25-10:11; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:42-12:27; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:42-05:33; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:49-01:20
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:14-10:39; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî13:30-14:55; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî06:23-07:49
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:25); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§´‡•ã‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó-‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•©‡•©‡•Ø, ‡§Æ‡•Ü‡§Ø‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡•ä‡§∞‡•Å‡§≥‡•ç ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•™) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à
‡§Æ‡•Ü‡§Ø‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡•ä‡§∞‡•Å‡§≥‡•ç ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•™) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on Uttaraphalgunƒ´ nakshatra of VrÃ•≈õcika·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: NayanarGurupujai
‡§´‡•ã‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó-‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•©‡•©‡•Ø

Event occured on 1683-11-19 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

Maratha reinforcements, which included Sambhaji himself, arrived from Rajapur to rescue the fort with 800 cavalry and 2,000 infantry.

Portuguese viceroy thought that Sambhaji will attack him from the rear and cut his line of communication with Goa. On 10 November, the viceroy called for a general retreat towards the Durbhat port. The Marathas routed the retreating Portuguese by attacking them from a hill near creek. The viceroy was wounded during this skirmish. On 12 November most of the Portuguese army reached Goa.

Context: During the marATha-portuguese war under sambaji, the Portuguese viceroy marched towards the Fortress of Ponda, with 3,700 soldiers. They crossed the river and reached the villages west of Ponda on 7th November. Veteran Maratha general Yesaji Kank and his son Krishnaji were stationed at Ponda with a force of 600 soldiers. The Marathas resisted the initial Portuguese infantry charges. In one of these skirmishes Krishnaji Kank was wounded heavily, he died a few days later. However The Portuguese heavy bombardment managed to break through the walls of the fort, severely damaging it.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-11-20

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-26 , ‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ-‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Éüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-04üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-29üåûü™ê , ‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-29, Islamic: 1444-04-25 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫10:41; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫24:33*; ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫22:58; ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫10:41; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫22:30; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-6.51¬∞ ‚Üí -7.05¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-7.08¬∞ ‚Üí -7.32¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-121.16¬∞ ‚Üí -120.14¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (155.07¬∞ ‚Üí 156.38¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-81.58¬∞ ‚Üí -80.62¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:24-12:05üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî15:02; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî03:37*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:24-07:49; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:14-10:39; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:05-13:30; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:20
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:24-07:09; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:09-07:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:26-10:11; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:42-12:27; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:43-05:33; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:49-01:21
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî16:20-17:46; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî12:05-13:30; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫10:56); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É, ‡§Ü‡§©‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•ß‡•©) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à-‡§û‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§±‡•ç‡§±‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§ø‡§¥‡§Æ‡•à, ‡§ñ‡§æ‡§®‡•ã‡§¶‡§∞-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•©‡•¨‡•©, ‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§á‡§®-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•á ‡§™‡•É‡§•‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•Æ‡•©‡•ß, ‡§∂‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§£ ‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§ß‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ò‡§≤‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á #‡•®‡•©‡•©, ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä
‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É

When Hasta nakshatra falls on a Sunday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. When Rohini nakshatra falls on a Saturday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays
‡§Ü‡§©‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•ß‡•©) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on Hasta·∏• nakshatra of VrÃ•≈õcika·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: NayanarGurupujai
‡§∂‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§£ ‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§ß‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ò‡§≤‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á #‡•®‡•©‡•©

Event occured on 1789-11-20 (gregorian).

The Mughal emperor Shah Alam II prohibited cow killing. Also, Mathura and vRndAvan granted to peshva (represented by Mahadji Scindia).

‡§ñ‡§æ‡§®‡•ã‡§¶‡§∞-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•©‡•¨‡•©

Event occured on 1659-11-20 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

Afzal Khan is killed in an epic encounter. Shivaji ordered Netoji Palkar to destroy Afzal’s base at Wai the very same day & himself followed soon. https://twitter.com/Gopanarya/status/928748402245976064
