‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä

The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of kƒÅrttika month is known as utpannƒÅ-ƒìkƒÅda≈õƒ´.

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§ö ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§É‡•§
‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•Å‡§≠‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡§™‡§ø‡••

‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ï‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§∂‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§≠‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡••
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡§•‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§∞‡•á ‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡§µ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡•§
‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö ‡§µ‡•à ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡•ã ‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§§‡§É‡••
–‡§™‡§¶‡•ç‡§Æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyVratam EkadashiVratam
‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§á‡§®-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•á ‡§™‡•É‡§•‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•Æ‡•©‡•ß

Event occured on 1191-11-20 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

chAhamAna-pRthvIrAja (Prithiviraj Chauhan) defeated the Ghurid king Mu’izz ad-Din Muhammad Ghori. Minhaj states that Mu’izz ad-Din, who was riding a horse, attacked Govind Rai with a lance, hitting his mouth and breaking two of his teeth. Govind Rai retaliated with a javelin, severely wounding Mu’izz ad-Din’s upper arm. According to Minhaj, Mu’izz ad-Din would have died or been captured, had a young soldier not led his horse to safety. ‘The Sultan turned his charger’s head round and receded, and from the agony of the wound he was unable to continue on horseback any longer. Defeat befell the army of IslƒÅm so that it was irretrievably routed.’ - Minhaj in Tabaqat-i Nasiri.

Prithviraj later recaptured Tabarhindah fort, but did not pursue the enemy further.

Context: Sometime before 1191, Mu’izz ad-Din’s army captured the Tabarhindah fort (probably present-day Bathinda).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-11-21

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-27 , ‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ-‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-05üåûüåå , ‡§ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§É-08-30üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-08-30, Islamic: 1444-04-26 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫10:07; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫24:11*; ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫21:02; ‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫10:07; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫21:33; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-7.32¬∞ ‚Üí -7.57¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-7.05¬∞ ‚Üí -7.59¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-120.14¬∞ ‚Üí -119.12¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-80.62¬∞ ‚Üí -79.66¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (156.38¬∞ ‚Üí 157.69¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:24-12:05üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî15:45; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî04:32*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:24-07:49; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:15-10:40; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:05-13:30; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:20; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:21
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:24-07:10; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:10-07:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:26-10:11; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:42-12:28; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:58-14:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:43-05:34; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:49-01:21
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:49-09:15; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:40-12:05; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:30-14:55
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:26); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï-‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§É, ‡§§‡•á‡§ó-‡§¨‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•©‡•™‡•≠, ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï-‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§É

Do puja to Shiva/Parvati, perform fast.

‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§π‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•á‡§∂ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡§¶‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡••
—‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ‡§• ‡§ú‡§ó‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•á‡•§
‡§Ö‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ï‡•ã‡§ü‡§ø‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞ ‡••
—‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§§‡•á‡§ú‡§∏‡•á‡•§
‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§Ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
—‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§¶‡§ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§∂‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§®‡•á‡•§
‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡••
—‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡•à ‡§®‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§ø ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§ø‡•§
‡§Ö‡§®‡§ò‡•á ‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡•á ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§ø ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•Ä‡§¶ ‡§Æ‡•á‡••
—‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡••
—‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§∂ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡•§
‡§∂‡•à‡§≤‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•á ‡§®‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡•ã‡••
—‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)

[‡§®‡•Ä‡§≤‡§ï‡§£‡•ç‡§†-‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•ã‡§ú-‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§´‡•Å‡§∞‡§ø‡§§-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§∏‡•§
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•ã‡§É ‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•á‡§π‡§ø ‡§ö‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§§‡•á‡••
—‡§ö‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ø‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§Æ‡§É ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É)]

Details
  • References
    • Skanda Puranam
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthWeekdayFestivals
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
  • 17:46‚Üí19:21

Pradosha Vratam. Fast during the day and perform ≈õivap≈´jƒÅ in Pradosha Kala. Pradosha vratam is even more special, when if falls on a Monday/Saturday.

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑‡•á ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§æ‡§É‡•§
‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§∂‡§§‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡§ø‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyVratam PradoshaVratam
‡§§‡•á‡§ó-‡§¨‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•©‡•™‡•≠

Event occured on 1675-11-21 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

tyAga-malla, aka guru tegh bahAdur, father of guru govind singh, was beheaded on this day by Jalal-ud-din Jallad on Awrangzeb’s orders under a banyan tree opposite the Sunheri Masjid near the Kotwali in Chandni Chowk, Delhi, were he’d been imprisoned.

Context

tyAgamalla had been arrested with some of his followers, including the mohyAl brAhmins Bhai Mati Das and Bhai Sati Das. They refused to convert to Islam. Bhai Mati Das was made to stand erect between two posts and a double headed saw was placed on his head and he was sawed from his head to his loins.

Aftermath

His head was carried by Bhai Jaita to Anandpur, where the nine-year-old Guru Gobind Singh cremated it (The gurdwara at this spot is also called Gurdwara Sis Ganj Sahib). The body, before it could be quartered, was stolen under the cover of darkness by Lakhi Shah Vanjara, another disciple, who carried it in a cart of hay and cremated it by burning his hut. Gurdwara Sis Ganj Sahib, was built at Chandni Chowk at the site of the execution.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-11-22

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-28 , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-06üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-01üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-01, Islamic: 1444-04-27 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫08:49; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫23:10; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫18:32; ‡§∂‡•ã‡§≠‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫08:49; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫19:56; ‡§∂‡§ï‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-7.59¬∞ ‚Üí -8.13¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-7.57¬∞ ‚Üí -7.81¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (157.69¬∞ ‚Üí 159.02¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-119.12¬∞ ‚Üí -118.10¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-79.66¬∞ ‚Üí -78.70¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:25-12:05üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî16:31; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî05:30*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:25-07:50; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:15-10:40; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:05-13:30; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:21
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:25-07:10; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:10-07:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:26-10:12; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:42-12:28; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:59-14:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:43-05:34; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:49-01:21
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî14:55-16:21; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:15-10:40; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:05-13:30
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫10:57); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • (‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®) ‡§∑‡§°‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä), ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É, ‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡§∏‡§π‡•ã-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É/‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
(‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®) ‡§∑‡§°‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 13:50‚Üí17:46

·π¢a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti Punyakala.

‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§™‡§É‚Äî
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§π‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
(‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ü‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ï-‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§É)
‡§∑‡§°‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•Å‡§µ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•á‡•§
‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•á ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ã ‡§®‡•à‡§µ ‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
—‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•å‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≠‡•á

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Caturda≈õƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (Ni≈õƒ´tha·∏•/paraviddha).

Monthly Shivaratri day.

‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä)

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Caturda≈õƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 07:26‚Üí17:46

16 ghatikas on either side of the transition of the Sun are sacred for various observances. In addition to specific pu·πáyakƒÅlas like ·π£a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti, vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ etc., this is also useful, especially in cases where the other pu·πáyakƒÅlas are inconvenient for appropriate performance of rituals such as snƒÅna, dƒÅna, tarpa·πáa, etc.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 12:05‚Üí17:46

When the transit of the Sun (sa·πÖkrƒÅnti) happens in the second half of the day (aparƒÅh·πáa) and before midnight, the second half of the day is a pu·πáyakƒÅla for various observances. In addition to 16 ghatikas on either side of the transition, and specific pu·πáyakƒÅlas like ·π£a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti, vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ etc., this is also useful, especially in cases where the other pu·πáyakƒÅlas are inconvenient for appropriate performance of rituals such as snƒÅna, dƒÅna, tarpa·πáa, etc.

  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§∏‡§π‡•ã-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É/‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É
  • 13:50‚Üí

Beginning of sah≈ç-mƒÅsa·∏•, marked by the transit of Sun into dhan≈´-rƒÅshƒ´. Also marks the beginning of hƒìmantarÃ•tu·∏•. While nirayana sa·πÖkrƒÅnti’s are widely observed, tropical sa·πÖkrƒÅnti’s are also equally sacred, and have similar pu·πáyakƒÅlas associated with them.

‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§™‡§É‚Äî
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§π‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
—‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ü‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ï-‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§É

‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§®‡§≠‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§®‡§≠‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‚Äå‡§∑‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§á‡§∑‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§∏‡§π‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§π‡•à‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§§‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§§‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡•à‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
—‡§§‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø-‡§∏‡§Ç‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡•™-‡•™-‡•ß‡•ß

2022-11-23

‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-08-29 , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-07üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-02üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-02, Islamic: 1444-04-28 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫06:53; ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫28:27*; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫21:35; ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•ã‡§≠‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫15:34; ‡§Ö‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§ï‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫06:53; ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‚ñ∫17:43; ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‚ñ∫28:27*; ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-7.81¬∞ ‚Üí -8.06¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-8.13¬∞ ‚Üí -8.66¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-118.10¬∞ ‚Üí -117.09¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (159.02¬∞ ‚Üí 160.35¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-78.70¬∞ ‚Üí -77.74¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:25-12:05üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî17:22; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî—
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:25-07:50; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:15-10:40; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:05-13:31; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:56-16:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:21
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:25-07:10; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:10-07:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:27-10:12; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:43-12:28; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:59-14:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:44-05:34; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:50-01:22
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:05-13:31; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî07:50-09:15; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:40-12:05
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:28); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ü‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§£-‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É ‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§°‡•á‡§∑‡•Å, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï-‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§É, ‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§≤‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£-‡§Æ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ-‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§®‡§µ‡§Æ-‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑-‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ), ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É-‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§É, ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§®‡§ó‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ã‡§™‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É ‡•ß‡•Ø‡•≠‡•Ø #‡•™‡•©, ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ï‡•ã‡§ü‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§≠‡§§‡•á #‡•©‡•´‡•´, ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äì‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ)
‡§Ü‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§£-‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É ‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§°‡•á‡§∑‡•Å

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of VrÃ•≈õcika·∏• (sidereal solar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Perform h≈çma with fresh rice from paddy.

Details
  • References
    • Vaidikasri Nov 2017
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialPuja
‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§®‡§ó‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ã‡§™‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡§É ‡•ß‡•Ø‡•≠‡•Ø #‡•™‡•©

Event occured on 1979-11-23 (gregorian).

On this Friday, crazed Muslim mobs _esecrated and burned the temple of Bhagyalakshmi at Charminar in Hyderabad - They broke the main Murti of Lakshmi. The riots went on for 10 days and the shops of Marwadis were destroyed.

Background

In 1979, dramatic events shook the Muslim world: revolution in Iran at the hands of Imam Khomeini, the occupation of Afghanistan by the Soviet Army, while in Mecca a commando of fanatics wreaked havoc at the Muslim holy site. Salahuddin Owaisi of AIMIM called for a Bandh in Hyderabad, even when India had nothing to do with it.

Aftermath

The riots stopped only after Saudi Arabia regain control of Grand Mosque in Mecca.
After the riots, the Congress Government led by then CM Chenna Reddy did not take ANY action against MIM rioters.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç

pƒÅrva·πáavratam on the eve of dar≈õa-sthƒÅlƒ´pƒÅka·∏•.

‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§æ ‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É, ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§Ω‡§≠‡§ø‡§Ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö - ‘‡§Ö‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£ ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•å‡§™‡§µ‡§∏‡§•‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•Ä ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç ‡§è‡§®‡§Ø‡•ã‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç- ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∂‡§≤‡•á‡§®’‡•§

‘‡§Ö‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§ß ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§Ø‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§§‡•å ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§ú‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§®‡•ç-‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡§∞‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§á‡§§‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∏-‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á‡§®‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§ ‡§ú‡•Å‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∏‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§’

‡§™‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç ‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É‡•§

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡§ø ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

“‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§â‡§¶‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Ø‡•á‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ” ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å‡•§

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§™‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É-‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§É

Pinda Pitru Yajnam is a ≈õrƒÅddham to be done to two sets of Pitru Devatas. It is to be done in one’s Agnihotra Agni or if that is not present then Aupasana Agni. Rice is cooked in a section of the Agni moved to the south-east. From this, even those whose father is living, give ƒÅhuti to the Deva Pitru-s ie s≈çma, yama and agni kavyavƒÅhana. Those whose father is not living should additionally give pi·πá·∏ças to the Manushya Pitru-s also to whom amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ-≈õrƒÅddham is also performed.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: ShraddhaDays
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äì‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ)

amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ of kƒÅrttika month.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: AmavasyaDays

It is said in Vishnupuranam that when Amavasya overlaps with one of nine nakshatras—Anuradha, Vishakha, Swati, Pushya, Ardra, Punarvasu, Shravishtha, Purvaproshthapada, or Shatabhishak—it is sacred even for Devas. For instance, Shraaddha done on an Amavasya joined with Anuradha, Vishakha, Swati keeps the pitrs satisfied for eight years. Likewise, on Pushya, Ardra and Punarvasu, the pitrs satisfied for twelve years.

‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡•á—
‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‡•§
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•á ‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É‡§ó‡§£‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•É‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§®‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§∞‡•å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§Ω‡§•‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•å‡•§
‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§§‡§¶‡§æ ‡§§‡•É‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∞‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§É‡••
‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§ú‡•à‡§ï‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡•É‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•Ñ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•É‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡•á ‡§ö‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§≤‡§≠‡§æ‡•§
‡§®‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•É‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•à‡§§‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡§µ‡§®‡•Ä‡§™‡§§‡•á‡••

Details
  • References
    • Vaidyanatha Dikshitiyam
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: AmavasyaDays
‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ï‡•ã‡§ü‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§≠‡§§‡•á #‡•©‡•´‡•´

Event occured on 1667-11-23 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On 13th November 1668 (in the same month as the raid on bArdesh, Goa), Shivaji commenced the construction of the temple of Shri Saptakoteshvara at Narwe.

Formerly the temple of Shri Saptakoteshvara, the family deity of the Kadamba dynasty that ruled over Goa in the 12th century, was in the village named Narwe (Naroa) in Divadi, a tiny coastal island. It was destroyed by the Muslims and the stone image of the deity was hidden by the devotees in the embankment of a field.

When Goa came under the sway of Vijayanagar, Madhava, a minister of that Empire, built a new magnificent temple at the same place and reestablished the deity. This, too, was destroyed in 1540 ‚Äì this time by the Portuguese - along with many other temples. They built a chapel dedicated to Nossa Senhora Candelaria in its place.

Some remains of the ancient temple could still be noticed in the chapel. The image of the deity was smuggled out of Goa and a temple was built in another village within Adilshahi territory also named Narwe (Naroa) in the district of Dicholi, opposite the one in Divadi. This temple, it seems, was in a very dilapidated condition.

Shivaji was now building a new one at that site which he perhaps intended would serve as a beacon of hope for his Hindu brethren in Goa. This was all that he could do for them at the moment.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§≤‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£-‡§Æ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ-‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of KƒÅrttika·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Thiruvisanallur Sridhara Aiyyaval brought Ganga to his house well on this day! See also http://www.sriayyaval.org/ .

‡§à‡§∂‡•á ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§§‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§Æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§Æ ‡§ö ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ö‡•§
‡§à‡§∂‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ ‡§ï‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡§æ ‡§ö ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á ‡§®‡§∞‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ï‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§µ‡•á‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡••

‡••‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ‡•§
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑ ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§§‡§•‡§æ‡§Ω‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ú‡•á‡§Ω‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡•ã ‡§ï‡•ã‡§Ω‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§É‡••‡•ß‡••
‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§∑ ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•á ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§µ‡•ã ‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§™‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡•§
‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§§‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ú‡§™‡•á‡§® ‡§∂‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§É‡••‡•®‡••
‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ ‡§® ‡§π‡§ø ‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§§‡§É ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§® ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§ó‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡•§
‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§™‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•ã‡••‡•©‡••
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡•á ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§æ ‡§ï‡•ã‡§Ω‡§π‡§Ç ‡§§‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§É‡•§
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•á ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡§æ‡§É ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡•ã‡§™‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§ñ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡••‡•™‡••
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§≠‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡•ã‡§™‡§∞‡•ã‡§ß‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ó‡§£‡§Ø‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ß‡•Ä‡§∞‡§æ‡§É‡•§
‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§ö‡•Å‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§Ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡•á‡§π‡§ø‡••‡•´‡••
‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞ ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡§ú‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§≠‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡•á ‡§ï‡•Ç‡§™‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§ó‡§æ‡§π‡§É‡•§
‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§® ‡§§‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•ã‡••‡•¨‡••
‡§®‡§æ‡§π‡§Ç ‡§§‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§® ‡§ú‡§π‡•ç‡§µ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï‡•ç‡§µ ‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§ø‡•§
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•ã ‡§ú‡§ü‡§æ‡§ú‡•Ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡§™‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§£‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§®‡•á ‡§®‡§æ‡§≤‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡§É‡••‡•≠‡••
‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞‡§æ‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•á ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ö‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡•§
‡§π‡§®‡•ç‡§§ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§É ‡§ï‡§•‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•Ç‡§™‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§´‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§§‡•Ä‡§∂‡§É ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§É‡••‡•Æ‡••
‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•á‡§§‡§ø ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡•á‡§§‡§ø ‡§π‡§∞‡•á‡§§‡§ø ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§®‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§π‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•á‡§É‡•§
‡§ï‡•Ç‡§™‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§É ‡§ó‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ú‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡•Å‡••‡•Ø‡••

‡••‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ß‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç‡••

2022-11-24

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-01 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-08üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-03üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-03, Islamic: 1444-04-29 Rabƒ´ ø ath-ThƒÅnƒ´/ al- æƒÄkhir, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‚ñ∫25:37*; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫19:35; ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫12:14; ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫15:04; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫25:37*; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-8.66¬∞ ‚Üí -9.20¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-8.06¬∞ ‚Üí -8.30¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-117.09¬∞ ‚Üí -116.08¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (160.35¬∞ ‚Üí 161.70¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-77.74¬∞ ‚Üí -76.78¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:26-12:06üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:31; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî18:17
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:26-07:51; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:16-10:41; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:06-13:31; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:56-16:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:21
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:26-07:11; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:11-07:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:27-10:12; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:43-12:28; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:59-14:44; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:00; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:00-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:44-05:35; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:50-01:22
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:31-14:56; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî06:26-07:51; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:16-10:41
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ (‚ñ∫13:59); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§§‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•ß‡•Æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•¨‡•©‡•Æ, ‡§°‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®-‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏-‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§®‡•ç‡§•-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•ß‡•¨‡•©, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂-‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§É, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É, ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§™‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∞‡§ò‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‡•®‡•¶‡•¶‡•®‡•ß‡•ß #‡•®‡•¶, ‡§µ‡§®‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É
‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyFestivals
‡§°‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®-‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏-‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶-‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§®‡•ç‡§•-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•ß‡•¨‡•©

Event occured on 1859-11-24 (gregorian).

Charles Darwin’s ‘On the origin of species’ (On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural Selection, or the Preservation of Favoured Races in the Struggle for Life) was published in England to great acclaim.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•ß‡•Æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•¨‡•©‡•Æ

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3486 (Kali era).

The austere preceptor Surendra after defeating boldly in debate the materialist Durdhivi and his companion Jƒ´va, being honoured by King Surendra in his Court merged in his original state. Preceptor Surendra, a Maharashtrian, revered by all as MƒÅthura, resorted to asceticism, an adept in Yogic practices, governed the Ma·π≠ha for only ten years and reached his abode on the first day of the bright fortnight in the month of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a of the TƒÅra·πáa year in the Kali era 3486.

‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ä‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§≠‡•Ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡§•‡§æ‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ-
‡§∏‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§Æ‡§™‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§ß‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡•§
‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§É ‡§∏‡§¶‡§∏‡§ø ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡§É
‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡•á ‡§™‡§¶‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡••‡•©‡•Ø‡••
‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§É ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•à‡§∞‡§™‡§ø ‡§ö ‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Å‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§•‡•Å‡§∞ ‡§á‡§§‡§ø
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§É ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§∏-‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å-‡§ú‡§≤‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•Å (‡•©‡•™‡•Æ‡•¨) ‡§ï‡§≤‡•á‡§É‡•§
‡§¶‡§∂‡•à‡§µ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§Æ‡§†‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§ï‡§É
‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§™‡§¶‡§ø ‡§∏‡§ø‡§§‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§™ ‡§®‡§ø‡§≤‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•™‡•¶‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§™‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

‘‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§â‡§¶‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Ø‡•á‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ ' ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å‡•§

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyFestivals
‡§∞‡§ò‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‡•®‡•¶‡•¶‡•®‡•ß‡•ß #‡•®‡•¶

Event occured on 2002-11-24 (gregorian).

Two suicide bombers attacked the rAma temple in Jammu (dating to 1860), just a few months after the March attack. They killed fourteen devotees and injured 45 others. CRPF men Yatindra Nath Rai, Assistant Commandant, Dev Singh, Head Constable, E.G. Rao, Head Constable, T.A.Singh, Constable, and Late K.K. Pandey showed great gallantry.

  • Tags:
‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂-‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§É

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha). sthƒÅlƒ´paka·∏• is an important fortnightly ritual, involving the offering of havi·π£yƒÅnna to agni, with the offering being cooked on the fire itself.

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Vanadurga Navaratri. Specially celebrated in Karthiramangalam.

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-04, Islamic: 1444-05-01 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£

  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123

    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:26-12:06üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî07:34; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî19:18
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:26-07:51; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:16-10:41; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:06-13:31; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:56-16:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:21
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:26-07:11; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:11-07:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:27-10:13; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:43-12:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî13:59-14:45; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:01-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:45-05:35; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:50-01:22
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:41-12:06; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî14:56-16:21; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:51-09:16
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫10:58); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞-‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§§‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä-‡§ó‡•å‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•á ‡§π‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•Å‡§ï‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•≠‡•´
‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞-‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • 17:46‚Üí19:18

Have darshan of Moon today, chanting the following shloka

‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∑‡§£‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö
‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ß‡§∞‡•ã ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§¨‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§É‡•§
‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ω‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§µ‡§∞‡§¶‡§É ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ü‡•Ä
‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡§ß‡§æ‡§§‡•Å ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: ChandraDarshanam
‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•á ‡§π‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•Å‡§ï‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•≠‡•´

Event occured on 1947-11-25 (gregorian).

On this day, began the large scale massacre of over 20k Hindu and sikhs at mIrpur in pAkistAn occupied kAshmIr.

In the morning, jihAdi-s entered mIrpur city. Rioting began. Of the minority population, only about 2,500 Hindus or Sikhs escaped through the border to Jammu and Kashmir along with the State troops. The jihAdi-s killed every hindu and sikh - shooting, hacking, even slitting throats while chanting kAlima-s (eg. at the gurdwara at Ali Baig which had been turned into a prison camp). Around 5k women were raped and abducted - though many committed mass suicide to escape that fate.

Aftermath

In March 1948, the ICRC rescued 1,600 of the survivors from Ali Baig. By 1951, only 790 non-Muslims remained in areas that came to comprise Azad Kashmir; down from a previous population of 114,000 which used to live there. Governments of sheikh abdullah and successors did not give them resident status.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§§‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä-‡§ó‡•å‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on ≈öukla-Dvitƒ´yƒÅ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialVratam

2022-11-26

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-03 , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-10üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-05üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-05, Islamic: 1444-05-02 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫19:28; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫14:56; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫25:09*; ‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫09:01; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫19:28; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫29:55*; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-9.72¬∞ ‚Üí -10.25¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-8.54¬∞ ‚Üí -8.79¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-115.07¬∞ ‚Üí -114.07¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (163.05¬∞ ‚Üí 164.42¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-75.82¬∞ ‚Üí -74.87¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:27-12:06üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî08:38; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî20:22
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:27-07:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:16-10:41; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:06-13:31; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:56-16:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:21
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:27-07:12; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:12-07:57; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:28-10:13; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:44-12:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:00-14:45; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:15-17:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:01-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:45-05:36; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:50-01:23
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:16-10:41; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî13:31-14:56; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî06:27-07:52
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:28); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ì‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡•ç‡§≤-‡§§‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ-‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É #‡•ß‡•™, ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•©‡•ß) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É
‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•©‡•ß) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on M≈´lƒÅ nakshatra of VrÃ•≈õcika·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: NayanarGurupujai
‡§ì‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡•ç‡§≤-‡§§‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ-‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É #‡•ß‡•™

Event occured on 2008-11-26 (gregorian).

tukArAm Omble died stopping jihAdi terrorist Ajmal Kasab in Mumbai on this day.

Background and events

Omble joined the police as a constable in 1991 after retiring from the Indian Army’s Signal Corps as a naik. He was an ASI with the Mumbai Police. On 26/11 he and his team were guarding one of the checkposts when they were approached by two terrorists in a hijacked car. After an initial shootout, one of the terrorists died inside the car, while the other, Ajmal Kasab got out of the car and lay down to pretend surrender. As unarmed Omble approached him, Kasab got up and tried to open fire. Omble stood in front of him and held on to the barrel of Kasab’s rifle, thus preventing the bullets from hitting anyone else but him. The rest of the team managed to overpower and apprehend Kasab. Omble had taken over 40 bullets from an Ak-47 at point blank range and did not survive.

####### Other heroes of the day

  • Mukesh Jadhav : A 23 year old Home Guard earning mere ‚Çπ90 per day. He was posted at CST. When Kasab & gang came he guided many passengers to safety. In saving one passenger he face to face with one terrorist & lost his life.
  • Jillu Yadav - He was a constable of RPF & he took Kasab & Ismail Khan head on. He was armed with outdated .303 rifle & terrorists had 3 AK47 & grenades. He fought bravely & even threw chairs when his rifle jammed to not allow terrorist to cross over to other platform.
  • Vishnu Zende - He was announcer at CST when carnage started. He was fired upon but he kept announcing & informed passenger about terrorist presence. Due to his announcements many lives were saved.
  • Vijay Surve - He is a Shivsainik & when 26/11 started he along with few of his Shiv Sena workers shifted people around Nariman House to safer locations.
  • Captain Tamil Selvan - He was parcel contractor & suddenly when injured people came at his counter he realised that there was attack at CST. He & his two staff members evacuated many & saved lives of 36 injured.
  • Vijay Khandekar - He was wireless operator & he was on leave when event occurred. He immediately proceeded to Cama Hospital & he was martyred when grenade was thrown at police party.
  • Inspector Sanjay Govilkar - He was part of the police team that captured Ajmal Kasab alive. When he realised on scene that Kasab has attacked Omble he used his lathi to disarm Kasab.
  • Sub-Inspector Bhaskar Kadam - He was the one to intercept Skoda of terrorist & he neutralised Ismail Khan with six shots fired from his gun.
  • Inspector Deepak Dhole - He managed to keep the terrorists at Taj Hotel confined to top floor for four hours & he responded whenever they tried to flee to other location. He suffered burn injuries. He never got any reward or promotion despite promise from then HM RR Patil.
  • Inspector Nagappa Mahale - He was the one who coordinated the operation at Chowpatty which led to arrest of Kasab yet he never received any commendation or reward.
  • Inspector Kishor Shinde - When a bag full of RDX was found at Oberoi Trident he quickly took it & placed it at an isolated place. It exploded few minutes later. If not for him many lives would have been lost that day.
  • Captain Amitendra Singh - This 25 year old braveheart from NSG suffered serious injuries to his eyes during raid at Oberoi Hotel. He lost his left eye permanently & returned to duty on a desk job. He was awarded with Shaurya Chakra.
  • Sub-Inspector Sudam Pandarkar - He was in ladies compartment for duty when he heard gunshots. He fired 3 shots from his .303 rifle & in return fire from terrorists he was wounded in the chest.
  • Commando Sunil Yadav - NSG brave-heart was trying to rescue people stuck at Taj Hotel when a bullet passed through his both legs. Somehow he got up & rescued guest who were stuck at 4th floor.
  • Dr Ashish Tiwari - He was physician at Bombay hospital. He drove to hospital as soon as he got report of attacks. He & his team set up various operation units at war footing. They saved many lives with their quick response.
Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É
  • 22:39‚Üí

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 180, it is sƒÅyana-vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Combinations

2022-11-27

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-04 , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-11üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-06üåûü™ê , ‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-06, Islamic: 1444-05-03 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫16:25; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫12:36; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫21:29; ‡§µ‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫16:25; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫26:58*; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡§ø‡§•‡•Å‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-8.79¬∞ ‚Üí -9.03¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-10.25¬∞ ‚Üí -10.77¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-114.07¬∞ ‚Üí -113.07¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (164.42¬∞ ‚Üí 165.79¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-74.87¬∞ ‚Üí -73.91¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:27-12:07üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî09:39; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî21:26
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:27-07:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:17-10:42; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:07-13:32; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:56-16:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:21
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:27-07:12; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:12-07:58; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:28-10:13; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:44-12:29; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:00-14:45; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:16-17:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:01-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:46-05:36; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:51-01:23
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî16:21-17:46; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî12:07-13:32; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî14:56-16:21
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫10:59); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à-‡§û‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§±‡•ç‡§±‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§ø‡§¥‡§Æ‡•à, ‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•Ä‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§§‡•Ä‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•®‡•Ø‡•ß, ‡§ö‡§ø‡§±‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•©‡•™) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡•Ø, ‡§¨‡§¶‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ó‡•å‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É
‡§¨‡§¶‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ó‡•å‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on ≈öukla-Caturthƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

‡§ö‡§ø‡§±‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•©‡•™) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on P≈´rvƒÅ·π£ƒÅ·∏çhƒÅ nakshatra of VrÃ•≈õcika·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡•Ø

Observed on ≈öukla-Pa√±camƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Devi Parva
‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•Ä‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§§‡•Ä‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•®‡•Ø‡•ß

Event occured on 1731-11-27 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On this day (1731, Nov 16 Julian), the Portuguese King gave the final order that, ‘I permit you to Baptise the (captive) women and children. Go ahead.’ chimAjI appa would soon put an end to this.

Background

1731, Mar 20: Portuguese Viceroy informed the King of Portugal: ‘During our war with Marathas, we captured many women & children & we’re going to Baptise them.’

1715: An order was passed:- ‘Hindus shall be compelled to listen Christian doctrine.’ This law led to mass exodus of Hindus from the city of Goa.

  • Tags:
‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à-‡§û‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§±‡•ç‡§±‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§ø‡§¥‡§Æ‡•à

Do puja to Surya/Suryanamaskaram.

‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É
  • ‚Üí18:58

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 180, it is sƒÅyana-vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

Shukla Chaturthi Vratam for Lord Ganesha.

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-05 , ‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-12üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-07üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-07, Islamic: 1444-05-04 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:28-12:07üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî10:36; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî22:28
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:28-07:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:17-10:42; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:07-13:32; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:57-16:21; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:22
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:28-07:13; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:13-07:58; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:29-10:14; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:44-12:30; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:00-14:45; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:16-17:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:01-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:46-05:37; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:51-01:23
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî07:53-09:17; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:42-12:07; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:32-14:57
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:29); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•©‡•® ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ò‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•©‡•´‡•ß, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§£‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•©‡•® ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ò‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•©‡•´‡•ß

Observed on ≈öukla-·π¢a·π£·π≠hƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3773 (Kali era).

Son of Ka·πá·πá≈´≈õa·πÖkara, the clever PadmanƒÅbha by ame, though intent on practising Lambika Yoga, this preceptor CidƒÅnandaghanendra adhering to the injunctions of the Master, remained in the seat of KƒÅmako·π≠i that bestows all desired things to those who resort to, fed innumerable devotees every day. He, the adept in Yoga reinstating compassionately the Kannada prince who lost kith and kin in his own kingdom through his (the prince‚Äôs) conqueror, He (CidƒÅnandaghanendra) remained as preceptor only for four years sustaining on dry leaves. This preceptor reached his Ultimate abode which is devoid of all grief, delusion etc. on the sixty day of bright fortnight in the month of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a of the year Prajotpati.

‡§Ö‡§£‡•ç‡§£‡•Å(‡§ï‡§£‡•ç‡§µ)‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§É ‡§™‡§ü‡•Å‡§™‡§¶‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ‡§≠‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•ã
‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§™‡§•‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ω‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ï‡•ã‡§ü‡§ø‡§™‡§¶‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ï‡•ã‡§ü‡§ø‡§´‡§≤‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•á
‡§®‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§≠‡•Ç‡§¶‡•ç ‡§á‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§™‡§¶‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§∏‡•å‡••‡•¨‡•ß‡••
‡§∏‡§ï‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§°‡•á‡§∂‡•Ä‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§Ç
‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡§™‡§ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§ú‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ú‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡•§
‡§Ö‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§ò‡•Å‡§§‡§®‡•Å‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä
‡§™‡§¶‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ω‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§µ ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡••‡•¨‡•®‡••
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ú‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•å ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§∏‡§ø‡§§‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§ó‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•å‡•§
‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∂‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ã‡§π‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•¨‡•©‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

Details
  • References
    • Punya Shloka Manjari
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: KanchiAradhanaDays
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§£‡•Ä-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
  • 10:26‚Üí

When Shravana nakshatra falls on a Monday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. When Rohini nakshatra falls on a Saturday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on every occurrence of ≈örava·πáa·∏• nakshatra (SƒÅ·πÖgava·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialVratam

2022-11-29

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-06 , ‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£‡§Éüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-13üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-08üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-08, Islamic: 1444-05-05 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‚ñ∫11:04; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫08:35; ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ß‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫14:48; ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫11:04; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫21:58; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-11.29¬∞ ‚Üí -11.80¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-72.96¬∞ ‚Üí -72.01¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-112.07¬∞ ‚Üí -111.08¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-9.27¬∞ ‚Üí -9.52¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (167.17¬∞ ‚Üí 168.55¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:28-12:07üåûÔ∏è-17:46üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî11:28; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî23:27
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:28-07:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:18-10:43; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:07-13:32; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:57-16:22; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:46-19:22
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:28-07:13; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:13-07:59; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:29-10:14; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:45-12:30; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:00-14:46; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:16-17:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:01-17:46
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:47-05:37; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:51-01:24
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî14:57-16:22; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:18-10:43; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:07-13:32
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:00); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•®‡•®‡•®‡•≠, ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§≤‡§ø‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä, ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä, ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ã ‡§¨‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§≤‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§ø #‡•©‡•´‡•´, ‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•®‡•®‡•®‡•≠

Observed on ≈öukla-Saptamƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 2897 (Kali era).

Born of a brahmin called NƒÅge≈õa in the village called Ma·πÖgala of the Chola country, the erudite saint well-known as ≈örƒ´ J√±ƒÅnottama, foremost among logicians, having adorned the Pƒ´·π≠ha of preceptors for sixty-three years, attained salvation/siddhi on the seventh day of the bright fortnight in the month of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a of the year Manmatha.

‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§®‡§ø ‡§ö‡•ã‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•á ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡•á‡§∂‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ú‡§æ-
‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§¨‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§¶‡•ã ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∏‡§∞‡§É‡•§
‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§Æ‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡§É ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Ä‡§†‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•ã‡§É
‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ø‡§§‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§ß‡•Ä‡§É‡••‡•ß‡•®‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§≤‡§ø‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä

Observed on ≈öukla-·π¢a·π£·π≠hƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Have darshan of Shivalingam today; removes Shivapachara doshas in the family.

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡•á‡§Ω‡§Æ‡§≤‡•á ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•á‡§Ç‡§Ω‡§∂‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§®‡§É‡•§
‡§∂‡§§‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ó‡§§‡•á ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§≤‡§ø‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§ó‡•ã‡§ö‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä

Observed on ≈öukla-Saptamƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Birth of Surya to Aditya-Kashyapa on this day.

‡§Ö‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡•á ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§∏‡§æ ‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•á‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‡••

‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä

Observed on ≈öukla-Saptamƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (MadhyƒÅhna·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Details
  • References
    • Bhavishyottara Puranam
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SpecialVratam LessCommonFestivals
‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ã ‡§¨‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§≤‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§ø #‡•©‡•´‡•´

Event occured on 1667-11-29 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

shivAjI invaded bArdesh with 5k foot and 1k horse, plundered and withdrew after 3 days. 2 Portuguese priests were killed. An English account from 10 days later says that the cause was irritation at roman catholic fanaticism (which was then rescinded by the Portuguese viceroy) - but this is not mentioned in Portuguese or Dutch letters and the later agreement, which say that the objective was to capture the desai-s from there who were using it as a base for their looting operations with Portuguese support.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

Also known as champƒÅ/champaka ·π£a·π£·π≠hƒ´

‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡§ï ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§¶ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∏‡•á‡§® ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¨‡§≤‡•§
‡§∞‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ú ‡§∑‡§°‡•ç‡§µ‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡•ç‡§≠ ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§§‡•á‡••

  • Tags: MonthlyVratam ShashthiVratam

2022-11-30

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-07 , ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-08-14üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-09üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-09, Islamic: 1444-05-06 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫08:58; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫07:09; ‡§∂‡§§‡§≠‡§ø‡§∑‡§ï‡•ç‚ñ∫30:10*; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫11:57; ‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫08:58; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫20:06; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§ü‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-11.80¬∞ ‚Üí -12.32¬∞)
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-72.01¬∞ ‚Üí -71.06¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-111.08¬∞ ‚Üí -110.09¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-9.52¬∞ ‚Üí -9.76¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (168.55¬∞ ‚Üí 169.94¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:29-12:08üåûÔ∏è-17:47üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî12:15; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî00:23*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:29-07:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:18-10:43; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:08-13:32; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî14:57-16:22; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:47-19:22
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:29-07:14; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:14-07:59; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:30-10:15; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:45-12:30; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:01-14:46; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:16-17:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:01-17:47
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:47-05:38; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:52-01:24
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:08-13:32; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî07:53-09:18; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:43-12:08
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:30); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§≤‡§æ‡§ü-‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞-‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡•ç-‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§É #‡•©‡•´‡•≠
‡§≤‡§æ‡§ü-‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞-‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡•ç-‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§É #‡•©‡•´‡•≠

Event occured on 1665-11-30 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On this day, Awrangzeb ordered redestruction of temples being reconstructed in Gujarat.

As it has come to His Majesty‚Äôs knowledge that some inhabitants of the mahals appertaining to the province of Gujarat have again built the temples which had been demolished by imperial order before his accession…therefore, His Majesty orders that the formerly demolished and recently restored temples should be pulled down.
