2022-12-15

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-22 , ‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ-08-29üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-24üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-24, Islamic: 1444-05-21 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à, ‡§Æ- ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç, ‡§™- ‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∞, ‡§Ö- ‡§Ü‡§ò‡•ã‡§£
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∂‡§∞‡§¶‡•É‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫25:39*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É‚ñ∫07:25; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫12:44; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫25:39*; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-18.71¬∞ ‚Üí -19.04¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-170.55¬∞ ‚Üí -169.19¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-13.11¬∞ ‚Üí -13.35¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-96.54¬∞ ‚Üí -95.60¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-57.86¬∞ ‚Üí -56.92¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:37-12:14üåûÔ∏è-17:51üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî11:40; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî23:49
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:37-08:01; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:26-10:50; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:14-13:38; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:03-16:27; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:51-19:27
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:37-07:22; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:22-08:07; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:37-10:22; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:52-12:37; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:07-14:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:21-17:06; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:06-17:51
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:55-05:46; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:58-01:31
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:38-15:03; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî06:37-08:01; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:26-10:50
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ (‚ñ∫14:07); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§§‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§É
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§É

2022-12-16

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-23 , ‡§∏‡§ø‡§Ç‡§π‡§É-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ-09-01üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-25üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-25, Islamic: 1444-05-22 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫27:02*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§®‡§µ‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫07:32; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫09:31; ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§É‚ñ∫09:31; ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫07:41; ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫14:26; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫27:02*; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-19.04¬∞ ‚Üí -19.34¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-13.35¬∞ ‚Üí -13.59¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-95.60¬∞ ‚Üí -94.66¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-169.19¬∞ ‚Üí -167.83¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-56.92¬∞ ‚Üí -55.99¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:37-12:15üåûÔ∏è-17:52üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî12:17; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî00:36*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:37-08:02; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:26-10:50; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:15-13:39; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:03-16:27; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:52-19:28
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:37-07:22; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:22-08:07; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:37-10:22; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:52-12:37; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:07-14:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:22-17:07; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:07-17:52
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:55-05:46; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:58-01:32
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:50-12:15; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî15:03-16:27; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî08:02-09:26
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:07); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•™ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•®‡•®‡•Ø‡•¶, ‡§ñ‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§£ ‡§ó‡•Ü‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§≤‡§π‡§≥‡•ç‡§≥‡§ø-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•á ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•®‡•¨‡•®, ‡§ß‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§∑‡§°‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä), ‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑-‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•´‡•ß, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
‡§ß‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§∑‡§°‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 09:31‚Üí17:52

Dhanur-Ravi-Sa·πÖkrama·πáa-·π¢a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti Punyakala. Perform danam of clothes/vehicle (e.g. bullock cart).

‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡•á ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
—‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•å‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≠‡•á
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§™‡§É‚Äî
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§π‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
(‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ü‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ï-‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§É)
‡§∑‡§°‡§∂‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•Å‡§µ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•á‡•§
‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•á ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ã ‡§®‡•à‡§µ ‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
—‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•å‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§≠‡•á

  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•™ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•®‡•®‡•Ø‡•¶

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 2834 (Kali era).

The saint Satyabodha, by name Phalinƒ´≈õa (before initiation into sainthood), son of TƒÅ·πá·∏çava≈õarma living on the banks of ƒÄmrƒÅvatƒ´ river, the noble preceptor, who authored commentatorial and VƒÅrtika texts on Advaita VedƒÅnta bore the responsibilities of preceptor. Then, ≈örƒ´ Satyabodha, who lived for ninety six years in KƒÅ√±ci in the Ma·π≠ha called ≈öƒÅradƒÅ, making unrestrained the systems of haughty KumƒÅrila, Buddhists, Jains, PrabhƒÅkara, Ka·πáƒÅda and Ak·π£apƒÅda and having shattered the enemies by the text Padaka≈õata realised his Self on the eighth day of the dark fortnight in the year Nandana.

‡§Ü‡§Æ‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä‡§§‡§ü‡§ú‡§§‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§µ‡§∂‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§®‡•Å‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§´‡§≤‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‡§∂‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡•§
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§≠‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡•É‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡§∞‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§∏‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡•ã‡§¢ ‡§ß‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Ç‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•ß‡•¶‡••
‡§Ö‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ(‡•Ø‡•¨)‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§∏‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§†‡•á ‡§∂‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§®‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç
‡§¶‡•É‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•å‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§π‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§®‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§ï‡§£‡§≠‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ô‡•ç‡§ò‡•ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§É ‡§™‡§¶‡§ï‡§∂‡§§‡§π‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•å‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§É
‡§∏‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§∏‡§π‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡•á ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•ß‡•ß‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

Details
  • References
    • Punya Shloka Manjari
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: KanchiAradhanaDays
‡§ñ‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§£ ‡§ó‡•Ü‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§≤‡§π‡§≥‡•ç‡§≥‡§ø-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•á ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§É #‡•®‡•¨‡•®

Event occured on 1760-12-16 (gregorian).

On this day, khANDe rAv, the royalist divAn of Krishnaraja Wodeyar II, thoroughly defeated Haidar Ali in the battle of Nanjangud-Haradanahalli near Gejjalahalli Pass.

Context
  • Khande Rao came in contact with Haidar Ali in August 1756 when the king entrusted him with 50k gold pieces to be given to Sahbas Sahib (brother of Haidar) and Haidar to enable them to raise an army to defeat the Dalawai brothers who had virtually imprisoned him (the king) in his own palace.
  • Haidar rose to power under Khande Rao with the countenence of Karachuri Nanjarajaiah. In 1758, Khande Rao was made “Dewan” on the recommendation of Haidar and the Dalawais (including Karachuri Nanjarajaiah) were side-lined.
  • By 1759, it was clear that Haidar was getting more and more revenue districts assigned to himself and Khande Rao had seen through Haidar’s intention to fleece the king.
  • The Wodeyar King sought the assistance of the Mahratta army and Khande Rao wrote several letters to George Pigout, Governor General at Madras for help.
  • On 26th August 1760, Khande Rao attacked Haidar at Srirangapatna but let Haidar flee out of sentiment, with the promise that he would retire away from maisUru. Haidar did not keep his promise - he tried regrouping and attacking.
Aftermath
  • Sadly, shortly thereafter marATha forces were recalled after the defeat at pANIpat.
  • Haidar rushed to the feet of the dalvai Karachuri Nanjarajaiah - the latter was swayed and basically let Haidar act on his behalf - sowing utter confusion in the maisUru king’s troops. This ultimately led to the capture of khANDe rAv on 20th June 1761. khANDe rAv was put in an iron cage in bengaLUru, where he died next year.
Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti).

‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑-‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•´‡•ß

Event occured on 1971-12-16 (gregorian).

Genocidal Pakistan Islamic Republic army (93,000 - mostly eastern command soldiers) surrendered to Indian forces at DhAka.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Ä)

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-A·π£·π≠amƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 06:37‚Üí15:55

16 ghatikas on either side of the transition of the Sun are sacred for various observances. In addition to specific pu·πáyakƒÅlas like ·π£a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti, vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ etc., this is also useful, especially in cases where the other pu·πáyakƒÅlas are inconvenient for appropriate performance of rituals such as snƒÅna, dƒÅna, tarpa·πáa, etc.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 06:37‚Üí12:15

When the transit of the Sun (sa·πÖkrƒÅnti) happens in the first half of the day (p≈´rvƒÅh·πáa) or after midnight of the previous day, the first half of the day is a pu·πáyakƒÅla for various observances. In addition to 16 ghatikas on either side of the transition, and specific pu·πáyakƒÅlas like ·π£a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti, vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ etc., this is also useful, especially in cases where the other pu·πáyakƒÅlas are inconvenient for appropriate performance of rituals such as snƒÅna, dƒÅna, tarpa·πáa, etc.

  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals

2022-12-17

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-24 , ‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-02üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-26üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-26, Islamic: 1444-05-23 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§®‡§µ‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫27:41*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§´‡§≤‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‚ñ∫09:15; ‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫ (‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‚ñ∫07:29; ‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫15:28; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫27:41*; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-55.99¬∞ ‚Üí -55.05¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-167.83¬∞ ‚Üí -166.48¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-19.34¬∞ ‚Üí -19.60¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-94.66¬∞ ‚Üí -93.72¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-13.59¬∞ ‚Üí -13.82¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:38-12:15üåûÔ∏è-17:52üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî12:56; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî01:25*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:38-08:02; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:27-10:51; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:15-13:39; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:04-16:28; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:52-19:28
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:38-07:23; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:23-08:08; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:38-10:23; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:53-12:38; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:07-14:52; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:22-17:07; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:07-17:52
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:56-05:47; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:59-01:32
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:27-10:51; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî13:39-15:04; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî06:38-08:02
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:38); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§¨‡•Å‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§≤-‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶-‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ-‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É #‡•®‡•¨‡•®, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø-‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•Ø‡•™
‡§¨‡•Å‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§≤-‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶-‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ-‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É #‡•®‡•¨‡•®

Event occured on 1760-12-17 (gregorian).

On this day, govinda-pant bundele with 500 men, on a foraging mission in the antarvedI, was surprised by an Afghan force near Meerut and killed. He was always known to be the greatest ‚ÄòFund raiser‚Äô of the Maratha Empire.

Context

The marATha-s were trapped in pAnIpat, encircled by afghans and allies after they crossed the yamunA.

Aftermath

This was followed by the loss of a contingent of 2,000 Maratha soldiers who had left Delhi to deliver money and rations to Panipat.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç

Shannavati Shraddham Day.

  • Tags: ShannavatiTarpanaDays
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø-‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø-‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•Ø‡•™

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Navamƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 5030 (Kali era).

‡§ï‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•Å‡§£‡§æ‡§ö‡§≤‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-25 , ‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ-‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Éüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-03üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-27üåûü™ê , ‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-27, Islamic: 1444-05-24 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ä‚ñ∫27:32*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫10:16; ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∏‡•å‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‚ñ∫06:43; ‡§∂‡•ã‡§≠‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫29:19*; ‡§Ö‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫15:43; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫27:32*; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-13.82¬∞ ‚Üí -14.06¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-55.05¬∞ ‚Üí -54.12¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-166.48¬∞ ‚Üí -165.14¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-93.72¬∞ ‚Üí -92.78¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-19.60¬∞ ‚Üí -19.81¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:39-12:16üåûÔ∏è-17:53üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî13:36; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî02:16*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:39-08:03; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:27-10:51; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:16-13:40; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:04-16:28; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:53-19:28
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:39-07:23; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:23-08:08; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:38-10:23; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:53-12:38; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:08-14:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:23-17:08; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:08-17:53
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:56-05:47; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî22:59-01:33
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî16:28-17:53; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî12:16-13:40; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:04-16:28
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:08); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É, ‡§§‡•à‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§®‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•¨‡•®‡•™
‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
  • ‚Üí10:16

When Hasta nakshatra falls on a Sunday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. When Rohini nakshatra falls on a Saturday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays
‡§§‡•à‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§®‡§ø-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•¨‡•®‡•™

Event occured on 1398-12-18 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

On this day, Taimur massacred about 100k Hindus in Loni which stood in the NE of Delhi.

Events (via MT)

On December 10th he proceed to attack the Loni that stood the north-east of Delhi, the Hindu defenders shaken by the loss of their chief failed to put an effective fight and were trashed by the Timurid army. Timur seized about 100,000 Hindus after the battle by encircling them in a crescent-like movement, even as their mass hunting expeditions on the steppe. He ordered his men to slaughter each one of them right away. He proudly describes how a Mullah who had not even killed a sparrow in the past now slew several Hindus with great enthusiasm.

Context

Timur was on his way to wrest Delhi and India from the Tughlaqs, who had weakened.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-12-19

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-26 , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-04üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-28üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-28, Islamic: 1444-05-25 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π

  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫26:32*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‚ñ∫10:28; ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫ (‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫27:16*; ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫15:08; ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫26:32*; ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§®‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-54.12¬∞ ‚Üí -53.19¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-14.06¬∞ ‚Üí -14.29¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-165.14¬∞ ‚Üí -163.80¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-92.78¬∞ ‚Üí -91.85¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-19.81¬∞ ‚Üí -19.96¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:39-12:16üåûÔ∏è-17:53üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî14:19; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî03:11*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:39-08:03; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:28-10:52; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:16-13:40; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:05-16:29; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:53-19:29
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:39-07:24; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:24-08:09; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:39-10:24; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:54-12:39; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:08-14:53; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:23-17:08; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:08-17:53
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:57-05:48; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:00-01:33
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî08:03-09:28; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî10:52-12:16; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:40-15:05
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:39); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§æ-‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§É #‡•¨‡•ß, ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•Ø‡•´, ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§∏‡§´‡§≤‡§æ-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä
‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§æ-‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§É #‡•¨‡•ß

Event occured on 1961-12-19 (gregorian).

Goa, much traumatized by missionaries (including the evil Jesuit Francis Xavier), inquisition and racist misrule, finally freed from Portuguese.

‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•Ø‡•´

Event occured on 1927-12-19 (gregorian).

On this day, the Arya-samAjist paNDit rAma-prasAd bismil, a fine revolutionary and urdu/ Hindi poet was murdered by British in retaliation for the Kakori heist; as was his protege Ashfaqullah Khan.

sarfaroshƒ´ kƒ´ tamannƒÅ ab hamƒÅre dil me√± hai
dekhnƒÅ hai zor kitnƒÅ bƒÅz≈´-e-qƒÅtil me√± hai

‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§∏‡§´‡§≤‡§æ-‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä

The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of mƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a month is known as saphalƒÅ-ƒìkƒÅda≈õƒ´.

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§ö ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ø‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§É‡•§
‡§è‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•Å‡§≠‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡§™‡§ø‡••

‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•§
‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ï‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§∂‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§≠‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡••
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§¶‡§•‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ω‡§Ω‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§∞‡•á ‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡§µ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡•§

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-27 , ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§æ-‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•Äüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-05üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-29üåûü™ê , ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-29, Islamic: 1444-05-26 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫24:45*; ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä‚ñ∫09:52; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‚ñ∫24:36*; ‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫13:45; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫24:45*; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-19.96¬∞ ‚Üí -20.06¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-53.19¬∞ ‚Üí -52.26¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-163.80¬∞ ‚Üí -162.48¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-14.29¬∞ ‚Üí -14.53¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-91.85¬∞ ‚Üí -90.91¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:40-12:17üåûÔ∏è-17:54üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî15:06; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî04:10*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:40-08:04; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:28-10:52; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:41; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:05-16:29; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:54-19:29
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:40-07:25; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:25-08:09; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:39-10:24; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:54-12:39; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:09-14:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:24-17:09; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:09-17:54
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:57-05:48; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:00-01:34
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî15:05-16:29; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî09:28-10:52; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:41
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:09); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•¨‡•Æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•á‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•≠ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•®‡•Ø, ‡§ñ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§®‡§æ-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•≠‡•©, ‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶-‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§§-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•®‡•¨‡•®, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§©‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§± ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•ß‡•ß) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§É
‡§ó‡•ã‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§¶-‡§™‡§®‡•ç‡§§-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•®‡•¨‡•®

Event occured on 1760-12-20 (gregorian).

On this day, in the lead up to Panipat, the Marathas suffer a major setback as their veteran revenue collector Govind Pant, who was in charge of an extremely critical & strategic role, is killed in an overwhelming attack led by Atai Khan, the Durrani Wazir’s nephew.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§É
  • ‚Üí08:10

The first quarter of dvƒÅda≈õƒ´ tithi is not suitable for breaking fast (pƒÅra·πáa), and is known as harivƒÅsara·∏•. Break fast once harivƒÅsara·∏• is over.

‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§É ‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡•ã ‡§π‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§Æ‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡§É‡••

‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§®-‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§É)—
‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§ï‡•á‡§∂‡§µ‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•Ä‡§¶ ‡§∏‡•Å‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§• ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡••

‡§µ‡•à‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•á ‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á—
‡§Ö‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡•Å‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§´‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§ó‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§
‡§Ü‡§Æ‡§≤‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É ‡§´‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∂‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyVratam EkadashiVratam
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•¨‡•Æ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•á‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•≠ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•®‡•Ø

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-DvƒÅda≈õƒ´ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 5095 (Kali era).

‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§∑‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ã ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É‡•§
‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡•á‡§Ω‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§ß‡§æ‡§Æ‡§®‡§ø‡••‡•®‡•´‡••
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•ã‡§®‡•á ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§æ‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§ï‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ó‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡§≤‡•å‡•§
‡§ú‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ï‡•á‡••‡•®‡•¨‡••
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡•á‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§
‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§∏‡•Å‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§™‡§∏‡§É ‡§´‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•®‡•≠‡••
‡§∞‡•Å‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ω‡§™‡§π‡•É‡§§‡§¶‡•á‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•á ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡§Ø‡•ã‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§¶‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∏ ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Ç‡§®‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§∂‡•á‡••‡•®‡•Æ‡••
‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•á‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§§‡§ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§¨‡§ø‡§≠‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç ‡§∏ ‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•Ä‡•§
‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§∞‡§§‡•ç ‡§™‡§¶‡§æ‡••‡•®‡•Ø‡••
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•à‡§µ‡§§‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö‡§æ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§ú‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§§‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§Æ‡•ç‡••‡•©‡•¶‡••
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•á‡§π‡§ï‡•à‡§µ‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§™‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§®‡•Ä‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡§É‡•§
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•á ‡§∏ ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§ï‡•á‡••‡•©‡•ß‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

Details
  • References
    • Punya Shloka Manjari
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: KanchiAradhanaDays CommonFestivals
‡§ñ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§®‡§æ-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•≠‡•©

Event occured on 1949-12-20 (gregorian).

The District Superintendent of Police arrived in Kalshira (in Khulna) accompanied by armed police contingent and the paramilitary Ansars and attacked Kalshira and other neighbouring Hindu villages mercilessly. They encouraged Muslims from neighbouring villages to loot the Hindu properties. A number of Hindus were killed, men and women were forcibly converted. Images were broken and shrines were desecrated. All the 350 homesteads in the village, except three, were demolished. The cattle and boats were forcibly taken away. Within a month of the massacre 30,000 Hindus fled from Khulna to India.

Context: The previous day, four police constables raided the house of one Joydev Brahma in the village of Kalshira under Mollahat police station in Bagerhat sub-division in the district of Khulna, in search of some suspected communists, late in the night. Failed to find any suspects the constables tried to rape the wife of Brahma. Her cry alerted him and his companions, who in a desperate bid to save her attacked two constables, one of whom died on the spot. The remaining two raised an alarm and the neighbouring people came to their rescue.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§©‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§± ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•ß‡•ß) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on SvƒÅtƒ´ nakshatra of Dhanu·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: NayanarGurupujai

2022-12-21

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-28 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-06üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§É-09-30üåûü™ê , ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-09-30, Islamic: 1444-05-27 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π

  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§ñ‡§æ‚ñ∫08:31; ‡§Ö‡§®‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ‚ñ∫30:31*; ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ß‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫21:21; ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫11:35; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫22:16; ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫

  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-20.06¬∞ ‚Üí -20.07¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-162.48¬∞ ‚Üí -161.17¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-52.26¬∞ ‚Üí -51.33¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-14.53¬∞ ‚Üí -14.77¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-90.91¬∞ ‚Üí -89.99¬∞)

  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:40-08:04; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:29-10:53; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:17-13:41; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:06-16:30; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:54-19:30
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:40-07:25; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:25-08:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:40-10:25; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:55-12:40; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:09-14:54; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:24-17:09; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:09-17:54
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:58-05:49; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:01-01:34

  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§â‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫12:40); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Ä‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ö‡•á‡§≤-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä), ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É, ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ã ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§æ‡§§‡§ø #‡•©‡•©‡•Ø, ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É/‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ-‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É
  • 08:31‚Üí

When an≈´rƒÅdhƒÅ nakshatra falls on a Wednesday, it is a special y≈çga·∏• for performing dƒÅnam. One can do dƒÅna·πÅ of dadhy≈çdanam in Vishnu temples on this day. When Rohini nakshatra falls on a Saturday, it is a special y≈çga·∏•. In the cyclic rotation of time, along with the bad combinations of grahas and nakshatras that indicate the probability of upcoming difficulties, good combinations that grant benefits in multiples also arise. Among such good combinations are the Amrita Siddhi yogas of certain weekdays and nakshatras. They are Sunday-Hasta, Monday-Mrigashirsha, Tuesday-Ashvini, Wednesday-Anuradha, Thursday-Pushya, Friday-Revati, Saturday-Rohini. Good deeds performed on such yogas become especially strong in protecting and nourishing us. For instance, in Devi Atharvashirsha, it is said bhaumƒÅ≈õvinyƒÅ·πÅ mahƒÅdevƒ´-sannidhau japtvƒÅ mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu·πÅ tarati, that is, one can cross even mahƒÅmrÃ•tyu by doing parayanam when Tuesday and Ashvini join.

‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•á ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§æ ‡§∂‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•§
‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ö ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•É‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•á‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§≠‡•å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§É‡••

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations AmritaSiddhiYogaDays
‡§ï‡•Å‡§ö‡•á‡§≤-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

Celebrated especially in Kerala/Guruvayur. Commemorates the incident of Kuchela visiting Lord Krishna. Offer naivedyam of prÃ•thukam.

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Caturda≈õƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (Ni≈õƒ´tha·∏•/paraviddha).

Monthly Shivaratri day.

‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä)

Observed on KrÃ•·π£·πáa-Caturda≈õƒ´ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑-‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç
  • 17:54‚Üí19:30

Pradosha Vratam. Fast during the day and perform ≈õivap≈´jƒÅ in Pradosha Kala.

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ã‡§∑‡•á ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§æ‡§É‡•§
‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡•ç ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§∂‡§§‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡§ø‡••

  • Tags: MonthlyVratam PradoshaVratam
‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É/‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • 03:18‚Üí

Beginning of sahasya-mƒÅsa·∏•, marked by the transit of Sun into makara-rƒÅshƒ´. Importantly, this also marks the beginning of uttarƒÅya·πáam, and the end of dak·π£i·πáƒÅyanam. This also marks the winter solstice. While nirayana sa·πÖkrƒÅnti’s are widely observed, tropical sa·πÖkrƒÅnti’s are also equally sacred, and have similar pu·πáyakƒÅlas associated with them.

‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§™‡§É‚Äî
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§π‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
—‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ü‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ï-‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§É

‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡§µ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§®‡§≠‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§®‡§≠‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‚Äå‡§∑‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§á‡§∑‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡§æ‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§∏‡§π‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§π‡•à‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
‡§§‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§§‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∂‡•à‡§∂‡§ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•Ç
—‡§§‡•à‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø-‡§∏‡§Ç‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡•™-‡•™-‡•ß‡•ß

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ã ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§æ‡§§‡§ø #‡•©‡•©‡•Ø

Event occured on 1683-12-21 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

Sambhaji’s army attacked Salsette and Bardez. Sambhaji had 6 thousand cavalry and 8-10 thousand infantry with him. Marathas plundered Bardesh and town of Madgaon. After having captured Salsette and Bardesh (Bardez) the Marathas were exerting to take the island of Goa as well. French factor of Surat Francois Martin has described the poor condition of the Portuguese, he said the viceroy was completely dependent on Mughal aid now.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-12-22

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-29 , ‡§µ‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§É-‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-07üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É-10-01üåûü™ê , ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-10-01, Islamic: 1444-05-28 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§£-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§∂‡•Ä‚ñ∫19:13; ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‚ñ∫28:00*; ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫17:39; ‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫08:48; ‡§∂‡§ï‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫19:13; ‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‚ñ∫29:32*; ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-14.77¬∞ ‚Üí -15.00¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-20.07¬∞ ‚Üí -20.01¬∞), ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-89.99¬∞ ‚Üí -89.06¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-51.33¬∞ ‚Üí -50.40¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-161.17¬∞ ‚Üí -159.87¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:41-12:18üåûÔ∏è-17:55üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî16:57; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:17*
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:41-08:05; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:29-10:53; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:42; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:06-16:30; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:55-19:30
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:41-07:26; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:26-08:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:40-10:25; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:55-12:40; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:10-14:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:25-17:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:10-17:55
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:58-05:49; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:01-01:34
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî13:42-15:06; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî06:41-08:05; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî09:29-10:53
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ (‚ñ∫14:10); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§§‡•à‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • (‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®) ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É, ‡§ï‡§Æ‡§≤‡§æ-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä, ‡§ó‡§£‡§ø‡§§‡§ú‡•ç‡§û-‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§ú-‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ #‡•ß‡•©‡•´, ‡§§‡•ä‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§∞‡§°‡§ø‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡•ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¥‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç ‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ), ‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ, ‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
(‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®) ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 06:41‚Üí11:18

UttarƒÅya·πáa Punyakala.

‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π ‡§∂‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡§™‡§É‚Äî
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§® ‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡§É‡•§
‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Ä ‡§ö ‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡••
‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§π‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§µ‡•à‡§É‡•§
‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§É ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡••
(‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§´‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ü‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ï-‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡•á-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§É)

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ
‡§ó‡§£‡§ø‡§§‡§ú‡•ç‡§û-‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§ú-‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ #‡•ß‡•©‡•´

Event occured on 1887-12-22 (gregorian).

The fine autodidact pure math genius rAmAnujan was born by the grace of nAmagiri-amma to shrInivAsa ayyangAr. Under the devI’s inspiration, he made substantial contributions to mathematical analysis, number theory, infinite series, and continued fractions, including solutions to mathematical problems then considered unsolvable. Ramanujan initially developed his own mathematical research in isolation. Finally he succeeded in getting GH Hardy’s attention and patronage. He cried as they cut his shikhA. Used to recite sanskrit conjugations. Died at age 32. As late as 2011 and again in 2012, researchers continued to discover that mere comments in his writings about ‘simple properties’ and ‘similar outputs’ for certain findings were themselves profound and subtle number theory results that remained unsuspected until nearly a century after his death.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§ï‡§Æ‡§≤‡§æ-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (MadhyarƒÅtri·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Goddess Kamala is 10th of the Dasha Maha Vidyas.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Dashamahavidya
‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö-‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ-‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ)

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (ƒÄ≈õvina·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Pancha Parva
‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 06:41‚Üí09:42

16 ghatikas on either side of the transition of the Sun are sacred for various observances. In addition to specific pu·πáyakƒÅlas like ·π£a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti, vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ etc., this is also useful, especially in cases where the other pu·πáyakƒÅlas are inconvenient for appropriate performance of rituals such as snƒÅna, dƒÅna, tarpa·πáa, etc.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§£-‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£-‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É
  • 06:41‚Üí12:18

When the transit of the Sun (sa·πÖkrƒÅnti) happens in the first half of the day (p≈´rvƒÅh·πáa) or after midnight of the previous day, the first half of the day is a pu·πáyakƒÅla for various observances. In addition to 16 ghatikas on either side of the transition, and specific pu·πáyakƒÅlas like ·π£a·∏ça≈õƒ´ti, vi·π£·πáupadƒ´ etc., this is also useful, especially in cases where the other pu·πáyakƒÅlas are inconvenient for appropriate performance of rituals such as snƒÅna, dƒÅna, tarpa·πáa, etc.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: SunSankranti CommonFestivals
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É
  • 15:10‚Üí

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 180, it is sƒÅyana-vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: Combinations
‡§§‡•ä‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§∞‡§°‡§ø‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡•ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¥‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç ‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•Å‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on Jyƒì·π£·π≠hƒÅ nakshatra of Dhanu·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MahapurushaEvents AzhwarJayanti
‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§æ‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§É

Observed on day 1 of Sahasya·∏• (tropical) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

Winter solstice.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags:

2022-12-23

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É-09-30 , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-08üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É-10-02üåûü™ê , ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-10-02, Islamic: 1444-05-29 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫15:46; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫25:11*; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§ó‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§É‚ñ∫13:37; ‡§µ‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‚ñ∫15:46; ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚ñ∫25:57*; ‡§¨‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ- ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ-‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø‡§É‚Äî‡§µ‡•É‡§∑‡§≠‡§É
  • üåû-ü™ê ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§¢‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§É - ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§É (-89.06¬∞ ‚Üí -88.14¬∞), ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§É (-15.00¬∞ ‚Üí -15.24¬∞), ‡§∂‡§®‡•à‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§É (-50.40¬∞ ‚Üí -49.47¬∞), ‡§Æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§≤‡§É (-159.87¬∞ ‚Üí -158.58¬∞), ‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡§É (-20.01¬∞ ‚Üí -19.84¬∞)

‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§É

  • üåÖ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî06:41-12:18üåûÔ∏è-17:55üåá
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî18:01; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî—
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:41-08:05; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:30-10:54; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:18-13:42; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:07-16:31; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:55-19:31
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:41-07:26; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:26-08:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:41-10:26; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:56-12:41; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:10-14:55; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:25-17:10; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:10-17:55
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:59-05:50; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:02-01:35
  • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî10:54-12:18; ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‚Äî15:07-16:31; ‡§ó‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É‚Äî08:05-09:30
  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫11:11); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§ó‡•Å‡§°‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•ß‡•™ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•≠‡•¶‡•¨, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•©‡•™ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•á‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•® ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•©‡•ß‡•©, ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§™‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É-‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§É, ‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É, ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ, ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•Å-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡§É #‡•©‡•™‡•™, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶-‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ #‡•Ø‡•¨, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§π‡§®‡•Ç‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç-‡§ú‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§É
‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§ï‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®-‡§á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É

i·π£·π≠i·∏• is performed on this day by those following the b≈çdhƒÅyana/kƒÅtyƒÅyana s≈´tras. This difference happens because chandradar≈õanam occurs tomorrow, and followers of b≈çdhƒÅyana/kƒÅtyƒÅyana s≈´tras do not perform i·π£·π≠i·∏• on chandradar≈õanam day.

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: RareDays Combinations SpecialVratam
‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•ß‡•™ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•≠‡•¶‡•¨

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3418 (Kali era).

Having entered the peak named Agastya after established Ga·πÖgƒÅdharagƒ´·π£pati in the ƒÅcƒÅrya Pƒ´·π≠ha and after subduing the Ugrabhairava through mantra, He stayed there itself. Son of ≈örƒ´ Boppanna, known as ≈örƒ´ NƒÅyana earlier, that VidyƒÅghana having got initiation from Saccidghana, endowed with enormous occult powers, having adorned the principal seat of KƒÅmako·π≠i for forty-five years, He merged (in Self) on the new moon day of the month of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a in the year DhƒÅtu of ≈öƒÅlivƒÅhana era 239.

‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ó‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§æ‡§ß‡§∞‡§ó‡•Ä‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡§¶‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•Ç‡§ü‡§Ç ‡§§‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§ó‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡§ø‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ü‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§§ ‡§â‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§≠‡•à‡§∞‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§®‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§§‡§§ ‡§è‡§µ ‡§ï‡•¢‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡••‡•®‡•Æ‡••
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§¨‡§æ‡§™‡§£‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡§®‡§Ø‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡§æ
‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§É ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§â‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§µ‡§É ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ò‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§
‡§Ü‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ï‡•ã‡§ü‡§ø ‡§∏ ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç (‡•™‡•´) ‡§Ö‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§ó‡•á‡§Ω‡§ó‡§æ‡§≤‡•ç‡§≤‡§Ø‡§Ç
‡§ß‡§æ‡§§‡•å ‡§∂‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§£‡•Ä‡§∂‡§ø‡§ñ‡•Ä‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£(‡•®‡•©‡•Ø)-‡§∏‡§π‡•á ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á ‡§ö ‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§®‡§É‡••‡•®‡•Ø‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

‡§ï‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡•©‡•™ ‡§ú‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•á‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä ‡•® ‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§æ #‡•ß‡•©‡•ß‡•©

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a·∏• (lunar) month (AparƒÅh·πáa·∏•/vyaapti). The event occurred in 3811 (Kali era).

The preceptor, son of MahƒÅdeva, who lived on the banks of river Vegavati, known by Lord ≈öiva‚Äôs name, who entered into the dense forest fire to save the child, wandered through out the earth by the directions of his master and adorning the Pƒ´·π≠ha and made the four castes to adhere to their respective paths. The pleasing, elegant and enduring preceptor Sri Chandra≈õekarendra also having remained in his ma·π≠ha for eighteen years disappeared on the new moon day of the month of MƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a in the year Saumya. His preceptorship was for eighteen years.

‡§∏‡•Ç‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§ó‡§µ‡§§‡•Ä‡§§‡§ü‡•ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡§µ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§§‡§É
‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§¶‡§µ‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§¶‡§ó‡•ç‡§ß‡§™‡•É‡§•‡•Å‡§ï‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§µ‡§ó‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‡§®‡§≤‡§É‡•§
‡§Ü‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§§‡§É ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§∞‡§®‡•ç ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç-
‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡§•‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§¶‡§ó‡§≤‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•Ä‡§†‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡••‡•¨‡•¨‡••
‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡•á‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ω‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§æ‡§¶‡§∂ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§†‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡•§
‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§∏‡•å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ω‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§ß‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§∏‡§π‡•á‡§Ω‡§§‡§ø‡§∏‡§π‡§®‡§É ‡§∏‡•Å‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®‡•ã ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á‡••‡•¨‡•≠‡••
‚Äî‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§Æ‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡§∞‡•Ä

‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑-‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ

amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ of mƒÅrga≈õƒ´r·π£a lunar month.

  • Tags: AmavasyaDays
‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç

pƒÅrva·πáavratam on the eve of dar≈õa-sthƒÅlƒ´pƒÅka·∏•.

‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§æ ‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É, ‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§Ω‡§≠‡§ø‡§Ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö - ‘‡§Ö‡§•‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£ ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§≤‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•å‡§™‡§µ‡§∏‡§•‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡§™‡§§‡•Ä ‡§≠‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç ‡§è‡§®‡§Ø‡•ã‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç- ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∂‡§≤‡•á‡§®’‡•§

‘‡§Ö‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§ß ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§Ø‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§§‡•å ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§ú‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§®‡•ç-‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡§∞‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§á‡§§‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∏-‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á‡§®‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§ ‡§ú‡•Å‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∏‡•á‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§’

‡§™‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç ‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§É‡•§

‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡§ø ‡§ï‡§ø‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç ‡§µ‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç

“‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§â‡§¶‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Ø‡•á‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ” ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å‡•§

‡§™‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡§ø‡§§‡•É-‡§Ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§É

Pinda Pitru Yajnam is a ≈õrƒÅddham to be done to two sets of Pitru Devatas. It is to be done in one’s Agnihotra Agni or if that is not present then Aupasana Agni. Rice is cooked in a section of the Agni moved to the south-east. From this, even those whose father is living, give ƒÅhuti to the Deva Pitru-s ie s≈çma, yama and agni kavyavƒÅhana. Those whose father is not living should additionally give pi·πá·∏ças to the Manushya Pitru-s also to whom amƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ-≈õrƒÅddham is also performed.

When the sum of the longitudes of the Moon and Sun is 180, it is sƒÅyana-vyatƒ´pƒÅta·∏•, and a y≈çga·∏• that is to be excluded for auspicious activities.

Event occured on 1678-12-23 (gregorian). Julian date was converted to Gregorian in this reckoning.

sAmbhAji fled from parali and joined mogol general dilIr khan. He was greeted with a command position. sambhAjI would escape the next year, disgusted by dilIr khAn’s cruelty and conciliated by shivAjI.

Observed on AmƒÅvƒÅsyƒÅ tithi of Dhanu·∏• (sidereal solar) month (S≈´ry≈çdaya·∏•/puurvaviddha).

  • Indian civil date: 1944-10-03, Islamic: 1444-05-30 JumƒÅdƒÅ al- æAwwal/ æ≈™lƒÅ, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π

  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫22:13; ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫

  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É‚ñ∫09:23; ‡§ß‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫29:06*; ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫

  • üåõ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî07:21; ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§É‚Äî19:07
  • üåû‚öù‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚Äî06:42-08:06; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É‚Äî09:30-10:54; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî12:19-13:43; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É‚Äî15:07-16:31; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É‚Äî17:56-19:31
  • üåû‚öù‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£-‡§Æ‡§§‡•á ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‚Äî ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞1‚Äî06:42-07:26; ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî07:26-08:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§µ‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî09:41-10:26; ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî11:56-12:41; ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî14:11-14:56; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞2‚Äî16:26-17:11; ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§®‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Å‡•∞3‚Äî17:11-17:56
  • üåû‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî04:59-05:50; ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§É‚Äî23:02-01:35

  • ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‚Äî‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•Ä (‚ñ∫09:41); ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‚Äì‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø

‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§É

  • ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞-‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§ö‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•©‡•©) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂-‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§É, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§É, ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§™‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç, ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•ß‡•®‡•©, ‡§π‡•ã‡§≤‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§ò‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü-‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É #‡•®‡•ß‡•Æ
‡§ö‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§©‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç (‡•©‡•©) ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡•à

Observed on P≈´rvƒÅ·π£ƒÅ·∏çhƒÅ nakshatra of Dhanu·∏• (sidereal solar) month (PrƒÅta·∏•/paraviddha).

Have darshan of Moon today, chanting the following shloka

‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∑‡§£‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö
‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§§‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ß‡§∞‡•ã ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§¨‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§É‡•§

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyFestivals
‡§π‡•ã‡§≤‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞-‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§ò‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü-‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§É #‡•®‡•ß‡•Æ

Event occured on 1804-12-24 (gregorian).

Shortly after bAjI rAv 2’s surrender to the British, and the British victory over shiNDe forces; yashvantrAv holkar separately (re)started his fight but settled for a treaty with the British.

He was initially successful, but was chased and defeated by General Lake - more by diplomacy than battle. The jAT rAjA raNajIt singh briefly helped, but defected when pressed. daulatrAv shiNDe joined briefly but was soon bought off. Other such as raNajIt singh of panjAb, hill chiefs, even the afhAn shAh etc.. all backed off and stayed away.

He would write two years later to vyankojI bhosle: " I paid a visit to Daulatrao and explained to him how important it was for all of us to join to avert foreign domination. Daulatrao failed me. It was cooperation and good will which had built the Maratha state. But now, we have all become self seekers. You also did not make your promise good. It is no use now talking of past things. When I found myself abandoned on all sides, I accepted the offer the British agents brought to me and concluded the war.”

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§°-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§§‡§ú‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®-‡§Ø‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç #‡•ß‡•®‡•©

Event occured on 1899-12-24 (gregorian).

On Christmas eve of 1899, acting on a carefully laid plan, Mundas, led by the anti-British and anti-Missionary apostate Birsa, attacked police stations and shot arrows into churches in many parts of the districts of Ranchi and Singhbhum. Savada Mission Hata, Muru Mission Hata, Borjo Mission hata were attacked.

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags:
‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§™‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha).

‘‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§£‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§â‡§™‡•ã‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§â‡§¶‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡•É‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Ø‡•á‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ ' ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ç ‡§Ü‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•Å‡•§

Details
  • Edit config file
  • Tags: MonthlyFestivals
‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂-‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§≤‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§É

Observed on ≈öukla-PrathamƒÅ tithi of every (lunar) month (P≈´rvƒÅh·πáa·∏•/puurvaviddha). sthƒÅlƒ´paka·∏• is an important fortnightly ritual, involving the offering of havi·π£yƒÅnna to agni, with the offering being cooked on the fire itself.

  • Tags: MonthlyFestivals

2022-12-25

‡§™‡•å‡§∑‡§É-10-02 , ‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É-‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-10üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É-10-04üåûü™ê , ‡§≠‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-10-04, Islamic: 1444-06-01 JumƒÅdƒÅ ath-ThƒÅniyah/ al- æƒÄkhirah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π
  • ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§∞‡§É - ‡§∂‡•Å‡§≠‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç
  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
  • ü™êüåû‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç
  • üåõ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§π‡•á‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ã‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§™‡•å‡§∑‡§É

‡§ñ‡§ö‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡§É

  • |üåû-üåõ|‡§§‡§ø‡§•‡§ø‡§É ‚Äî ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫08:24; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‚ñ∫28:51*; ‡§∂‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§≤-‡§ö‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•Ä‚ñ∫
  • üååüåõ‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡§æ‡§¢‡§æ‚ñ∫19:19; ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫ (‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É)
  • üååüåû‡§∏‡•å‡§∞-‡§®‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ‚ñ∫
    • ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∂‡§ø-‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§É ‚Äî ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‚ñ∫
  • üåõ+üåû‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É ‚Äî ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§É‚ñ∫24:55*; ‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§£‡§É‚ñ∫
  • ‡•®|üåõ-üåû|‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡•ç ‚Äî ‡§ï‡•å‡§≤‡§µ‡§É‚ñ∫08:24; ‡§§‡•à‡§§‡§ø‡§≤‡§É‚ñ∫18:36; ‡§ó‡§∞‡§É‚ñ∫28:51*; ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ú‡§É‚ñ∫

2022-12-26

‡§™‡•å‡§∑‡§É-10-04 , ‡§Æ‡§ï‡§∞‡§É-‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£‡§Éüåõüåå , ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É-‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§≤‡§æ-09-11üåûüåå , ‡§∏‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É-10-05üåûü™ê , ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Æ‡§É

  • Indian civil date: 1944-10-05, Islamic: 1444-06-02 JumƒÅdƒÅ ath-ThƒÅniyah/ al- æƒÄkhirah, üååüåû: ‡§∏‡§Ç- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å‡§É, ‡§§‡§Ç- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§¥‡§ø, ‡§Æ- ‡§ß‡§®‡•Å, ‡§™- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π, ‡§Ö- ‡§™‡•ã‡§π

  • ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üåõ- ‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 1944, ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§É 2079, ‡§ï‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ó‡•á 5123
